content: 1 These are the words that Moses addressed to all Israel on the other side of the Jordan.—Through the wilderness, in the Arabah near Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab,
content_old: 1 These are the words that Moses addressed to all Israel on the other side of the Jordan.—Through the wilderness, in the Arabah near Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab,

content: 2 it is eleven days from Horeb to Kadesh-barnea by the Mount Seir route.—
content_old: 2 it is eleven days from Horeb to Kadesh-barnea by the Mount Seir route.—

content: 3 It was in the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, that Moses addressed the Israelites in accordance with the instructions that the LORD had given him for them,
content_old: 3 It was in the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, that Moses addressed the Israelites in accordance with the instructions that the LORD had given him for them,

content: 4 after he had defeated Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, who dwelt at Ashtaroth and Edrei.
content_old: 4 after he had defeated Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, who dwelt at Ashtaroth and Edrei.

content: 5 On the other side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses undertook to expound this Teaching. He said:
content_old: 5 On the other side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses undertook to expound this Teaching. He said:

content: 6 The LORD our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying: You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
content_old: 6 The LORD our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying: You have stayed long enough at this mountain.

content: 7 Start out and make your way to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, the hill country, the Shephelah, the Negeb, the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites, and the Lebanon, as far as the Great River, the river Euphrates.
content_old: 7 Start out and make your way to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, the hill country, the Shephelah, the Negeb, the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites, and the Lebanon, as far as the Great River, the river Euphrates.

content: 8 See, I place the land at your disposal. Go, take possession of the land that the LORD swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to them and to their heirs after them.
content_old: 8 See, I place the land at your disposal. Go, take possession of the land that the LORD swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to them and to their heirs after them.

content: 9 Thereupon I said to you, “I cannot bear the burden of you by myself.
content_old: 9 Thereupon I said to you, “I cannot bear the burden of you by myself.

content: 10 The LORD your God has multiplied you until you are today as numerous as the stars in the sky.—
content_old: 10 The LORD your God has multiplied you until you are today as numerous as the stars in the sky.—

content: 11 May the LORD, the God of your fathers, increase your numbers a thousandfold, and bless you as He promised you.—
content_old: 11 May the LORD, the God of your fathers, increase your numbers a thousandfold, and bless you as He promised you.—

content: 12 How can I bear unaided the trouble of you, and the burden, and the bickering!
content_old: 12 How can I bear unaided the trouble of you, and the burden, and the bickering!

content: 13 Pick from each of your tribes men who are wise, discerning, and experienced, and I will appoint them as your heads.”
content_old: 13 Pick from each of your tribes men who are wise, discerning, and experienced, and I will appoint them as your heads.”

content: 14 You answered me and said, “What you propose to do is good.”
content_old: 14 You answered me and said, “What you propose to do is good.”

content: 15 So I took your tribal leaders, wise and experienced men, and appointed them heads over you: chiefs of thousands, chiefs of hundreds, chiefs of fifties, and chiefs of tens, and officials for your tribes.
content_old: 15 So I took your tribal leaders, wise and experienced men, and appointed them heads over you: chiefs of thousands, chiefs of hundreds, chiefs of fifties, and chiefs of tens, and officials for your tribes.

content: 16 I charged your magistrates at that time as follows, “Hear out your fellow men, and decide justly between any man and a fellow Israelite or a stranger.
content_old: 16 I charged your magistrates at that time as follows, “Hear out your fellow men, and decide justly between any man and a fellow Israelite or a stranger.

content: 17 You shall not be partial in judgment: hear out low and high alike. Fear no man, for judgment is God’s. And any matter that is too difficult for you, you shall bring to me and I will hear it.”
content_old: 17 You shall not be partial in judgment: hear out low and high alike. Fear no man, for judgment is God’s. And any matter that is too difficult for you, you shall bring to me and I will hear it.”

content: 18 Thus I instructed you, at that time, about the various things that you should do.
content_old: 18 Thus I instructed you, at that time, about the various things that you should do.

content: 19 We set out from Horeb and traveled the great and terrible wilderness that you saw, along the road to the hill country of the Amorites, as the LORD our God had commanded us. When we reached Kadesh-barnea,
content_old: 19 We set out from Horeb and traveled the great and terrible wilderness that you saw, along the road to the hill country of the Amorites, as the LORD our God had commanded us. When we reached Kadesh-barnea,

content: 20 I said to you, “You have come to the hill country of the Amorites which the LORD our God is giving to us.
content_old: 20 I said to you, “You have come to the hill country of the Amorites which the LORD our God is giving to us.

content: 21 See, the LORD your God has placed the land at your disposal. Go up, take possession, as the LORD, the God of your fathers, promised you. Fear not and be not dismayed.”
content_old: 21 See, the LORD your God has placed the land at your disposal. Go up, take possession, as the LORD, the God of your fathers, promised you. Fear not and be not dismayed.”

content: 22 Then all of you came to me and said, “Let us send men ahead to reconnoiter the land for us and bring back word on the route we shall follow and the cities we shall come to.”
content_old: 22 Then all of you came to me and said, “Let us send men ahead to reconnoiter the land for us and bring back word on the route we shall follow and the cities we shall come to.”

content: 23 I approved of the plan, and so I selected twelve of your men, one from each tribe.
content_old: 23 I approved of the plan, and so I selected twelve of your men, one from each tribe.

content: 24 They made for the hill country, came to the wadi Eshcol, and spied it out.
content_old: 24 They made for the hill country, came to the wadi Eshcol, and spied it out.

content: 25 They took some of the fruit of the land with them and brought it down to us. And they gave us this report: “It is a good land that the LORD our God is giving to us.”
content_old: 25 They took some of the fruit of the land with them and brought it down to us. And they gave us this report: “It is a good land that the LORD our God is giving to us.”

content: 26 Yet you refused to go up, and flouted the command of the LORD your God.
content_old: 26 Yet you refused to go up, and flouted the command of the LORD your God.

content: 27 You sulked in your tents and said, “It is because the LORD hates us that He brought us out of the land of Egypt, to hand us over to the Amorites to wipe us out.
content_old: 27 You sulked in your tents and said, “It is because the LORD hates us that He brought us out of the land of Egypt, to hand us over to the Amorites to wipe us out.

content: 28 What kind of place are we going to? Our kinsmen have taken the heart out of us, saying, ‘We saw there a people stronger and taller than we, large cities with walls sky-high, and even Anakites.’ ”
content_old: 28 What kind of place are we going to? Our kinsmen have taken the heart out of us, saying, ‘We saw there a people stronger and taller than we, large cities with walls sky-high, and even Anakites.’ ”

content: 29 I said to you, “Have no dread or fear of them.
content_old: 29 I said to you, “Have no dread or fear of them.

content: 30 None other than the LORD your God, who goes before you, will fight for you, just as He did for you in Egypt before your very eyes,
content_old: 30 None other than the LORD your God, who goes before you, will fight for you, just as He did for you in Egypt before your very eyes,

content: 31 and in the wilderness, where you saw how the LORD your God carried you, as a man carries his son, all the way that you traveled until you came to this place.
content_old: 31 and in the wilderness, where you saw how the LORD your God carried you, as a man carries his son, all the way that you traveled until you came to this place.

content: 32 Yet for all that, you have no faith in the LORD your God,
content_old: 32 Yet for all that, you have no faith in the LORD your God,

content: 33 who goes before you on your journeys—to scout the place where you are to encamp—in fire by night and in cloud by day, in order to guide you on the route you are to follow.”
content_old: 33 who goes before you on your journeys—to scout the place where you are to encamp—in fire by night and in cloud by day, in order to guide you on the route you are to follow.”

content: 34 When the LORD heard your loud complaint, He was angry. He vowed:
content_old: 34 When the LORD heard your loud complaint, He was angry. He vowed:

content: 35 Not one of these men, this evil generation, shall see the good land that I swore to give to your fathers—
content_old: 35 Not one of these men, this evil generation, shall see the good land that I swore to give to your fathers—

content: 36 none except Caleb son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him and his descendants will I give the land on which he set foot, because he remained loyal to the LORD.
content_old: 36 none except Caleb son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him and his descendants will I give the land on which he set foot, because he remained loyal to the LORD.

content: 37 Because of you the LORD was incensed with me too, and He said: You shall not enter it either.
content_old: 37 Because of you the LORD was incensed with me too, and He said: You shall not enter it either.

content: 38 Joshua son of Nun, who attends you, he shall enter it. Imbue him with strength, for he shall allot it to Israel.
content_old: 38 Joshua son of Nun, who attends you, he shall enter it. Imbue him with strength, for he shall allot it to Israel.

content: 39 Moreover, your little ones who you said would be carried off, your children who do not yet know good from bad, they shall enter it; to them will I give it and they shall possess it.
content_old: 39 Moreover, your little ones who you said would be carried off, your children who do not yet know good from bad, they shall enter it; to them will I give it and they shall possess it.

content: 40 As for you, turn about and march into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds.
content_old: 40 As for you, turn about and march into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds.

content: 41 You replied to me, saying, “We stand guilty before the LORD. We will go up now and fight, just as the LORD our God commanded us.” And you all girded yourselves with war gear and recklessly started for the hill country.
content_old: 41 You replied to me, saying, “We stand guilty before the LORD. We will go up now and fight, just as the LORD our God commanded us.” And you all girded yourselves with war gear and recklessly started for the hill country.

content: 42 But the LORD said to me, “Warn them: Do not go up and do not fight, since I am not in your midst; else you will be routed by your enemies.”
content_old: 42 But the LORD said to me, “Warn them: Do not go up and do not fight, since I am not in your midst; else you will be routed by your enemies.”

content: 43 I spoke to you, but you would not listen; you flouted the LORD‘s command and willfully marched into the hill country.
content_old: 43 I spoke to you, but you would not listen; you flouted the LORD‘s command and willfully marched into the hill country.

content: 44 Then the Amorites who lived in those hills came out against you like so many bees and chased you, and they crushed you at Hormah in Seir.
content_old: 44 Then the Amorites who lived in those hills came out against you like so many bees and chased you, and they crushed you at Hormah in Seir.

content: 45 Again you wept before the LORD; but the LORD would not heed your cry or give ear to you.
content_old: 45 Again you wept before the LORD; but the LORD would not heed your cry or give ear to you.

content: 1 we marched back into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds, as the LORD had spoken to me, and skirted the hill country of Seir a long time.
content_old: 1 we marched back into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds, as the LORD had spoken to me, and skirted the hill country of Seir a long time.

content: 2 Then the LORD said to me:
content_old: 2 Then the LORD said to me:

content: 3 You have been skirting this hill country long enough; now turn north.
content_old: 3 You have been skirting this hill country long enough; now turn north.

content: 4 And charge the people as follows: You will be passing through the territory of your kinsmen, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. Though they will be afraid of you, be very careful
content_old: 4 And charge the people as follows: You will be passing through the territory of your kinsmen, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. Though they will be afraid of you, be very careful

content: 5 not to provoke them. For I will not give you of their land so much as a foot can tread on; I have given the hill country of Seir as a possession to Esau.
content_old: 5 not to provoke them. For I will not give you of their land so much as a foot can tread on; I have given the hill country of Seir as a possession to Esau.

content: 6 What food you eat you shall obtain from them for money; even the water you drink you shall procure from them for money.
content_old: 6 What food you eat you shall obtain from them for money; even the water you drink you shall procure from them for money.

content: 7 Indeed, the LORD your God has blessed you in all your undertakings. He has watched over your wanderings through this great wilderness; the LORD your God has been with you these past forty years: you have lacked nothing.
content_old: 7 Indeed, the LORD your God has blessed you in all your undertakings. He has watched over your wanderings through this great wilderness; the LORD your God has been with you these past forty years: you have lacked nothing.

content: 8 We then moved on, away from our kinsmen, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, away from the road of the Arabah, away from Elath and Ezion-geber; and we marched on in the direction of the wilderness of Moab.
content_old: 8 We then moved on, away from our kinsmen, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, away from the road of the Arabah, away from Elath and Ezion-geber; and we marched on in the direction of the wilderness of Moab.

content: 9 And the LORD said to me: Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war. For I will not give you any of their land as a possession; I have assigned Ar as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—
content_old: 9 And the LORD said to me: Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war. For I will not give you any of their land as a possession; I have assigned Ar as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—

content: 10 It was formerly inhabited by the Emim, a people great and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites.
content_old: 10 It was formerly inhabited by the Emim, a people great and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites.

content: 11 Like the Anakites, they are counted as Rephaim; but the Moabites call them Emim.
content_old: 11 Like the Anakites, they are counted as Rephaim; but the Moabites call them Emim.

content: 12 Similarly, Seir was formerly inhabited by the Horites; but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them, wiping them out and settling in their place, just as Israel did in the land they were to possess, which the LORD had given to them.—
content_old: 12 Similarly, Seir was formerly inhabited by the Horites; but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them, wiping them out and settling in their place, just as Israel did in the land they were to possess, which the LORD had given to them.—

content: 13 Up now! Cross the wadi Zered! So we crossed the wadi Zered.
content_old: 13 Up now! Cross the wadi Zered! So we crossed the wadi Zered.

content: 14 The time that we spent in travel from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, until that whole generation of warriors had perished from the camp, as the LORD had sworn concerning them.
content_old: 14 The time that we spent in travel from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, until that whole generation of warriors had perished from the camp, as the LORD had sworn concerning them.

content: 15 Indeed, the hand of the LORD struck them, to root them out from the camp to the last man.
content_old: 15 Indeed, the hand of the LORD struck them, to root them out from the camp to the last man.

content: 16 When all the warriors among the people had died off,
content_old: 16 When all the warriors among the people had died off,

content: 17 the LORD spoke to me, saying:
content_old: 17 the LORD spoke to me, saying:

content: 18 You are now passing through the territory of Moab, through Ar.
content_old: 18 You are now passing through the territory of Moab, through Ar.

content: 19 You will then be close to the Ammonites; do not harass them or start a fight with them. For I will not give any part of the land of the Ammonites to you as a possession; I have assigned it as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—
content_old: 19 You will then be close to the Ammonites; do not harass them or start a fight with them. For I will not give any part of the land of the Ammonites to you as a possession; I have assigned it as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—

content: 20 It, too, is counted as Rephaim country. It was formerly inhabited by Rephaim, whom the Ammonites call Zamzummim,
content_old: 20 It, too, is counted as Rephaim country. It was formerly inhabited by Rephaim, whom the Ammonites call Zamzummim,

content: 21 a people great and numerous and as tall as the Anakites. The LORD wiped them out, so that the Ammonites dispossessed them and settled in their place,
content_old: 21 a people great and numerous and as tall as the Anakites. The LORD wiped them out, so that the Ammonites dispossessed them and settled in their place,

content: 22 as He did for the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, when He wiped out the Horites before them, so that they dispossessed them and settled in their place, as is still the case.
content_old: 22 as He did for the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, when He wiped out the Horites before them, so that they dispossessed them and settled in their place, as is still the case.

content: 23 So, too, with the Avvim who dwelt in villages in the vicinity of Gaza: the Caphtorim, who came from Crete, wiped them out and settled in their place.—
content_old: 23 So, too, with the Avvim who dwelt in villages in the vicinity of Gaza: the Caphtorim, who came from Crete, wiped them out and settled in their place.—

content: 24 Up! Set out across the wadi Arnon! See, I give into your power Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin the occupation: engage him in battle.
content_old: 24 Up! Set out across the wadi Arnon! See, I give into your power Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin the occupation: engage him in battle.

content: 25 This day I begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the peoples everywhere under heaven, so that they shall tremble and quake because of you whenever they hear you mentioned.
content_old: 25 This day I begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the peoples everywhere under heaven, so that they shall tremble and quake because of you whenever they hear you mentioned.

content: 26 Then I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to King Sihon of Heshbon with an offer of peace, as follows,
content_old: 26 Then I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to King Sihon of Heshbon with an offer of peace, as follows,

content: 27 “Let me pass through your country. I will keep strictly to the highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left.
content_old: 27 “Let me pass through your country. I will keep strictly to the highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left.

content: 28 What food I eat you will supply for money, and what water I drink you will furnish for money; just let me pass through—
content_old: 28 What food I eat you will supply for money, and what water I drink you will furnish for money; just let me pass through—

content: 29 as the descendants of Esau who dwell in Seir did for me, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar—that I may cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD our God is giving us.”
content_old: 29 as the descendants of Esau who dwell in Seir did for me, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar—that I may cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD our God is giving us.”

content: 30 But King Sihon of Heshbon refused to let us pass through, because the LORD had stiffened his will and hardened his heart in order to deliver him into your power—as is now the case.
content_old: 30 But King Sihon of Heshbon refused to let us pass through, because the LORD had stiffened his will and hardened his heart in order to deliver him into your power—as is now the case.

content: 31 And the LORD said to me: See, I begin by placing Sihon and his land at your disposal. Begin the occupation; take possession of his land.
content_old: 31 And the LORD said to me: See, I begin by placing Sihon and his land at your disposal. Begin the occupation; take possession of his land.

content: 32 Sihon with all his men took the field against us at Jahaz,
content_old: 32 Sihon with all his men took the field against us at Jahaz,

content: 33 and the LORD our God delivered him to us and we defeated him and his sons and all his men.
content_old: 33 and the LORD our God delivered him to us and we defeated him and his sons and all his men.

content: 34 At that time we captured all his towns, and we doomed every town—men, women, and children—leaving no survivor.
content_old: 34 At that time we captured all his towns, and we doomed every town—men, women, and children—leaving no survivor.

content: 35 We retained as booty only the cattle and the spoil of the cities that we captured.
content_old: 35 We retained as booty only the cattle and the spoil of the cities that we captured.

content: 36 From Aroer on the edge of the Arnon valley, including the town in the valley itself, to Gilead, not a city was too mighty for us; the LORD our God delivered everything to us.
content_old: 36 From Aroer on the edge of the Arnon valley, including the town in the valley itself, to Gilead, not a city was too mighty for us; the LORD our God delivered everything to us.

content: 1 We made our way up the road toward Bashan, and King Og of Bashan with all his men took the field against us at Edrei.
content_old: 1 We made our way up the road toward Bashan, and King Og of Bashan with all his men took the field against us at Edrei.

content: 2 But the LORD said to me: Do not fear him, for I am delivering him and all his men and his country into your power, and you will do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.
content_old: 2 But the LORD said to me: Do not fear him, for I am delivering him and all his men and his country into your power, and you will do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.

content: 3 So the LORD our God also delivered into our power King Og of Bashan, with all his men, and we dealt them such a blow that no survivor was left.
content_old: 3 So the LORD our God also delivered into our power King Og of Bashan, with all his men, and we dealt them such a blow that no survivor was left.

content: 4 At that time we captured all his towns; there was not a town that we did not take from them: sixty towns, the whole district of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan
content_old: 4 At that time we captured all his towns; there was not a town that we did not take from them: sixty towns, the whole district of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan

content: 5 —all those towns were fortified with high walls, gates, and bars—apart from a great number of unwalled towns.
content_old: 5 —all those towns were fortified with high walls, gates, and bars—apart from a great number of unwalled towns.

content: 6 We doomed them as we had done in the case of King Sihon of Heshbon; we doomed every town—men, women, and children—
content_old: 6 We doomed them as we had done in the case of King Sihon of Heshbon; we doomed every town—men, women, and children—

content: 7 and retained as booty all the cattle and the spoil of the towns.
content_old: 7 and retained as booty all the cattle and the spoil of the towns.

content: 8 Thus we seized, at that time, from the two Amorite kings, the country beyond the Jordan, from the wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon—
content_old: 8 Thus we seized, at that time, from the two Amorite kings, the country beyond the Jordan, from the wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon—

content: 9 Sidonians called Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir—
content_old: 9 Sidonians called Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir—

content: 10 all the towns of the Tableland and the whole of Gilead and Bashan as far as Salcah and Edrei, the towns of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.
content_old: 10 all the towns of the Tableland and the whole of Gilead and Bashan as far as Salcah and Edrei, the towns of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.

content: 11 Only King Og of Bashan was left of the remaining Rephaim. His bedstead, an iron bedstead, is now in Rabbah of the Ammonites; it is nine cubits long and four cubits wide, by the standard cubit!
content_old: 11 Only King Og of Bashan was left of the remaining Rephaim. His bedstead, an iron bedstead, is now in Rabbah of the Ammonites; it is nine cubits long and four cubits wide, by the standard cubit!

content: 12 And this is the land which we apportioned at that time: The part from Aroer along the wadi Arnon, with part of the hill country of Gilead and its towns, I assigned to the Reubenites and the Gadites.
content_old: 12 And this is the land which we apportioned at that time: The part from Aroer along the wadi Arnon, with part of the hill country of Gilead and its towns, I assigned to the Reubenites and the Gadites.

content: 13 The rest of Gilead, and all of Bashan under Og’s rule—the whole Argob district, all that part of Bashan which is called Rephaim country—I assigned to the half-tribe of Manasseh.
content_old: 13 The rest of Gilead, and all of Bashan under Og’s rule—the whole Argob district, all that part of Bashan which is called Rephaim country—I assigned to the half-tribe of Manasseh.

content: 14 Jair son of Manasseh received the whole Argob district that is, Bashan as far as the boundary of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and named it after himself. Havvoth-jair—as is still the case.
content_old: 14 Jair son of Manasseh received the whole Argob district that is, Bashan as far as the boundary of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and named it after himself. Havvoth-jair—as is still the case.

content: 15 To Machir I assigned Gilead.
content_old: 15 To Machir I assigned Gilead.

content: 16 And to the Reubenites and the Gadites I assigned the part from Gilead down to the wadi Arnon, the middle of the wadi being the boundary, and up to the wadi Jabbok, the boundary of the Ammonites.
content_old: 16 And to the Reubenites and the Gadites I assigned the part from Gilead down to the wadi Arnon, the middle of the wadi being the boundary, and up to the wadi Jabbok, the boundary of the Ammonites.

content: 17 the Arabah, from the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, to the edge of the Jordan, and from Chinnereth down to the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea.
content_old: 17 the Arabah, from the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, to the edge of the Jordan, and from Chinnereth down to the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea.

content: 18 At that time I charged you, saying, “The LORD your God has given you this country to possess. You must go as shock-troops, warriors all, at the head of your Israelite kinsmen.
content_old: 18 At that time I charged you, saying, “The LORD your God has given you this country to possess. You must go as shock-troops, warriors all, at the head of your Israelite kinsmen.

content: 19 Only your wives, children, and livestock—I know that you have much livestock—shall be left in the towns I have assigned to you,
content_old: 19 Only your wives, children, and livestock—I know that you have much livestock—shall be left in the towns I have assigned to you,

content: 20 until the LORD has granted your kinsmen a haven such as you have, and they too have taken possession of the land that the LORD your God is assigning them, beyond the Jordan. Then you may return each to the homestead that I have assigned to him.”
content_old: 20 until the LORD has granted your kinsmen a haven such as you have, and they too have taken possession of the land that the LORD your God is assigning them, beyond the Jordan. Then you may return each to the homestead that I have assigned to him.”

content: 21 I also charged Joshua at that time, saying, “You have seen with your own eyes all that the LORD your God has done to these two kings; so shall the LORD do to all the kingdoms into which you shall cross over.
content_old: 21 I also charged Joshua at that time, saying, “You have seen with your own eyes all that the LORD your God has done to these two kings; so shall the LORD do to all the kingdoms into which you shall cross over.

content: 22 Do not fear them, for it is the LORD your God who will battle for you.”
content_old: 22 Do not fear them, for it is the LORD your God who will battle for you.”

content: 23 I pleaded with the LORD at that time, saying,
content_old: 23 I pleaded with the LORD at that time, saying,

content: 24 “O Lord GOD, You who let Your servant see the first works of Your greatness and Your mighty hand, You whose powerful deeds no god in heaven or on earth can equal!
content_old: 24 “O Lord GOD, You who let Your servant see the first works of Your greatness and Your mighty hand, You whose powerful deeds no god in heaven or on earth can equal!

content: 25 Let me, I pray, cross over and see the good land on the other side of the Jordan, that good hill country, and the Lebanon.”
content_old: 25 Let me, I pray, cross over and see the good land on the other side of the Jordan, that good hill country, and the Lebanon.”

content: 26 But the LORD was wrathful with me on your account and would not listen to me. The LORD said to me, “Enough! Never speak to Me of this matter again!
content_old: 26 But the LORD was wrathful with me on your account and would not listen to me. The LORD said to me, “Enough! Never speak to Me of this matter again!

content: 27 Go up to the summit of Pisgah and gaze about, to the west, the north, the south, and the east. Look at it well, for you shall not go across yonder Jordan.
content_old: 27 Go up to the summit of Pisgah and gaze about, to the west, the north, the south, and the east. Look at it well, for you shall not go across yonder Jordan.

content: 28 Give Joshua his instructions, and imbue him with strength and courage, for he shall go across at the head of this people, and he shall allot to them the land that you may only see.”
content_old: 28 Give Joshua his instructions, and imbue him with strength and courage, for he shall go across at the head of this people, and he shall allot to them the land that you may only see.”

content: 1 And now, O Israel, give heed to the laws and rules that I am instructing you to observe, so that you may live to enter and occupy the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
content_old: 1 And now, O Israel, give heed to the laws and rules that I am instructing you to observe, so that you may live to enter and occupy the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, is giving you.

content: 2 You shall not add anything to what I command you or take anything away from it, but keep the commandments of the LORD your God that I enjoin upon you.
content_old: 2 You shall not add anything to what I command you or take anything away from it, but keep the commandments of the LORD your God that I enjoin upon you.

content: 3 You saw with your own eyes what the LORD did in the matter of Baal-peor, that the LORD your God wiped out from among you every person who followed Baal-peor;
content_old: 3 You saw with your own eyes what the LORD did in the matter of Baal-peor, that the LORD your God wiped out from among you every person who followed Baal-peor;

content: 4 while you, who held fast to the LORD your God, are all alive today.
content_old: 4 while you, who held fast to the LORD your God, are all alive today.

content: 5 See, I have imparted to you laws and rules, as the LORD my God has commanded me, for you to abide by in the land that you are about to enter and occupy.
content_old: 5 See, I have imparted to you laws and rules, as the LORD my God has commanded me, for you to abide by in the land that you are about to enter and occupy.

content: 6 Observe them faithfully, for that will be proof of your wisdom and discernment to other peoples, who on hearing of all these laws will say, “Surely, that great nation is a wise and discerning people.”
content_old: 6 Observe them faithfully, for that will be proof of your wisdom and discernment to other peoples, who on hearing of all these laws will say, “Surely, that great nation is a wise and discerning people.”

content: 7 For what great nation is there that has a god so close at hand as is the LORD our God whenever we call upon Him?
content_old: 7 For what great nation is there that has a god so close at hand as is the LORD our God whenever we call upon Him?

content: 8 Or what great nation has laws and rules as perfect as all this Teaching that I set before you this day?
content_old: 8 Or what great nation has laws and rules as perfect as all this Teaching that I set before you this day?

content: 9 But take utmost care and watch yourselves scrupulously, so that you do not forget the things that you saw with your own eyes and so that they do not fade from your mind as long as you live. And make them known to your children and to your children’s children:
content_old: 9 But take utmost care and watch yourselves scrupulously, so that you do not forget the things that you saw with your own eyes and so that they do not fade from your mind as long as you live. And make them known to your children and to your children’s children:

content: 10 The day you stood before the LORD your God at Horeb, when the LORD said to Me, “Gather the people to Me that I may let them hear My words, in order that they may learn to revere Me as long as they live on earth, and may so teach their children.”
content_old: 10 The day you stood before the LORD your God at Horeb, when the LORD said to Me, “Gather the people to Me that I may let them hear My words, in order that they may learn to revere Me as long as they live on earth, and may so teach their children.”

content: 11 You came forward and stood at the foot of the mountain. The mountain was ablaze with flames to the very skies, dark with densest clouds.
content_old: 11 You came forward and stood at the foot of the mountain. The mountain was ablaze with flames to the very skies, dark with densest clouds.

content: 12 The LORD spoke to you out of the fire; you heard the sound of words but perceived no shape—nothing but a voice.
content_old: 12 The LORD spoke to you out of the fire; you heard the sound of words but perceived no shape—nothing but a voice.

content: 13 He declared to you the covenant that He commanded you to observe, the Ten Commandments; and He inscribed them on two tablets of stone.
content_old: 13 He declared to you the covenant that He commanded you to observe, the Ten Commandments; and He inscribed them on two tablets of stone.

content: 14 At the same time the LORD commanded me to impart to you laws and rules for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy.
content_old: 14 At the same time the LORD commanded me to impart to you laws and rules for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy.

content: 15 For your own sake, therefore, be most careful—since you saw no shape when the LORD your God spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire—
content_old: 15 For your own sake, therefore, be most careful—since you saw no shape when the LORD your God spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire—

content: 16 not to act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness whatever: the form of a man or a woman,
content_old: 16 not to act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness whatever: the form of a man or a woman,

content: 17 the form of any beast on earth, the form of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
content_old: 17 the form of any beast on earth, the form of any winged bird that flies in the sky,

content: 18 the form of anything that creeps on the ground, the form of any fish that is in the waters below the earth.
content_old: 18 the form of anything that creeps on the ground, the form of any fish that is in the waters below the earth.

content: 19 And when you look up to the sky and behold the sun and the moon and the stars, the whole heavenly host, you must not be lured into bowing down to them or serving them. These the LORD your God allotted to other peoples everywhere under heaven;
content_old: 19 And when you look up to the sky and behold the sun and the moon and the stars, the whole heavenly host, you must not be lured into bowing down to them or serving them. These the LORD your God allotted to other peoples everywhere under heaven;

content: 20 but you the LORD took and brought out of Egypt, that iron blast furnace, to be His very own people, as is now the case.
content_old: 20 but you the LORD took and brought out of Egypt, that iron blast furnace, to be His very own people, as is now the case.

content: 21 Now the LORD was angry with me on your account and swore that I should not cross the Jordan and enter the good land that the LORD your God is assigning you as a heritage.
content_old: 21 Now the LORD was angry with me on your account and swore that I should not cross the Jordan and enter the good land that the LORD your God is assigning you as a heritage.

content: 22 For I must die in this land; I shall not cross the Jordan. But you will cross and take possession of that good land.
content_old: 22 For I must die in this land; I shall not cross the Jordan. But you will cross and take possession of that good land.

content: 23 Take care, then, not to forget the covenant that the LORD your God concluded with you, and not to make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, against which the LORD your God has enjoined you.
content_old: 23 Take care, then, not to forget the covenant that the LORD your God concluded with you, and not to make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, against which the LORD your God has enjoined you.

content: 24 For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, an impassioned God.
content_old: 24 For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, an impassioned God.

content: 25 When you have begotten children and children’s children and are long established in the land, should you act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, causing the LORD your God displeasure and vexation,
content_old: 25 When you have begotten children and children’s children and are long established in the land, should you act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, causing the LORD your God displeasure and vexation,

content: 26 I call heaven and earth this day to witness against you that you shall soon perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess; you shall not long endure in it, but shall be utterly wiped out.
content_old: 26 I call heaven and earth this day to witness against you that you shall soon perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess; you shall not long endure in it, but shall be utterly wiped out.

content: 27 The LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and only a scant few of you shall be left among the nations to which the LORD will drive you.
content_old: 27 The LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and only a scant few of you shall be left among the nations to which the LORD will drive you.

content: 28 There you will serve man-made gods of wood and stone, that cannot see or hear or eat or smell.
content_old: 28 There you will serve man-made gods of wood and stone, that cannot see or hear or eat or smell.

content: 29 But if you search there for the LORD your God, you will find Him, if only you seek Him with all your heart and soul—
content_old: 29 But if you search there for the LORD your God, you will find Him, if only you seek Him with all your heart and soul—

content: 30 when you are in distress because all these things have befallen you and, in the end, return to the LORD your God and obey Him.
content_old: 30 when you are in distress because all these things have befallen you and, in the end, return to the LORD your God and obey Him.

content: 31 For the LORD your God is a compassionate God: He will not fail you nor will He let you perish; He will not forget the covenant which He made on oath with your fathers.
content_old: 31 For the LORD your God is a compassionate God: He will not fail you nor will He let you perish; He will not forget the covenant which He made on oath with your fathers.

content: 32 You have but to inquire about bygone ages that came before you, ever since God created man on earth, from one end of heaven to the other: has anything as grand as this ever happened, or has its like ever been known?
content_old: 32 You have but to inquire about bygone ages that came before you, ever since God created man on earth, from one end of heaven to the other: has anything as grand as this ever happened, or has its like ever been known?

content: 33 Has any people heard the voice of a god speaking out of a fire, as you have, and survived?
content_old: 33 Has any people heard the voice of a god speaking out of a fire, as you have, and survived?

content: 34 Or has any god ventured to go and take for himself one nation from the midst of another by prodigious acts, by signs and portents, by war, by a mighty and an outstretched arm and awesome power, as the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?
content_old: 34 Or has any god ventured to go and take for himself one nation from the midst of another by prodigious acts, by signs and portents, by war, by a mighty and an outstretched arm and awesome power, as the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?

content: 35 It has been clearly demonstrated to you that the LORD alone is God; there is none beside Him.
content_old: 35 It has been clearly demonstrated to you that the LORD alone is God; there is none beside Him.

content: 36 From the heavens He let you hear His voice to discipline you; on earth He let you see His great fire; and from amidst that fire you heard His words.
content_old: 36 From the heavens He let you hear His voice to discipline you; on earth He let you see His great fire; and from amidst that fire you heard His words.

content: 37 And because He loved your fathers, He chose their heirs after them; He Himself, in His great might, led you out of Egypt,
content_old: 37 And because He loved your fathers, He chose their heirs after them; He Himself, in His great might, led you out of Egypt,

content: 38 to drive from your path nations greater and more populous than you, to take you into their land and assign it to you as a heritage, as is still the case.
content_old: 38 to drive from your path nations greater and more populous than you, to take you into their land and assign it to you as a heritage, as is still the case.

content: 39 Know therefore this day and keep in mind that the LORD alone is God in heaven above and on earth below; there is no other.
content_old: 39 Know therefore this day and keep in mind that the LORD alone is God in heaven above and on earth below; there is no other.

content: 40 Observe His laws and commandments, which I enjoin upon you this day, that it may go well with you and your children after you, and that you may long remain in the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you for all time.
content_old: 40 Observe His laws and commandments, which I enjoin upon you this day, that it may go well with you and your children after you, and that you may long remain in the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you for all time.

content: 41 Then Moses set aside three cities on the east side of the Jordan
content_old: 41 Then Moses set aside three cities on the east side of the Jordan

content: 42 to which a manslayer could escape, one who unwittingly slew a fellow man without having been hostile to him in the past; he could flee to one of these cities and live:
content_old: 42 to which a manslayer could escape, one who unwittingly slew a fellow man without having been hostile to him in the past; he could flee to one of these cities and live:

content: 43 Bezer, in the wilderness in the Tableland, belonging to the Reubenites; Ramoth, in Gilead, belonging to the Gadites; and Golan, in Bashan, belonging to the Manassites.
content_old: 43 Bezer, in the wilderness in the Tableland, belonging to the Reubenites; Ramoth, in Gilead, belonging to the Gadites; and Golan, in Bashan, belonging to the Manassites.

content: 44 This is the Teaching that Moses set before the Israelites:
content_old: 44 This is the Teaching that Moses set before the Israelites:

content: 45 these are the decrees, laws, and rules that Moses addressed to the people of Israel, after they had left Egypt,
content_old: 45 these are the decrees, laws, and rules that Moses addressed to the people of Israel, after they had left Egypt,

content: 46 beyond the Jordan, in the valley at Beth-peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, whom Moses and the Israelites defeated after they had left Egypt.
content_old: 46 beyond the Jordan, in the valley at Beth-peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, whom Moses and the Israelites defeated after they had left Egypt.

content: 47 They had taken possession of his country and that of King Og of Bashan—the two kings of the Amorites—which were on the east side of the Jordan
content_old: 47 They had taken possession of his country and that of King Og of Bashan—the two kings of the Amorites—which were on the east side of the Jordan

content: 48 from Aroer on the banks of the wadi Arnon, as far as Mount Sion, that is, Hermon;
content_old: 48 from Aroer on the banks of the wadi Arnon, as far as Mount Sion, that is, Hermon;

content: 1 Moses summoned all the Israelites and said to them: Hear, O Israel, the laws and rules that I proclaim to you this day! Study them and observe them faithfully!
content_old: 1 Moses summoned all the Israelites and said to them: Hear, O Israel, the laws and rules that I proclaim to you this day! Study them and observe them faithfully!

content: 2 The LORD our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
content_old: 2 The LORD our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.

content: 3 It was not with our fathers that the LORD made this covenant, but with us, the living, every one of us who is here today.
content_old: 3 It was not with our fathers that the LORD made this covenant, but with us, the living, every one of us who is here today.

content: 4 Face to face the LORD spoke to you on the mountain out of the fire—
content_old: 4 Face to face the LORD spoke to you on the mountain out of the fire—

content: 5 I stood between the LORD and you at that time to convey the LORD‘s words to you, for you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain—saying:
content_old: 5 I stood between the LORD and you at that time to convey the LORD‘s words to you, for you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain—saying:

content: 6 I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:
content_old: 6 I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:

content: 7 You shall have no other gods beside Me.
content_old: 7 You shall have no other gods beside Me.

content: 8 You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters below the earth.
content_old: 8 You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters below the earth.

content: 9 You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I the LORD your God am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,
content_old: 9 You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I the LORD your God am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,

content: 10 but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
content_old: 10 but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.

content: 11 You shall not swear falsely by the name of the LORD your God; for the LORD will not clear one who swears falsely by His name.
content_old: 11 You shall not swear falsely by the name of the LORD your God; for the LORD will not clear one who swears falsely by His name.

content: 12 Observe the sabbath day and keep it holy, as the LORD your God has commanded you.
content_old: 12 Observe the sabbath day and keep it holy, as the LORD your God has commanded you.

content: 13 Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
content_old: 13 Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

content: 14 but the seventh day is a sabbath of the LORD your God; you shall not do any work—you, your son or your daughter, your male or female slave, your ox or your ass, or any of your cattle, or the stranger in your settlements, so that your male and female slave may rest as you do.
content_old: 14 but the seventh day is a sabbath of the LORD your God; you shall not do any work—you, your son or your daughter, your male or female slave, your ox or your ass, or any of your cattle, or the stranger in your settlements, so that your male and female slave may rest as you do.

content: 15 Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the LORD your God freed you from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the LORD your God has commanded you to observe the sabbath day.
content_old: 15 Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the LORD your God freed you from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the LORD your God has commanded you to observe the sabbath day.

content: 16 Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, that you may long endure, and that you may fare well, in the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you.
content_old: 16 Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, that you may long endure, and that you may fare well, in the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you.

content: 17 You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
content_old: 17 You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

content: 18 You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. You shall not crave your neighbor’s house, or his field, or his male or female slave, or his ox, or his ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.
content_old: 18 You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. You shall not crave your neighbor’s house, or his field, or his male or female slave, or his ox, or his ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.

content: 19 The LORD spoke those words—those and no more—to your whole congregation at the mountain, with a mighty voice out of the fire and the dense clouds. He inscribed them on two tablets of stone, which He gave to me.
content_old: 19 The LORD spoke those words—those and no more—to your whole congregation at the mountain, with a mighty voice out of the fire and the dense clouds. He inscribed them on two tablets of stone, which He gave to me.

content: 20 When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, you came up to me, all your tribal heads and elders,
content_old: 20 When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, you came up to me, all your tribal heads and elders,

content: 21 and said, “The LORD our God has just shown us His majestic Presence, and we have heard His voice out of the fire; we have seen this day that man may live though God has spoken to him.
content_old: 21 and said, “The LORD our God has just shown us His majestic Presence, and we have heard His voice out of the fire; we have seen this day that man may live though God has spoken to him.

content: 22 Let us not die, then, for this fearsome fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the LORD our God any longer, we shall die.
content_old: 22 Let us not die, then, for this fearsome fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the LORD our God any longer, we shall die.

content: 23 For what mortal ever heard the voice of the living God speak out of the fire, as we did, and lived?
content_old: 23 For what mortal ever heard the voice of the living God speak out of the fire, as we did, and lived?

content: 24 You go closer and hear all that the LORD our God says, and then you tell us everything that the LORD our God tells you, and we will willingly do it.”
content_old: 24 You go closer and hear all that the LORD our God says, and then you tell us everything that the LORD our God tells you, and we will willingly do it.”

content: 25 The LORD heard the plea that you made to me, and the LORD said to me, “I have heard the plea that this people made to you; they did well to speak thus.
content_old: 25 The LORD heard the plea that you made to me, and the LORD said to me, “I have heard the plea that this people made to you; they did well to speak thus.

content: 26 May they always be of such mind, to revere Me and follow all My commandments, that it may go well with them and with their children forever!
content_old: 26 May they always be of such mind, to revere Me and follow all My commandments, that it may go well with them and with their children forever!

content: 27 Go, say to them, ‘Return to your tents.’
content_old: 27 Go, say to them, ‘Return to your tents.’

content: 28 But you remain here with Me, and I will give you the whole Instruction—the laws and the rules—that you shall impart to them, for them to observe in the land that I am giving them to possess.”
content_old: 28 But you remain here with Me, and I will give you the whole Instruction—the laws and the rules—that you shall impart to them, for them to observe in the land that I am giving them to possess.”

content: 29 Be careful, then, to do as the LORD your God has commanded you. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left:
content_old: 29 Be careful, then, to do as the LORD your God has commanded you. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left:

content: 1 And this is the Instruction—the laws and the rules—that the LORD your God has commanded meto impart to you, to be observed in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy,
content_old: 1 And this is the Instruction—the laws and the rules—that the LORD your God has commanded meto impart to you, to be observed in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy,

content: 2 so that you, your children, and your children’s children may revere the LORD your God and follow, as long as you live, all His laws and commandments that I enjoin upon you, to the end that you may long endure.
content_old: 2 so that you, your children, and your children’s children may revere the LORD your God and follow, as long as you live, all His laws and commandments that I enjoin upon you, to the end that you may long endure.

content: 3 Obey, O Israel, willingly and faithfully, that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, as the LORD, the God of your fathers, spoke to you.
content_old: 3 Obey, O Israel, willingly and faithfully, that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, as the LORD, the God of your fathers, spoke to you.

content: 4 Hear, O Israel! The LORD is our God, the LORD alone.
content_old: 4 Hear, O Israel! The LORD is our God, the LORD alone.

content: 5 You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.
content_old: 5 You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.

content: 6 Take to heart these instructions with which I charge you this day.
content_old: 6 Take to heart these instructions with which I charge you this day.

content: 7 Impress them upon your children. Recite them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up.
content_old: 7 Impress them upon your children. Recite them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up.

content: 8 Bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a symbol on your forehead;
content_old: 8 Bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a symbol on your forehead;

content: 9 inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
content_old: 9 inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.

content: 10 When the LORD your God brings you into the land that He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to you—great and flourishing cities that you did not build,
content_old: 10 When the LORD your God brings you into the land that He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to you—great and flourishing cities that you did not build,

content: 11 houses full of all good things that you did not fill, hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant—and you eat your fill,
content_old: 11 houses full of all good things that you did not fill, hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant—and you eat your fill,

content: 12 take heed that you do not forget the LORD who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage.
content_old: 12 take heed that you do not forget the LORD who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage.

content: 13 Revere only the LORD your God and worship Him alone, and swear only by His name.
content_old: 13 Revere only the LORD your God and worship Him alone, and swear only by His name.

content: 14 Do not follow other gods, any gods of the peoples about you
content_old: 14 Do not follow other gods, any gods of the peoples about you

content: 15 —for the LORD your God in your midst is an impassioned God—lest the anger of the LORD your God blaze forth against you and He wipe you off the face of the earth.
content_old: 15 —for the LORD your God in your midst is an impassioned God—lest the anger of the LORD your God blaze forth against you and He wipe you off the face of the earth.

content: 16 Do not try the LORD your God, as you did at Massah.
content_old: 16 Do not try the LORD your God, as you did at Massah.

content: 17 Be sure to keep the commandments, decrees, and laws that the LORD your God has enjoined upon you.
content_old: 17 Be sure to keep the commandments, decrees, and laws that the LORD your God has enjoined upon you.

content: 18 Do what is right and good in the sight of the LORD, that it may go well with you and that you may be able to possess the good land that the LORD your God promised on oath to your fathers,
content_old: 18 Do what is right and good in the sight of the LORD, that it may go well with you and that you may be able to possess the good land that the LORD your God promised on oath to your fathers,

content: 19 and that all your enemies may be driven out before you, as the LORD has spoken.
content_old: 19 and that all your enemies may be driven out before you, as the LORD has spoken.

content: 20 When, in time to come, your children ask you, “What mean the decrees, laws, and rules that the LORD our God has enjoined upon you?”
content_old: 20 When, in time to come, your children ask you, “What mean the decrees, laws, and rules that the LORD our God has enjoined upon you?”

content: 21 you shall say to your children, “We were slaves to Pharaoh in Egypt and the LORD freed us from Egypt with a mighty hand.
content_old: 21 you shall say to your children, “We were slaves to Pharaoh in Egypt and the LORD freed us from Egypt with a mighty hand.

content: 22 The LORD wrought before our eyes marvelous and destructive signs and portents in Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his household;
content_old: 22 The LORD wrought before our eyes marvelous and destructive signs and portents in Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his household;

content: 23 and us He freed from there, that He might take us and give us the land that He had promised on oath to our fathers.
content_old: 23 and us He freed from there, that He might take us and give us the land that He had promised on oath to our fathers.

content: 24 Then the LORD commanded us to observe all these laws, to revere the LORD our God, for our lasting good and for our survival, as is now the case.
content_old: 24 Then the LORD commanded us to observe all these laws, to revere the LORD our God, for our lasting good and for our survival, as is now the case.

content: 1 When the LORD your God brings you to the land that you are about to enter and possess, and He dislodges many nations before you—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations much larger than you—
content_old: 1 When the LORD your God brings you to the land that you are about to enter and possess, and He dislodges many nations before you—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations much larger than you—

content: 2 and the LORD your God delivers them to you and you defeat them, you must doom them to destruction: grant them no terms and give them no quarter.
content_old: 2 and the LORD your God delivers them to you and you defeat them, you must doom them to destruction: grant them no terms and give them no quarter.

content: 3 You shall not intermarry with them: do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons.
content_old: 3 You shall not intermarry with them: do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons.

content: 4 For they will turn your children away from Me to worship other gods, and the LORD‘s anger will blaze forth against you and He will promptly wipe you out.
content_old: 4 For they will turn your children away from Me to worship other gods, and the LORD‘s anger will blaze forth against you and He will promptly wipe you out.

content: 5 Instead, this is what you shall do to them: you shall tear down their altars, smash their pillars, cut down their sacred posts, and consign their images to the fire.
content_old: 5 Instead, this is what you shall do to them: you shall tear down their altars, smash their pillars, cut down their sacred posts, and consign their images to the fire.

content: 6 For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God: of all the peoples on earth the LORD your God chose you to be His treasured people.
content_old: 6 For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God: of all the peoples on earth the LORD your God chose you to be His treasured people.

content: 7 It is not because you are the most numerous of peoples that the LORD set His heart on you and chose you—indeed, you are the smallest of peoples;
content_old: 7 It is not because you are the most numerous of peoples that the LORD set His heart on you and chose you—indeed, you are the smallest of peoples;

content: 8 but it was because the LORD favored you and kept the oath He made to your fathers that the LORD freed you with a mighty hand and rescued you from the house of bondage, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
content_old: 8 but it was because the LORD favored you and kept the oath He made to your fathers that the LORD freed you with a mighty hand and rescued you from the house of bondage, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.

content: 9 Know, therefore, that only the LORD your God is God, the steadfast God who keeps His covenant faithfully to the thousandth generation of those who love Him and keep His commandments,
content_old: 9 Know, therefore, that only the LORD your God is God, the steadfast God who keeps His covenant faithfully to the thousandth generation of those who love Him and keep His commandments,

content: 10 but who instantly requites with destruction those who reject Him—never slow with those who reject Him, but requiting them instantly.
content_old: 10 but who instantly requites with destruction those who reject Him—never slow with those who reject Him, but requiting them instantly.

content: 11 Therefore, observe faithfully the Instruction—the laws and the rules—with which I charge you today.
content_old: 11 Therefore, observe faithfully the Instruction—the laws and the rules—with which I charge you today.

content: 12 And if you do obey these rules and observe them carefully, the LORD your God will maintain faithfully for you the covenant that He made on oath with your fathers:
content_old: 12 And if you do obey these rules and observe them carefully, the LORD your God will maintain faithfully for you the covenant that He made on oath with your fathers:

content: 13 He will favor you and bless you and multiply you; He will bless the issue of your womb and the produce of your soil, your new grain and wine and oil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock, in the land that He swore to your fathers to assign to you.
content_old: 13 He will favor you and bless you and multiply you; He will bless the issue of your womb and the produce of your soil, your new grain and wine and oil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock, in the land that He swore to your fathers to assign to you.

content: 14 You shall be blessed above all other peoples: there shall be no sterile male or female among you or among your livestock.
content_old: 14 You shall be blessed above all other peoples: there shall be no sterile male or female among you or among your livestock.

content: 15 The LORD will ward off from you all sickness; He will not bring upon you any of the dreadful diseases of Egypt, about which you know, but will inflict them upon all your enemies.
content_old: 15 The LORD will ward off from you all sickness; He will not bring upon you any of the dreadful diseases of Egypt, about which you know, but will inflict them upon all your enemies.

content: 16 You shall destroy all the peoples that the LORD your God delivers to you, showing them no pity. And you shall not worship their gods, for that would be a snare to you.
content_old: 16 You shall destroy all the peoples that the LORD your God delivers to you, showing them no pity. And you shall not worship their gods, for that would be a snare to you.

content: 17 Should you say to yourselves, “These nations are more numerous than we; how can we dispossess them?”
content_old: 17 Should you say to yourselves, “These nations are more numerous than we; how can we dispossess them?”

content: 18 You need have no fear of them. You have but to bear in mind what the LORD your God did to Pharaoh and all the Egyptians:
content_old: 18 You need have no fear of them. You have but to bear in mind what the LORD your God did to Pharaoh and all the Egyptians:

content: 19 the wondrous acts that you saw with your own eyes, the signs and the portents, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm by which the LORD your God liberated you. Thus will the LORD your God do to all the peoples you now fear.
content_old: 19 the wondrous acts that you saw with your own eyes, the signs and the portents, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm by which the LORD your God liberated you. Thus will the LORD your God do to all the peoples you now fear.

content: 20 The LORD your God will also send a plague against them, until those who are left in hiding perish before you.
content_old: 20 The LORD your God will also send a plague against them, until those who are left in hiding perish before you.

content: 21 Do not stand in dread of them, for the LORD your God is in your midst, a great and awesome God.
content_old: 21 Do not stand in dread of them, for the LORD your God is in your midst, a great and awesome God.

content: 22 The LORD your God will dislodge those peoples before you little by little; you will not be able to put an end to them at once, else the wild beasts would multiply to your hurt.
content_old: 22 The LORD your God will dislodge those peoples before you little by little; you will not be able to put an end to them at once, else the wild beasts would multiply to your hurt.

content: 23 The LORD your God will deliver them up to you, throwing them into utter panic until they are wiped out.
content_old: 23 The LORD your God will deliver them up to you, throwing them into utter panic until they are wiped out.

content: 24 He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall obliterate their name from under the heavens; no man shall stand up to you, until you have wiped them out.
content_old: 24 He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall obliterate their name from under the heavens; no man shall stand up to you, until you have wiped them out.

content: 25 You shall consign the images of their gods to the fire; you shall not covet the silver and gold on them and keep it for yourselves, lest you be ensnared thereby; for that is abhorrent to the LORD your God.
content_old: 25 You shall consign the images of their gods to the fire; you shall not covet the silver and gold on them and keep it for yourselves, lest you be ensnared thereby; for that is abhorrent to the LORD your God.

content: 1 You shall faithfully observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, that you may thrive and increase and be able to possess the land that the LORD promised on oath to your fathers.
content_old: 1 You shall faithfully observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, that you may thrive and increase and be able to possess the land that the LORD promised on oath to your fathers.

content: 2 Remember the long way that the LORD your God has made you travel in the wilderness these past forty years, that He might test you by hardships to learn what was in your hearts: whether you would keep His commandments or not.
content_old: 2 Remember the long way that the LORD your God has made you travel in the wilderness these past forty years, that He might test you by hardships to learn what was in your hearts: whether you would keep His commandments or not.

content: 3 He subjected you to the hardship of hunger and then gave you manna to eat, which neither you nor your fathers had ever known, in order to teach you that man does not live on bread alone, but that man may live on anything that the LORD decrees.
content_old: 3 He subjected you to the hardship of hunger and then gave you manna to eat, which neither you nor your fathers had ever known, in order to teach you that man does not live on bread alone, but that man may live on anything that the LORD decrees.

content: 4 The clothes upon you did not wear out, nor did your feet swell these forty years.
content_old: 4 The clothes upon you did not wear out, nor did your feet swell these forty years.

content: 5 Bear in mind that the LORD your God disciplines you just as a man disciplines his son.
content_old: 5 Bear in mind that the LORD your God disciplines you just as a man disciplines his son.

content: 6 Therefore keep the commandments of the LORD your God: walk in His ways and revere Him.
content_old: 6 Therefore keep the commandments of the LORD your God: walk in His ways and revere Him.

content: 7 For the LORD your God is bringing you into a good land, a land with streams and springs and fountains issuing from plain and hill;
content_old: 7 For the LORD your God is bringing you into a good land, a land with streams and springs and fountains issuing from plain and hill;

content: 8 a land of wheat and barley, of vines, figs, and pomegranates, a land of olive trees and honey;
content_old: 8 a land of wheat and barley, of vines, figs, and pomegranates, a land of olive trees and honey;

content: 9 a land where you may eat food without stint, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper.
content_old: 9 a land where you may eat food without stint, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper.

content: 10 When you have eaten your fill, give thanks to the LORD your God for the good land which He has given you.
content_old: 10 When you have eaten your fill, give thanks to the LORD your God for the good land which He has given you.

content: 11 Take care lest you forget the LORD your God and fail to keep His commandments, His rules, and His laws, which I enjoin upon you today.
content_old: 11 Take care lest you forget the LORD your God and fail to keep His commandments, His rules, and His laws, which I enjoin upon you today.

content: 12 When you have eaten your fill, and have built fine houses to live in,
content_old: 12 When you have eaten your fill, and have built fine houses to live in,

content: 13 and your herds and flocks have multiplied, and your silver and gold have increased, and everything you own has prospered,
content_old: 13 and your herds and flocks have multiplied, and your silver and gold have increased, and everything you own has prospered,

content: 14 beware lest your heart grow haughty and you forget the LORD your God—who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage;
content_old: 14 beware lest your heart grow haughty and you forget the LORD your God—who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage;

content: 15 who led you through the great and terrible wilderness with its seraph serpents and scorpions, a parched land with no water in it, who brought forth water for you from the flinty rock;
content_old: 15 who led you through the great and terrible wilderness with its seraph serpents and scorpions, a parched land with no water in it, who brought forth water for you from the flinty rock;

content: 16 who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers had never known, in order to test you by hardships only to benefit you in the end—
content_old: 16 who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers had never known, in order to test you by hardships only to benefit you in the end—

content: 17 and you say to yourselves, “My own power and the might of my own hand have won this wealth for me.”
content_old: 17 and you say to yourselves, “My own power and the might of my own hand have won this wealth for me.”

content: 18 Remember that it is the LORD your God who gives you the power to get wealth, in fulfillment of the covenant that He made on oath with your fathers, as is still the case.
content_old: 18 Remember that it is the LORD your God who gives you the power to get wealth, in fulfillment of the covenant that He made on oath with your fathers, as is still the case.

content: 19 If you do forget the LORD your God and follow other gods to serve them or bow down to them, I warn you this day that you shall certainly perish;
content_old: 19 If you do forget the LORD your God and follow other gods to serve them or bow down to them, I warn you this day that you shall certainly perish;

content: 1 Hear, O Israel! You are about to cross the Jordan to go in and dispossess nations greater and more populous than you: great cities with walls sky-high;
content_old: 1 Hear, O Israel! You are about to cross the Jordan to go in and dispossess nations greater and more populous than you: great cities with walls sky-high;

content: 2 a people great and tall, the Anakites, of whom you have knowledge; for you have heard it said, “Who can stand up to the children of Anak?”
content_old: 2 a people great and tall, the Anakites, of whom you have knowledge; for you have heard it said, “Who can stand up to the children of Anak?”

content: 3 Know then this day that none other than the LORD your God is crossing at your head, a devouring fire; it is He who will wipe them out. He will subdue them before you, that you may quickly dispossess and destroy them, as the LORD promised you.
content_old: 3 Know then this day that none other than the LORD your God is crossing at your head, a devouring fire; it is He who will wipe them out. He will subdue them before you, that you may quickly dispossess and destroy them, as the LORD promised you.

content: 4 And when the LORD your God has thrust them from your path, say not to yourselves, “The LORD has enabled us to possess this land because of our virtues”; it is rather because of the wickedness of those nations that the LORD is dispossessing them before you.
content_old: 4 And when the LORD your God has thrust them from your path, say not to yourselves, “The LORD has enabled us to possess this land because of our virtues”; it is rather because of the wickedness of those nations that the LORD is dispossessing them before you.

content: 5 It is not because of your virtues and your rectitude that you will be able to possess their country; but it is because of their wickedness that the LORD your God is dispossessing those nations before you, and in order to fulfill the oath that the LORD made to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
content_old: 5 It is not because of your virtues and your rectitude that you will be able to possess their country; but it is because of their wickedness that the LORD your God is dispossessing those nations before you, and in order to fulfill the oath that the LORD made to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

content: 6 Know, then, that it is not for any virtue of yours that the LORD your God is giving you this good land to possess; for you are a stiffnecked people.
