content_old: 6 Know, then, that it is not for any virtue of yours that the LORD your God is giving you this good land to possess; for you are a stiffnecked people.

content: 7 Remember, never forget, how you provoked the LORD your God to anger in the wilderness: from the day that you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place, you have continued defiant toward the LORD.
content_old: 7 Remember, never forget, how you provoked the LORD your God to anger in the wilderness: from the day that you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place, you have continued defiant toward the LORD.

content: 8 At Horeb you so provoked the LORD that the LORD was angry enough with you to have destroyed you.
content_old: 8 At Horeb you so provoked the LORD that the LORD was angry enough with you to have destroyed you.

content: 9 I had ascended the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant that the LORD had made with you, and I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, eating no bread and drinking no water.
content_old: 9 I had ascended the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant that the LORD had made with you, and I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, eating no bread and drinking no water.

content: 10 And the LORD gave me the two tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God, with the exact words that the LORD had addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly.
content_old: 10 And the LORD gave me the two tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God, with the exact words that the LORD had addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly.

content: 11 At the end of those forty days and forty nights, the LORD gave me the two tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant.
content_old: 11 At the end of those forty days and forty nights, the LORD gave me the two tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant.

content: 12 And the LORD said to me, “Hurry, go down from here at once, for the people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted wickedly; they have been quick to stray from the path that I enjoined upon them; they have made themselves a molten image.”
content_old: 12 And the LORD said to me, “Hurry, go down from here at once, for the people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted wickedly; they have been quick to stray from the path that I enjoined upon them; they have made themselves a molten image.”

content: 13 The LORD further said to me, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.
content_old: 13 The LORD further said to me, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.

content: 14 Let Me alone and I will destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven, and I will make you a nation far more numerous than they.”
content_old: 14 Let Me alone and I will destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven, and I will make you a nation far more numerous than they.”

content: 15 I started down the mountain, a mountain ablaze with fire, the two Tablets of the Covenant in my two hands.
content_old: 15 I started down the mountain, a mountain ablaze with fire, the two Tablets of the Covenant in my two hands.

content: 16 I saw how you had sinned against the LORD your God: you had made yourselves a molten calf; you had been quick to stray from the path that the LORD had enjoined upon you.
content_old: 16 I saw how you had sinned against the LORD your God: you had made yourselves a molten calf; you had been quick to stray from the path that the LORD had enjoined upon you.

content: 17 Thereupon I gripped the two tablets and flung them away with both my hands, smashing them before your eyes.
content_old: 17 Thereupon I gripped the two tablets and flung them away with both my hands, smashing them before your eyes.

content: 18 I threw myself down before the LORD—eating no bread and drinking no water forty days and forty nights, as before—because of the great wrong you had committed, doing what displeased the LORD and vexing Him.
content_old: 18 I threw myself down before the LORD—eating no bread and drinking no water forty days and forty nights, as before—because of the great wrong you had committed, doing what displeased the LORD and vexing Him.

content: 19 For I was in dread of the LORD‘s fierce anger against you, which moved Him to wipe you out. And that time, too, the LORD gave heed to me.—
content_old: 19 For I was in dread of the LORD‘s fierce anger against you, which moved Him to wipe you out. And that time, too, the LORD gave heed to me.—

content: 20 Moreover, the LORD was angry enough with Aaron to have destroyed him; so I also interceded for Aaron at that time.—
content_old: 20 Moreover, the LORD was angry enough with Aaron to have destroyed him; so I also interceded for Aaron at that time.—

content: 21 As for that sinful thing you had made, the calf, I took it and put it to the fire; I broke it to bits and ground it thoroughly until it was fine as dust, and I threw its dust into the brook that comes down from the mountain.
content_old: 21 As for that sinful thing you had made, the calf, I took it and put it to the fire; I broke it to bits and ground it thoroughly until it was fine as dust, and I threw its dust into the brook that comes down from the mountain.

content: 22 Again you provoked the LORD at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah.
content_old: 22 Again you provoked the LORD at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah.

content: 23 And when the LORD sent you on from Kadesh-barnea, saying, “Go up and take possession of the land that I am giving you,” you flouted the command of the LORD your God; you did not put your trust in Him and did not obey Him.
content_old: 23 And when the LORD sent you on from Kadesh-barnea, saying, “Go up and take possession of the land that I am giving you,” you flouted the command of the LORD your God; you did not put your trust in Him and did not obey Him.

content: 24 As long as I have known you, you have been defiant toward the LORD.
content_old: 24 As long as I have known you, you have been defiant toward the LORD.

content: 25 When I lay prostrate before the LORD those forty days and forty nights, because the LORD was determined to destroy you,
content_old: 25 When I lay prostrate before the LORD those forty days and forty nights, because the LORD was determined to destroy you,

content: 26 I prayed to the LORD and said, “O Lord God, do not annihilate Your very own people, whom You redeemed in Your majesty and whom You freed from Egypt with a mighty hand.
content_old: 26 I prayed to the LORD and said, “O Lord God, do not annihilate Your very own people, whom You redeemed in Your majesty and whom You freed from Egypt with a mighty hand.

content: 27 Give thought to Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and pay no heed to the stubbornness of this people, its wickedness, and its sinfulness.
content_old: 27 Give thought to Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and pay no heed to the stubbornness of this people, its wickedness, and its sinfulness.

content: 28 Else the country from which You freed us will say, ‘It was because the LORD was powerless to bring them into the land that He had promised them, and because He rejected them, that He brought them out to have them die in the wilderness.’
content_old: 28 Else the country from which You freed us will say, ‘It was because the LORD was powerless to bring them into the land that He had promised them, and because He rejected them, that He brought them out to have them die in the wilderness.’

content: 1 Thereupon the LORD said to me, “Carve out two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to Me on the mountain; and make an ark of wood.
content_old: 1 Thereupon the LORD said to me, “Carve out two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to Me on the mountain; and make an ark of wood.

content: 2 I will inscribe on the tablets the commandments that were on the first tablets that you smashed, and you shall deposit them in the ark.”
content_old: 2 I will inscribe on the tablets the commandments that were on the first tablets that you smashed, and you shall deposit them in the ark.”

content: 3 I made an ark of acacia wood and carved out two tablets of stone like the first; I took the two tablets with me and went up the mountain.
content_old: 3 I made an ark of acacia wood and carved out two tablets of stone like the first; I took the two tablets with me and went up the mountain.

content: 4 The LORD inscribed on the tablets the same text as on the first, the Ten Commandments that He addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly; and the LORD gave them to me.
content_old: 4 The LORD inscribed on the tablets the same text as on the first, the Ten Commandments that He addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly; and the LORD gave them to me.

content: 5 Then I left and went down from the mountain, and I deposited the tablets in the ark that I had made, where they still are, as the LORD had commanded me.
content_old: 5 Then I left and went down from the mountain, and I deposited the tablets in the ark that I had made, where they still are, as the LORD had commanded me.

content: 6 From Beeroth-bene-jaakan the Israelites marched to Moserah. Aaron died there and was buried there; and his son Eleazar became priest in his stead.
content_old: 6 From Beeroth-bene-jaakan the Israelites marched to Moserah. Aaron died there and was buried there; and his son Eleazar became priest in his stead.

content: 7 From there they marched to Gudgod, and from Gudgod to Jotbath, a region of running brooks.
content_old: 7 From there they marched to Gudgod, and from Gudgod to Jotbath, a region of running brooks.

content: 8 At that time the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the Ark of the LORD‘s Covenant, to stand in attendance upon the LORD, and to bless in His name, as is still the case.
content_old: 8 At that time the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the Ark of the LORD‘s Covenant, to stand in attendance upon the LORD, and to bless in His name, as is still the case.

content: 9 That is why the Levites have received no hereditary portion along with their kinsmen: the LORD is their portion, as the LORD your God spoke concerning them.
content_old: 9 That is why the Levites have received no hereditary portion along with their kinsmen: the LORD is their portion, as the LORD your God spoke concerning them.

content: 10 I had stayed on the mountain, as I did the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the LORD heeded me once again: the LORD agreed not to destroy you.
content_old: 10 I had stayed on the mountain, as I did the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the LORD heeded me once again: the LORD agreed not to destroy you.

content: 11 And the LORD said to me, “Up, resume the march at the head of the people, that they may go in and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”
content_old: 11 And the LORD said to me, “Up, resume the march at the head of the people, that they may go in and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”

content: 12 And now, O Israel, what does the LORD your God demand of you? Only this: to revere the LORD your God, to walk only in His paths, to love Him, and to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and soul,
content_old: 12 And now, O Israel, what does the LORD your God demand of you? Only this: to revere the LORD your God, to walk only in His paths, to love Him, and to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and soul,

content: 13 keeping the LORD‘s commandments and laws, which I enjoin upon you today, for your good.
content_old: 13 keeping the LORD‘s commandments and laws, which I enjoin upon you today, for your good.

content: 14 Mark, the heavens to their uttermost reaches belong to the LORD your God, the earth and all that is on it!
content_old: 14 Mark, the heavens to their uttermost reaches belong to the LORD your God, the earth and all that is on it!

content: 15 Yet it was to your fathers that the LORD was drawn in His love for them, so that He chose you, their lineal descendants, from among all peoples—as is now the case.
content_old: 15 Yet it was to your fathers that the LORD was drawn in His love for them, so that He chose you, their lineal descendants, from among all peoples—as is now the case.

content: 16 Cut away, therefore, the thickening about your hearts and stiffen your necks no more.
content_old: 16 Cut away, therefore, the thickening about your hearts and stiffen your necks no more.

content: 17 For the LORD your God is God supreme and Lord supreme, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who shows no favor and takes no bribe,
content_old: 17 For the LORD your God is God supreme and Lord supreme, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who shows no favor and takes no bribe,

content: 18 but upholds the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and befriends the stranger, providing him with food and clothing.—
content_old: 18 but upholds the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and befriends the stranger, providing him with food and clothing.—

content: 19 You too must befriend the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 19 You too must befriend the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

content: 20 You must revere the LORD your God: only Him shall you worship, to Him shall you hold fast, and by His name shall you swear.
content_old: 20 You must revere the LORD your God: only Him shall you worship, to Him shall you hold fast, and by His name shall you swear.

content: 21 He is your glory and He is your God, who wrought for you those marvelous, awesome deeds that you saw with your own eyes.
content_old: 21 He is your glory and He is your God, who wrought for you those marvelous, awesome deeds that you saw with your own eyes.

content: 1 Love, therefore, the LORD your God, and always keep His charge, His laws, His rules, and His commandments.
content_old: 1 Love, therefore, the LORD your God, and always keep His charge, His laws, His rules, and His commandments.

content: 2 Take thought this day that it was not your children, who neither experienced nor witnessed the lesson of the LORD your God— His majesty, His mighty hand, His outstretched arm;
content_old: 2 Take thought this day that it was not your children, who neither experienced nor witnessed the lesson of the LORD your God— His majesty, His mighty hand, His outstretched arm;

content: 3 the signs and the deeds that He performed in Egypt against Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;
content_old: 3 the signs and the deeds that He performed in Egypt against Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;

content: 4 what He did to Egypt’s army, its horses and chariots; how the LORD rolled back upon them the waters of the Sea of Reeds when they were pursuing you, thus destroying them once and for all;
content_old: 4 what He did to Egypt’s army, its horses and chariots; how the LORD rolled back upon them the waters of the Sea of Reeds when they were pursuing you, thus destroying them once and for all;

content: 5 what He did for you in the wilderness before you arrived in this place;
content_old: 5 what He did for you in the wilderness before you arrived in this place;

content: 6 and what He did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab son of Reuben, when the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them, along with their households, their tents, and every living thing in their train, from amidst all Israel—
content_old: 6 and what He did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab son of Reuben, when the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them, along with their households, their tents, and every living thing in their train, from amidst all Israel—

content: 7 but that it was you who saw with your own eyes all the marvelous deeds that the LORD performed.
content_old: 7 but that it was you who saw with your own eyes all the marvelous deeds that the LORD performed.

content: 8 Keep, therefore, all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, so that you may have the strength to enter and take possession of the land that you are about to cross into and possess,
content_old: 8 Keep, therefore, all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, so that you may have the strength to enter and take possession of the land that you are about to cross into and possess,

content: 9 and that you may long endure upon the soil that the LORD swore to your fathers to assign to them and to their heirs, a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 9 and that you may long endure upon the soil that the LORD swore to your fathers to assign to them and to their heirs, a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 10 For the land that you are about to enter and possess is not like the land of Egypt from which you have come. There the grain you sowed had to be watered by your own labors, like a vegetable garden;
content_old: 10 For the land that you are about to enter and possess is not like the land of Egypt from which you have come. There the grain you sowed had to be watered by your own labors, like a vegetable garden;

content: 11 but the land you are about to cross into and possess, a land of hills and valleys, soaks up its water from the rains of heaven.
content_old: 11 but the land you are about to cross into and possess, a land of hills and valleys, soaks up its water from the rains of heaven.

content: 12 It is a land which the LORD your God looks after, on which the LORD your God always keeps His eye, from year’s beginning to year’s end.
content_old: 12 It is a land which the LORD your God looks after, on which the LORD your God always keeps His eye, from year’s beginning to year’s end.

content: 13 If, then, you obey the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day, loving the LORD your God and serving Him with all your heart and soul,
content_old: 13 If, then, you obey the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day, loving the LORD your God and serving Him with all your heart and soul,

content: 14 I will grant the rain for your land in season, the early rain and the late. You shall gather in your new grain and wine and oil—
content_old: 14 I will grant the rain for your land in season, the early rain and the late. You shall gather in your new grain and wine and oil—

content: 15 I will also provide grass in the fields for your cattle—and thus you shall eat your fill.
content_old: 15 I will also provide grass in the fields for your cattle—and thus you shall eat your fill.

content: 16 Take care not to be lured away to serve other gods and bow to them.
content_old: 16 Take care not to be lured away to serve other gods and bow to them.

content: 17 For the LORD‘s anger will flare up against you, and He will shut up the skies so that there will be no rain and the ground will not yield its produce; and you will soon perish from the good land that the LORD is assigning to you.
content_old: 17 For the LORD‘s anger will flare up against you, and He will shut up the skies so that there will be no rain and the ground will not yield its produce; and you will soon perish from the good land that the LORD is assigning to you.

content: 18 Therefore impress these My words upon your very heart: bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a -symbol on your forehead,
content_old: 18 Therefore impress these My words upon your very heart: bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a -symbol on your forehead,

content: 19 and teach them to your children—reciting them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up;
content_old: 19 and teach them to your children—reciting them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up;

content: 20 and inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates—
content_old: 20 and inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates—

content: 21 to the end that you and your children may endure, in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to assign to them, as long as there is a heaven over the earth.
content_old: 21 to the end that you and your children may endure, in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to assign to them, as long as there is a heaven over the earth.

content: 22 If, then, you faithfully keep all this Instruction that I command you, loving the LORD your God, walking in all His ways, and holding fast to Him,
content_old: 22 If, then, you faithfully keep all this Instruction that I command you, loving the LORD your God, walking in all His ways, and holding fast to Him,

content: 23 the LORD will dislodge before you all these nations: you will dispossess nations greater and more numerous than you.
content_old: 23 the LORD will dislodge before you all these nations: you will dispossess nations greater and more numerous than you.

content: 24 Every spot on which your foot treads shall be yours; your territory shall extend from the wilderness to the Lebanon and from the River—the Euphrates—to the Western Sea.
content_old: 24 Every spot on which your foot treads shall be yours; your territory shall extend from the wilderness to the Lebanon and from the River—the Euphrates—to the Western Sea.

content: 25 No man shall stand up to you: the LORD your God will put the dread and the fear of you over the whole land in which you set foot, as He promised you.
content_old: 25 No man shall stand up to you: the LORD your God will put the dread and the fear of you over the whole land in which you set foot, as He promised you.

content: 26 See, this day I set before you blessing and curse:
content_old: 26 See, this day I set before you blessing and curse:

content: 27 blessing, if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God that I enjoin upon you this day;
content_old: 27 blessing, if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God that I enjoin upon you this day;

content: 28 and curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn away from the path that I enjoin upon you this day and follow other gods, whom you have not experienced.
content_old: 28 and curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn away from the path that I enjoin upon you this day and follow other gods, whom you have not experienced.

content: 29 When the LORD your God brings you into the land that you are about to enter and possess, you shall pronounce the blessing at Mount Gerizim and the curse at Mount Ebal.—
content_old: 29 When the LORD your God brings you into the land that you are about to enter and possess, you shall pronounce the blessing at Mount Gerizim and the curse at Mount Ebal.—

content: 30 Both are on the other side of the Jordan, beyond the west road that is in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah—near Gilgal, by the terebinths of Moreh.
content_old: 30 Both are on the other side of the Jordan, beyond the west road that is in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah—near Gilgal, by the terebinths of Moreh.

content: 31 For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you. When you have occupied it and are settled in it,
content_old: 31 For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you. When you have occupied it and are settled in it,

content: 1 These are the laws and rules that you must carefully observe in the land that the LORD, God of your fathers, is giving you to possess, as long as you live on earth.
content_old: 1 These are the laws and rules that you must carefully observe in the land that the LORD, God of your fathers, is giving you to possess, as long as you live on earth.

content: 2 You must destroy all the sites at which the nations you are to dispossess worshiped their gods, whether on lofty mountains and on hills or under any luxuriant tree.
content_old: 2 You must destroy all the sites at which the nations you are to dispossess worshiped their gods, whether on lofty mountains and on hills or under any luxuriant tree.

content: 3 Tear down their altars, smash their pillars, put their sacred posts to the fire, and cut down the images of their gods, obliterating their name from that site.
content_old: 3 Tear down their altars, smash their pillars, put their sacred posts to the fire, and cut down the images of their gods, obliterating their name from that site.

content: 4 Do not worship the LORD your God in like manner,
content_old: 4 Do not worship the LORD your God in like manner,

content: 5 but look only to the site that the LORD your God will choose amidst all your tribes as His habitation, to establish His name there. There you are to go,
content_old: 5 but look only to the site that the LORD your God will choose amidst all your tribes as His habitation, to establish His name there. There you are to go,

content: 6 and there you are to bring your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions, your votive and freewill offerings, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks.
content_old: 6 and there you are to bring your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions, your votive and freewill offerings, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks.

content: 7 Together with your households, you shall feast there before the LORD your God, happy in all the undertakings in which the LORD your God has blessed you.
content_old: 7 Together with your households, you shall feast there before the LORD your God, happy in all the undertakings in which the LORD your God has blessed you.

content: 8 You shall not act at all as we now act here, every man as he pleases,
content_old: 8 You shall not act at all as we now act here, every man as he pleases,

content: 9 because you have not yet come to the allotted haven that the LORD your God is giving you.
content_old: 9 because you have not yet come to the allotted haven that the LORD your God is giving you.

content: 10 When you cross the Jordan and settle in the land that the LORD your God is allotting to you, and He grants you safety from all your enemies around you and you live in security,
content_old: 10 When you cross the Jordan and settle in the land that the LORD your God is allotting to you, and He grants you safety from all your enemies around you and you live in security,

content: 11 then you must bring everything that I command you to the site where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name: your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions, and all the choice votive offerings that you vow to the LORD.
content_old: 11 then you must bring everything that I command you to the site where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name: your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions, and all the choice votive offerings that you vow to the LORD.

content: 12 And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God with your sons and daughters and with your male and female slaves, along with the Levite in your settlements, for he has no territorial allotment among you.
content_old: 12 And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God with your sons and daughters and with your male and female slaves, along with the Levite in your settlements, for he has no territorial allotment among you.

content: 13 Take care not to sacrifice your burnt offerings in any place you like,
content_old: 13 Take care not to sacrifice your burnt offerings in any place you like,

content: 14 but only in the place that the LORD will choose in one of your tribal territories. There you shall sacrifice your burnt offerings and there you shall observe all that I enjoin upon you.
content_old: 14 but only in the place that the LORD will choose in one of your tribal territories. There you shall sacrifice your burnt offerings and there you shall observe all that I enjoin upon you.

content: 15 But whenever you desire, you may slaughter and eat meat in any of your settlements, according to the blessing that the LORD your God has granted you. The unclean and the clean alike may partake of it, as of the gazelle and the deer.
content_old: 15 But whenever you desire, you may slaughter and eat meat in any of your settlements, according to the blessing that the LORD your God has granted you. The unclean and the clean alike may partake of it, as of the gazelle and the deer.

content: 16 But you must not partake of the blood; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
content_old: 16 But you must not partake of the blood; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.

content: 17 You may not partake in your settlements of the tithes of your new grain or wine or oil, or of the firstlings of your herds and flocks, or of any of the votive offerings that you vow, or of your freewill offerings, or of your contributions.
content_old: 17 You may not partake in your settlements of the tithes of your new grain or wine or oil, or of the firstlings of your herds and flocks, or of any of the votive offerings that you vow, or of your freewill offerings, or of your contributions.

content: 18 These you must consume before the LORD your God in the place that the LORD your God will choose—you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, and the Levite in your settlements—happy before the LORD your God in all your undertakings.
content_old: 18 These you must consume before the LORD your God in the place that the LORD your God will choose—you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, and the Levite in your settlements—happy before the LORD your God in all your undertakings.

content: 19 Be sure not to neglect the Levite as long as you live in your land.
content_old: 19 Be sure not to neglect the Levite as long as you live in your land.

content: 20 When the LORD enlarges your territory, as He has promised you, and you say, “I shall eat some meat,” for you have the urge to eat meat, you may eat meat whenever you wish.
content_old: 20 When the LORD enlarges your territory, as He has promised you, and you say, “I shall eat some meat,” for you have the urge to eat meat, you may eat meat whenever you wish.

content: 21 If the place where the LORD has chosen to establish His name is too far from you, you may slaughter any of the cattle or sheep that the LORD gives you, as I have instructed you; and you may eat to your heart’s content in your settlements.
content_old: 21 If the place where the LORD has chosen to establish His name is too far from you, you may slaughter any of the cattle or sheep that the LORD gives you, as I have instructed you; and you may eat to your heart’s content in your settlements.

content: 22 Eat it, however, as the gazelle and the deer are eaten: the unclean may eat it together with the clean.
content_old: 22 Eat it, however, as the gazelle and the deer are eaten: the unclean may eat it together with the clean.

content: 23 But make sure that you do not partake of the blood; for the blood is the life, and you must not consume the life with the flesh.
content_old: 23 But make sure that you do not partake of the blood; for the blood is the life, and you must not consume the life with the flesh.

content: 24 You must not partake of it; you must pour it out on the ground like water:
content_old: 24 You must not partake of it; you must pour it out on the ground like water:

content: 25 you must not partake of it, in order that it may go well with you and with your descendants to come, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of the LORD.
content_old: 25 you must not partake of it, in order that it may go well with you and with your descendants to come, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of the LORD.

content: 26 But such sacred and votive donations as you may have shall be taken by you to the site that the LORD will choose.
content_old: 26 But such sacred and votive donations as you may have shall be taken by you to the site that the LORD will choose.

content: 27 You shall offer your burnt offerings, both the flesh and the blood, on the altar of the LORD your God; and of your other sacrifices, the blood shall be poured out on the altar of the LORD your God, and you shall eat the flesh.
content_old: 27 You shall offer your burnt offerings, both the flesh and the blood, on the altar of the LORD your God; and of your other sacrifices, the blood shall be poured out on the altar of the LORD your God, and you shall eat the flesh.

content: 28 Be careful to heed all these commandments that I enjoin upon you; thus it will go well with you and with your descendants after you forever, for you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of the LORD your God.
content_old: 28 Be careful to heed all these commandments that I enjoin upon you; thus it will go well with you and with your descendants after you forever, for you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of the LORD your God.

content: 29 When the LORD your God has cut down before you the nations that you are about to enter and dispossess, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their land,
content_old: 29 When the LORD your God has cut down before you the nations that you are about to enter and dispossess, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their land,

content: 30 beware of being lured into their ways after they have been wiped out before you! Do not inquire about their gods, saying, “How did those nations worship their gods? I too will follow those practices.”
content_old: 30 beware of being lured into their ways after they have been wiped out before you! Do not inquire about their gods, saying, “How did those nations worship their gods? I too will follow those practices.”

content: 1 Be careful to observe only that which I enjoin upon you: neither add to it nor take away from it.
content_old: 1 Be careful to observe only that which I enjoin upon you: neither add to it nor take away from it.

content: 2 If there appears among you a prophet or a dream-diviner and he gives you a sign or a portent,
content_old: 2 If there appears among you a prophet or a dream-diviner and he gives you a sign or a portent,

content: 3 saying, “Let us follow and worship another god”—whom you have not experienced—even if the sign or portent that he named to you comes true,
content_old: 3 saying, “Let us follow and worship another god”—whom you have not experienced—even if the sign or portent that he named to you comes true,

content: 4 do not heed the words of that prophet or that dream-diviner. For the LORD your God is testing you to see whether you really love the LORD your God with all your heart and soul.
content_old: 4 do not heed the words of that prophet or that dream-diviner. For the LORD your God is testing you to see whether you really love the LORD your God with all your heart and soul.

content: 5 Follow none but the LORD your God, and revere none but Him; observe His commandments alone, and heed only His orders; worship none but Him, and hold fast to Him.
content_old: 5 Follow none but the LORD your God, and revere none but Him; observe His commandments alone, and heed only His orders; worship none but Him, and hold fast to Him.

content: 6 As for that prophet or dream-diviner, he shall be put to death; for he urged disloyalty to the LORD your God—who freed you from the land of Egypt and who redeemed you from the house of bondage—to make you stray from the path that the LORD your God commanded you to follow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.
content_old: 6 As for that prophet or dream-diviner, he shall be put to death; for he urged disloyalty to the LORD your God—who freed you from the land of Egypt and who redeemed you from the house of bondage—to make you stray from the path that the LORD your God commanded you to follow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.

content: 7 If your brother, your own mother’s son, or your son or daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your closest friend entices you in secret, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom neither you nor your fathers have experienced—
content_old: 7 If your brother, your own mother’s son, or your son or daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your closest friend entices you in secret, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom neither you nor your fathers have experienced—

content: 8 from among the gods of the peoples around you, either near to you or distant, anywhere from one end of the earth to the other:
content_old: 8 from among the gods of the peoples around you, either near to you or distant, anywhere from one end of the earth to the other:

content: 9 do not assent or give heed to him. Show him no pity or compassion, and do not shield him;
content_old: 9 do not assent or give heed to him. Show him no pity or compassion, and do not shield him;

content: 10 but take his life. Let your hand be the first against him to put him to death, and the hand of the rest of the people thereafter.
content_old: 10 but take his life. Let your hand be the first against him to put him to death, and the hand of the rest of the people thereafter.

content: 11 Stone him to death, for he sought to make you stray from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
content_old: 11 Stone him to death, for he sought to make you stray from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

content: 12 Thus all Israel will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not be done again in your midst.
content_old: 12 Thus all Israel will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not be done again in your midst.

content: 13 If you hear it said, of one of the towns that the LORD your God is giving you to dwell in,
content_old: 13 If you hear it said, of one of the towns that the LORD your God is giving you to dwell in,

content: 14 that some scoundrels from among you have gone and subverted the inhabitants of their town, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom you have not experienced—
content_old: 14 that some scoundrels from among you have gone and subverted the inhabitants of their town, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom you have not experienced—

content: 15 you shall investigate and inquire and interrogate thoroughly. If it is true, the fact is established—that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in your midst—
content_old: 15 you shall investigate and inquire and interrogate thoroughly. If it is true, the fact is established—that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in your midst—

content: 16 put the inhabitants of that town to the sword and put its cattle to the sword. Doom it and all that is in it to destruction:
content_old: 16 put the inhabitants of that town to the sword and put its cattle to the sword. Doom it and all that is in it to destruction:

content: 17 gather all its spoil into the open square, and burn the town and all its spoil as a holocaust to the LORD your God. And it shall remain an everlasting ruin, never to be rebuilt.
content_old: 17 gather all its spoil into the open square, and burn the town and all its spoil as a holocaust to the LORD your God. And it shall remain an everlasting ruin, never to be rebuilt.

content: 18 Let nothing that has been doomed stick to your hand, in order that the LORD may turn from His blazing anger and show you compassion, and in His compassion increase you as He promised your fathers on oath—
content_old: 18 Let nothing that has been doomed stick to your hand, in order that the LORD may turn from His blazing anger and show you compassion, and in His compassion increase you as He promised your fathers on oath—

content: 1 You are children of the LORD your God. You shall not gash yourselves or shave the front of your heads because of the dead.
content_old: 1 You are children of the LORD your God. You shall not gash yourselves or shave the front of your heads because of the dead.

content: 2 For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God: the LORD your God chose you from among all other peoples on earth to be His treasured people.
content_old: 2 For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God: the LORD your God chose you from among all other peoples on earth to be His treasured people.

content: 3 You shall not eat anything abhorrent.
content_old: 3 You shall not eat anything abhorrent.

content: 4 These are the animals that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat;
content_old: 4 These are the animals that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat;

content: 5 the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, the mountain sheep,
content_old: 5 the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, the mountain sheep,

content: 6 and any other animal that has true hoofs which are cleft in two and brings up the cud—such you may eat.
content_old: 6 and any other animal that has true hoofs which are cleft in two and brings up the cud—such you may eat.

content: 7 But the following, which do bring up the cud or have true hoofs which are cleft through, you may not eat: the camel, the hare, and the daman—for although they bring up the cud, they have no true hoofs—they are unclean for you;
content_old: 7 But the following, which do bring up the cud or have true hoofs which are cleft through, you may not eat: the camel, the hare, and the daman—for although they bring up the cud, they have no true hoofs—they are unclean for you;

content: 8 also the swine—for although it has true hoofs, it does not bring up the cud—is unclean for you. You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses.
content_old: 8 also the swine—for although it has true hoofs, it does not bring up the cud—is unclean for you. You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses.

content: 9 These you may eat of all that live in water: you may eat anything that has fins and scales.
content_old: 9 These you may eat of all that live in water: you may eat anything that has fins and scales.

content: 10 But you may not eat anything that has no fins and scales: it is unclean for you.
content_old: 10 But you may not eat anything that has no fins and scales: it is unclean for you.

content: 11 You may eat any clean bird.
content_old: 11 You may eat any clean bird.

content: 12 The following you may not eat: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;
content_old: 12 The following you may not eat: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;

content: 13 the kite, the falcon, and the buzzard of any variety;
content_old: 13 the kite, the falcon, and the buzzard of any variety;

content: 14 every variety of raven;
content_old: 14 every variety of raven;

content: 15 the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and the hawk of any variety;
content_old: 15 the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and the hawk of any variety;

content: 16 the little owl, the great owl, and the white owl;
content_old: 16 the little owl, the great owl, and the white owl;

content: 17 the pelican, the bustard, and the cormorant;
content_old: 17 the pelican, the bustard, and the cormorant;

content: 18 the stork, any variety of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.
content_old: 18 the stork, any variety of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.

content: 19 All winged swarming things are unclean for you: they may not be eaten.
content_old: 19 All winged swarming things are unclean for you: they may not be eaten.

content: 20 You may eat only clean winged creatures.
content_old: 20 You may eat only clean winged creatures.

content: 21 You shall not eat anything that has died a natural death; give it to the stranger in your community to eat, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
content_old: 21 You shall not eat anything that has died a natural death; give it to the stranger in your community to eat, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.

content: 22 You shall set aside every year a tenth part of all the yield of your sowing that is brought from the field.
content_old: 22 You shall set aside every year a tenth part of all the yield of your sowing that is brought from the field.

content: 23 You shall consume the tithes of your new grain and wine and oil, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the LORD your God, in the place where He will choose to establish His name, so that you may learn to revere the LORD your God forever.
content_old: 23 You shall consume the tithes of your new grain and wine and oil, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the LORD your God, in the place where He will choose to establish His name, so that you may learn to revere the LORD your God forever.

content: 24 Should the distance be too great for you, should you be unable to transport them, because the place where the LORD your God has chosen to establish His name is far from you and because the LORD your God has blessed you,
content_old: 24 Should the distance be too great for you, should you be unable to transport them, because the place where the LORD your God has chosen to establish His name is far from you and because the LORD your God has blessed you,

content: 25 you may convert them into money. Wrap up the money and take it with you to the place that the LORD your God has chosen,
content_old: 25 you may convert them into money. Wrap up the money and take it with you to the place that the LORD your God has chosen,

content: 26 and spend the money on anything you want—cattle, sheep, wine, or other intoxicant, or anything you may desire. And you shall feast there, in the presence of the LORD your God, and rejoice with your household.
content_old: 26 and spend the money on anything you want—cattle, sheep, wine, or other intoxicant, or anything you may desire. And you shall feast there, in the presence of the LORD your God, and rejoice with your household.

content: 27 But do not neglect the Levite in your community, for he has no hereditary portion as you have.
content_old: 27 But do not neglect the Levite in your community, for he has no hereditary portion as you have.

content: 28 Every third year you shall bring out the full tithe of your yield of that year, but leave it within your settlements.
content_old: 28 Every third year you shall bring out the full tithe of your yield of that year, but leave it within your settlements.

content: 1 Every seventh year you shall practice remission of debts.
content_old: 1 Every seventh year you shall practice remission of debts.

content: 2 This shall be the nature of the remission: every creditor shall remit the due that he claims from his fellow; he shall not dun his fellow or kinsman, for the remission proclaimed is of the LORD.
content_old: 2 This shall be the nature of the remission: every creditor shall remit the due that he claims from his fellow; he shall not dun his fellow or kinsman, for the remission proclaimed is of the LORD.

content: 3 You may dun the foreigner; but you must remit whatever is due you from your kinsmen.
content_old: 3 You may dun the foreigner; but you must remit whatever is due you from your kinsmen.

content: 4 There shall be no needy among you—since the LORD your God will bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a hereditary portion—
content_old: 4 There shall be no needy among you—since the LORD your God will bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a hereditary portion—

content: 5 if only you heed the LORD your God and take care to keep all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.
content_old: 5 if only you heed the LORD your God and take care to keep all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.

content: 6 For the LORD your God will bless you as He has promised you: you will extend loans to many nations, but require none yourself; you will dominate many nations, but they will not dominate you.
content_old: 6 For the LORD your God will bless you as He has promised you: you will extend loans to many nations, but require none yourself; you will dominate many nations, but they will not dominate you.

content: 7 If, however, there is a needy person among you, one of your kinsmen in any of your settlements in the land that the LORD your God is giving you, do not harden your heart and shut your hand against your needy kinsman.
content_old: 7 If, however, there is a needy person among you, one of your kinsmen in any of your settlements in the land that the LORD your God is giving you, do not harden your heart and shut your hand against your needy kinsman.

content: 8 Rather, you must open your hand and lend him sufficient for whatever he needs.
content_old: 8 Rather, you must open your hand and lend him sufficient for whatever he needs.

content: 9 Beware lest you harbor the base thought, “The seventh year, the year of remission, is approaching,” so that you are mean to your needy kinsman and give him nothing. He will cry out to the LORD against you, and you will incur guilt.
content_old: 9 Beware lest you harbor the base thought, “The seventh year, the year of remission, is approaching,” so that you are mean to your needy kinsman and give him nothing. He will cry out to the LORD against you, and you will incur guilt.

content: 10 Give to him readily and have no regrets when you do so, for in return the LORD your God will bless you in all your efforts and in all your undertakings.
content_old: 10 Give to him readily and have no regrets when you do so, for in return the LORD your God will bless you in all your efforts and in all your undertakings.

content: 11 For there will never cease to be needy ones in your land, which is why I command you: open your hand to the poor and needy kinsman in your land.
content_old: 11 For there will never cease to be needy ones in your land, which is why I command you: open your hand to the poor and needy kinsman in your land.

content: 12 If a fellow Hebrew, man or woman, is sold to you, he shall serve you six years, and in the seventh year you shall set him free.
content_old: 12 If a fellow Hebrew, man or woman, is sold to you, he shall serve you six years, and in the seventh year you shall set him free.

content: 13 When you set him free, do not let him go empty-handed:
content_old: 13 When you set him free, do not let him go empty-handed:

content: 14 Furnish him out of the flock, threshing floor, and vat, with which the LORD your God has blessed you.
content_old: 14 Furnish him out of the flock, threshing floor, and vat, with which the LORD your God has blessed you.

content: 15 Bear in mind that you were slaves in the land of Egypt and the LORD your God redeemed you; therefore I enjoin this commandment upon you today.
content_old: 15 Bear in mind that you were slaves in the land of Egypt and the LORD your God redeemed you; therefore I enjoin this commandment upon you today.

content: 16 But should he say to you, “I do not want to leave you”—for he loves you and your household and is happy with you—
content_old: 16 But should he say to you, “I do not want to leave you”—for he loves you and your household and is happy with you—

content: 17 you shall take an awl and put it through his ear into the door, and he shall become your slave in perpetuity. Do the same with your female slave.
content_old: 17 you shall take an awl and put it through his ear into the door, and he shall become your slave in perpetuity. Do the same with your female slave.

content: 18 When you do set him free, do not feel aggrieved; for in the six years he has given you double the service of a hired man. Moreover, the LORD your God will bless you in all you do.
content_old: 18 When you do set him free, do not feel aggrieved; for in the six years he has given you double the service of a hired man. Moreover, the LORD your God will bless you in all you do.

content: 19 You shall consecrate to the LORD your God all male firstlings that are born in your herd and in your flock: you must not work your firstling ox or shear your firstling sheep.
content_old: 19 You shall consecrate to the LORD your God all male firstlings that are born in your herd and in your flock: you must not work your firstling ox or shear your firstling sheep.

content: 20 You and your household shall eat it annually before the LORD your God in the place that the LORD will choose.
content_old: 20 You and your household shall eat it annually before the LORD your God in the place that the LORD will choose.

content: 21 But if it has a defect, lameness or blindness, any serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.
content_old: 21 But if it has a defect, lameness or blindness, any serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.

content: 22 Eat it in your settlements, the unclean among you no less than the clean, just like the gazelle and the deer.
content_old: 22 Eat it in your settlements, the unclean among you no less than the clean, just like the gazelle and the deer.

content: 1 Observe the month of Abib and offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD your God, for it was in the month of Abib, at night, that the LORD your God freed you from Egypt.
content_old: 1 Observe the month of Abib and offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD your God, for it was in the month of Abib, at night, that the LORD your God freed you from Egypt.

content: 2 You shall slaughter the passover sacrifice for the LORD your God, from the flock and the herd, in the place where the LORD will choose to establish His name.
content_old: 2 You shall slaughter the passover sacrifice for the LORD your God, from the flock and the herd, in the place where the LORD will choose to establish His name.

content: 3 You shall not eat anything leavened with it; for seven days thereafter you shall eat unleavened bread, bread of distress—for you departed from the land of Egypt hurriedly—so that you may remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt as long as you live.
content_old: 3 You shall not eat anything leavened with it; for seven days thereafter you shall eat unleavened bread, bread of distress—for you departed from the land of Egypt hurriedly—so that you may remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt as long as you live.

content: 4 For seven days no leaven shall be found with you in all your territory, and none of the flesh of what you slaughter on the evening of the first day shall be left until morning.
content_old: 4 For seven days no leaven shall be found with you in all your territory, and none of the flesh of what you slaughter on the evening of the first day shall be left until morning.

content: 5 You are not permitted to slaughter the passover sacrifice in any of the settlements that the LORD your God is giving you;
content_old: 5 You are not permitted to slaughter the passover sacrifice in any of the settlements that the LORD your God is giving you;

content: 6 but at the place where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name, there alone shall you slaughter the passover sacrifice, in the evening, at sundown, the time of day when you departed from Egypt.
content_old: 6 but at the place where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name, there alone shall you slaughter the passover sacrifice, in the evening, at sundown, the time of day when you departed from Egypt.

content: 7 You shall cook and eat it at the place that the LORD your God will choose; and in the morning you may start back on your journey home.
content_old: 7 You shall cook and eat it at the place that the LORD your God will choose; and in the morning you may start back on your journey home.

content: 8 After eating unleavened bread six days, you shall hold a solemn gathering for the LORD your God on the seventh day: you shall do no work.
content_old: 8 After eating unleavened bread six days, you shall hold a solemn gathering for the LORD your God on the seventh day: you shall do no work.

content: 9 You shall count off seven weeks; start to count the seven weeks when the sickle is first put to the standing grain.
content_old: 9 You shall count off seven weeks; start to count the seven weeks when the sickle is first put to the standing grain.

content: 10 Then you shall observe the Feast of Weeks for the LORD your God, offering your freewill contribution according as the LORD your God has blessed you.
content_old: 10 Then you shall observe the Feast of Weeks for the LORD your God, offering your freewill contribution according as the LORD your God has blessed you.

content: 11 You shall rejoice before the LORD your God with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite in your communities, and the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your midst, at the place where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name.
content_old: 11 You shall rejoice before the LORD your God with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite in your communities, and the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your midst, at the place where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name.

content: 12 Bear in mind that you were slaves in Egypt, and take care to obey these laws.
content_old: 12 Bear in mind that you were slaves in Egypt, and take care to obey these laws.

content: 13 After the ingathering from your threshing floor and your vat, you shall hold the Feast of Booths for seven days.
content_old: 13 After the ingathering from your threshing floor and your vat, you shall hold the Feast of Booths for seven days.

content: 14 You shall rejoice in your festival, with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your communities.
content_old: 14 You shall rejoice in your festival, with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your communities.

content: 15 You shall hold a festival for the LORD your God seven days, in the place that the LORD will choose; for the LORD your God will bless all your crops and all your undertakings, and you shall have nothing but joy.
content_old: 15 You shall hold a festival for the LORD your God seven days, in the place that the LORD will choose; for the LORD your God will bless all your crops and all your undertakings, and you shall have nothing but joy.

content: 16 Three times a year—on the Feast of Unleavened Bread, on the Feast of Weeks, and on the Feast of Booths—all your males shall appear before the LORD your God in the place that He will choose. They shall not appear before the LORD empty-handed,
content_old: 16 Three times a year—on the Feast of Unleavened Bread, on the Feast of Weeks, and on the Feast of Booths—all your males shall appear before the LORD your God in the place that He will choose. They shall not appear before the LORD empty-handed,

content: 17 but each with his own gift, according to the blessing that the LORD your God has bestowed upon you.
content_old: 17 but each with his own gift, according to the blessing that the LORD your God has bestowed upon you.

content: 18 You shall appoint magistrates and officials for your tribes, in all the settlements that the LORD your God is giving you, and they shall govern the people with due justice.
content_old: 18 You shall appoint magistrates and officials for your tribes, in all the settlements that the LORD your God is giving you, and they shall govern the people with due justice.

content: 19 You shall not judge unfairly: you shall show no partiality; you shall not take bribes, for bribes blind the eyes of the discerning and upset the plea of the just.
content_old: 19 You shall not judge unfairly: you shall show no partiality; you shall not take bribes, for bribes blind the eyes of the discerning and upset the plea of the just.

content: 20 Justice, justice shall you pursue, that you may thrive and occupy the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
content_old: 20 Justice, justice shall you pursue, that you may thrive and occupy the land that the LORD your God is giving you.

content: 21 You shall not set up a sacred post—any kind of pole beside the altar of the LORD your God that you may make—
content_old: 21 You shall not set up a sacred post—any kind of pole beside the altar of the LORD your God that you may make—

content: 1 You shall not sacrifice to the LORD your God an ox or a sheep that has any defect of a serious kind, for that is abhorrent to the LORD your God.
content_old: 1 You shall not sacrifice to the LORD your God an ox or a sheep that has any defect of a serious kind, for that is abhorrent to the LORD your God.

content: 2 If there is found among you, in one of the settlements that the LORD your God is giving you, a man or woman who has affronted the LORD your God and transgressed His covenant—
content_old: 2 If there is found among you, in one of the settlements that the LORD your God is giving you, a man or woman who has affronted the LORD your God and transgressed His covenant—

content: 3 turning to the worship of other gods and bowing down to them, to the sun or the moon or any of the heavenly host, something I never commanded—
content_old: 3 turning to the worship of other gods and bowing down to them, to the sun or the moon or any of the heavenly host, something I never commanded—

content: 4 and you have been informed or have learned of it, then you shall make a thorough inquiry. If it is true, the fact is established, that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in Israel,
content_old: 4 and you have been informed or have learned of it, then you shall make a thorough inquiry. If it is true, the fact is established, that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in Israel,

content: 5 you shall take the man or the woman who did that wicked thing out to the public place, and you shall stone them, man or woman, to death.—
content_old: 5 you shall take the man or the woman who did that wicked thing out to the public place, and you shall stone them, man or woman, to death.—

content: 6 A person shall be put to death only on the testimony of two or more witnesses; he must not be put to death on the testimony of a single witness.—
content_old: 6 A person shall be put to death only on the testimony of two or more witnesses; he must not be put to death on the testimony of a single witness.—

content: 7 Let the hands of the witnesses be the first against him to put him to death, and the hands of the rest of the people thereafter. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.
content_old: 7 Let the hands of the witnesses be the first against him to put him to death, and the hands of the rest of the people thereafter. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.

content: 8 If a case is too baffling for you to decide, be it a controversy over homicide, civil law, or assault—matters of dispute in your courts—you shall promptly repair to the place that the LORD your God will have chosen,
content_old: 8 If a case is too baffling for you to decide, be it a controversy over homicide, civil law, or assault—matters of dispute in your courts—you shall promptly repair to the place that the LORD your God will have chosen,

content: 9 and appear before the levitical priests, or the magistrate in charge at the time, and present your problem. When they have announced to you the verdict in the case,
content_old: 9 and appear before the levitical priests, or the magistrate in charge at the time, and present your problem. When they have announced to you the verdict in the case,

content: 10 you shall carry out the verdict that is announced to you from that place that the LORD chose, observing scrupulously all their instructions to you.
content_old: 10 you shall carry out the verdict that is announced to you from that place that the LORD chose, observing scrupulously all their instructions to you.

content: 11 You shall act in accordance with the instructions given you and the ruling handed down to you; you must not deviate from the verdict that they announce to you either to the right or to the left.
content_old: 11 You shall act in accordance with the instructions given you and the ruling handed down to you; you must not deviate from the verdict that they announce to you either to the right or to the left.

content: 12 Should a man act presumptuously and disregard the priest charged with serving there the LORD your God, or the magistrate, that man shall die. Thus you will sweep out evil from Israel:
content_old: 12 Should a man act presumptuously and disregard the priest charged with serving there the LORD your God, or the magistrate, that man shall die. Thus you will sweep out evil from Israel:

content: 13 all the people will hear and be afraid and will not act presumptuously again.
content_old: 13 all the people will hear and be afraid and will not act presumptuously again.

content: 14 If, after you have entered the land that the LORD your God has assigned to you, and taken possession of it and settled in it, you decide, “I will set a king over me, as do all the nations about me,”
content_old: 14 If, after you have entered the land that the LORD your God has assigned to you, and taken possession of it and settled in it, you decide, “I will set a king over me, as do all the nations about me,”

content: 15 you shall be free to set a king over yourself, one chosen by the LORD your God. Be sure to set as king over yourself one of your own people; you must not set a foreigner over you, one who is not your kinsman.
content_old: 15 you shall be free to set a king over yourself, one chosen by the LORD your God. Be sure to set as king over yourself one of your own people; you must not set a foreigner over you, one who is not your kinsman.

content: 16 Moreover, he shall not keep many horses or send people back to Egypt to add to his horses, since the LORD has warned you, “You must not go back that way again.”
content_old: 16 Moreover, he shall not keep many horses or send people back to Egypt to add to his horses, since the LORD has warned you, “You must not go back that way again.”

content: 17 And he shall not have many wives, lest his heart go astray; nor shall he amass silver and gold to excess.
content_old: 17 And he shall not have many wives, lest his heart go astray; nor shall he amass silver and gold to excess.

content: 18 When he is seated on his royal throne, he shall have a copy of this Teaching written for him on a scroll by the levitical priests.
content_old: 18 When he is seated on his royal throne, he shall have a copy of this Teaching written for him on a scroll by the levitical priests.

content: 19 Let it remain with him and let him read in it all his life, so that he may learn to revere the LORD his God, to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching as well as these laws.
content_old: 19 Let it remain with him and let him read in it all his life, so that he may learn to revere the LORD his God, to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching as well as these laws.

content: 1 The levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, shall have no territorial portion with Israel. They shall live only off the LORD‘s offerings by fire as their portion,
content_old: 1 The levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, shall have no territorial portion with Israel. They shall live only off the LORD‘s offerings by fire as their portion,

content: 2 and shall have no portion among their brother tribes: the LORD is their portion, as He promised them.
content_old: 2 and shall have no portion among their brother tribes: the LORD is their portion, as He promised them.

content: 3 This then shall be the priests’ due from the people: Everyone who offers a sacrifice, whether an ox or a sheep, must give the shoulder, the cheeks, and the stomach to the priest.
content_old: 3 This then shall be the priests’ due from the people: Everyone who offers a sacrifice, whether an ox or a sheep, must give the shoulder, the cheeks, and the stomach to the priest.

content: 4 You shall also give him the first fruits of your new grain and wine and oil, and the first shearing of your sheep.
content_old: 4 You shall also give him the first fruits of your new grain and wine and oil, and the first shearing of your sheep.

content: 5 For the LORD your God has chosen him and his descendants, out of all your tribes, to be in attendance for service in the name of the LORD for all time.
content_old: 5 For the LORD your God has chosen him and his descendants, out of all your tribes, to be in attendance for service in the name of the LORD for all time.

content: 6 If a Levite would go, from any of the settlements throughout Israel where he has been residing, to the place that the LORD has chosen, he may do so whenever he pleases.
content_old: 6 If a Levite would go, from any of the settlements throughout Israel where he has been residing, to the place that the LORD has chosen, he may do so whenever he pleases.

content: 7 He may serve in the name of the LORD his God like all his fellow Levites who are there in attendance before the LORD.
content_old: 7 He may serve in the name of the LORD his God like all his fellow Levites who are there in attendance before the LORD.

content: 8 They shall receive equal shares of the dues, without regard to personal gifts or patrimonies.
content_old: 8 They shall receive equal shares of the dues, without regard to personal gifts or patrimonies.

content: 9 When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall not learn to imitate the abhorrent practices of those nations.
content_old: 9 When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall not learn to imitate the abhorrent practices of those nations.

content: 10 Let no one be found among you who consigns his son or daughter to the fire, or who is an augur, a soothsayer, a diviner, a sorcerer,
content_old: 10 Let no one be found among you who consigns his son or daughter to the fire, or who is an augur, a soothsayer, a diviner, a sorcerer,

content: 11 one who casts spells, or one who consults ghosts or familiar spirits, or one who inquires of the dead.
content_old: 11 one who casts spells, or one who consults ghosts or familiar spirits, or one who inquires of the dead.

content: 12 For anyone who does such things is abhorrent to the LORD, and it is because of these abhorrent things that the LORD your God is dispossessing them before you.
content_old: 12 For anyone who does such things is abhorrent to the LORD, and it is because of these abhorrent things that the LORD your God is dispossessing them before you.

content: 13 You must be wholehearted with the LORD your God.
content_old: 13 You must be wholehearted with the LORD your God.

content: 14 Those nations that you are about to dispossess do indeed resort to soothsayers and augurs; to you, however, the LORD your God has not assigned the like.
content_old: 14 Those nations that you are about to dispossess do indeed resort to soothsayers and augurs; to you, however, the LORD your God has not assigned the like.

content: 15 The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet from among your own people, like myself; him you shall heed.
content_old: 15 The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet from among your own people, like myself; him you shall heed.

content: 16 This is just what you asked of the LORD your God at Horeb, on the day of the Assembly, saying, “Let me not hear the voice of the LORD my God any longer or see this wondrous fire any more, lest I die.”
content_old: 16 This is just what you asked of the LORD your God at Horeb, on the day of the Assembly, saying, “Let me not hear the voice of the LORD my God any longer or see this wondrous fire any more, lest I die.”

content: 17 Whereupon the LORD said to me, “They have done well in speaking thus.
content_old: 17 Whereupon the LORD said to me, “They have done well in speaking thus.

content: 18 I will raise up a prophet for them from among their own people, like yourself: I will put My words in his mouth and he will speak to them all that I command him;
content_old: 18 I will raise up a prophet for them from among their own people, like yourself: I will put My words in his mouth and he will speak to them all that I command him;

content: 19 and if anybody fails to heed the words he speaks in My name, I myself will call him to account.
content_old: 19 and if anybody fails to heed the words he speaks in My name, I myself will call him to account.

content: 20 But any prophet who presumes to speak in My name an oracle that I did not command him to utter, or who speaks in the name of other gods—that prophet shall die.”
content_old: 20 But any prophet who presumes to speak in My name an oracle that I did not command him to utter, or who speaks in the name of other gods—that prophet shall die.”

content: 21 And should you ask yourselves, “How can we know that the oracle was not spoken by the LORD?”—
content_old: 21 And should you ask yourselves, “How can we know that the oracle was not spoken by the LORD?”—

content: 1 When the LORD your God has cut down the nations whose land the LORD your God is assigning to you, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their towns and homes,
content_old: 1 When the LORD your God has cut down the nations whose land the LORD your God is assigning to you, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their towns and homes,

content: 2 you shall set aside three cities in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
content_old: 2 you shall set aside three cities in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.

content: 3 You shall survey the distances, and divide into three parts the territory of the country that the LORD your God has allotted to you, so that any manslayer may have a place to flee to.
content_old: 3 You shall survey the distances, and divide into three parts the territory of the country that the LORD your God has allotted to you, so that any manslayer may have a place to flee to.

content: 4 —Now this is the case of the manslayer who may flee there and live: one who has killed another unwittingly, without having been his enemy in the past.
content_old: 4 —Now this is the case of the manslayer who may flee there and live: one who has killed another unwittingly, without having been his enemy in the past.

content: 5 For instance, a man goes with his neighbor into a grove to cut wood; as his hand swings the ax to cut down a tree, the ax-head flies off the handle and strikes the other so that he dies. That man shall flee to one of these cities and live.—
content_old: 5 For instance, a man goes with his neighbor into a grove to cut wood; as his hand swings the ax to cut down a tree, the ax-head flies off the handle and strikes the other so that he dies. That man shall flee to one of these cities and live.—

content: 6 Otherwise, when the distance is great, the blood-avenger, pursuing the manslayer in hot anger, may overtake him and kill him; yet he did not incur the death penalty, since he had never been the other’s enemy.
content_old: 6 Otherwise, when the distance is great, the blood-avenger, pursuing the manslayer in hot anger, may overtake him and kill him; yet he did not incur the death penalty, since he had never been the other’s enemy.

content: 7 That is why I command you: set aside three cities.
content_old: 7 That is why I command you: set aside three cities.

content: 8 And when the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land that He promised to give your fathers—
content_old: 8 And when the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land that He promised to give your fathers—

content: 9 if you faithfully observe all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day, to love the LORD your God and to walk in His ways at all times—then you shall add three more towns to those three.
content_old: 9 if you faithfully observe all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day, to love the LORD your God and to walk in His ways at all times—then you shall add three more towns to those three.

content: 10 Thus blood of the innocent will not be shed, bringing bloodguilt upon you in the land that the LORD your God is allotting to you.
content_old: 10 Thus blood of the innocent will not be shed, bringing bloodguilt upon you in the land that the LORD your God is allotting to you.

content: 11 If, however, a person who is the enemy of another lies in wait for him and sets upon him and strikes him a fatal blow and then flees to one of these towns,
content_old: 11 If, however, a person who is the enemy of another lies in wait for him and sets upon him and strikes him a fatal blow and then flees to one of these towns,

content: 12 the elders of his town shall have him brought back from there and shall hand him over to the blood-avenger to be put to death;
content_old: 12 the elders of his town shall have him brought back from there and shall hand him over to the blood-avenger to be put to death;

content: 13 you must show him no pity. Thus you will purge Israel of the blood of the innocent, and it will go well with you.
content_old: 13 you must show him no pity. Thus you will purge Israel of the blood of the innocent, and it will go well with you.

content: 14 You shall not move your countryman’s landmarks, set up by previous generations, in the property that will be allotted to you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
content_old: 14 You shall not move your countryman’s landmarks, set up by previous generations, in the property that will be allotted to you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.

content: 15 A single witness may not validate against a person any guilt or blame for any offense that may be committed; a case can be valid only on the testimony of two witnesses or more.
content_old: 15 A single witness may not validate against a person any guilt or blame for any offense that may be committed; a case can be valid only on the testimony of two witnesses or more.

content: 16 If a man appears against another to testify maliciously and gives false testimony against him,
content_old: 16 If a man appears against another to testify maliciously and gives false testimony against him,

content: 17 the two parties to the dispute shall appear before the LORD, before the priests or magistrates in authority at the time,
content_old: 17 the two parties to the dispute shall appear before the LORD, before the priests or magistrates in authority at the time,

content: 18 and the magistrates shall make a thorough investigation. If the man who testified is a false witness, if he has testified falsely against his fellow,
content_old: 18 and the magistrates shall make a thorough investigation. If the man who testified is a false witness, if he has testified falsely against his fellow,

content: 19 you shall do to him as he schemed to do to his fellow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst;
content_old: 19 you shall do to him as he schemed to do to his fellow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst;

content: 20 others will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not again be done in your midst.
content_old: 20 others will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not again be done in your midst.

content: 1 When you take the field against your enemies, and see horses and chariots—forces larger than yours—have no fear of them, for the LORD your God, who brought you from the land of Egypt, is with you.
