content_old: 1 When you take the field against your enemies, and see horses and chariots—forces larger than yours—have no fear of them, for the LORD your God, who brought you from the land of Egypt, is with you.

content: 2 Before you join battle, the priest shall come forward and address the troops.
content_old: 2 Before you join battle, the priest shall come forward and address the troops.

content: 3 He shall say to them, “Hear, O Israel! You are about to join battle with your enemy. Let not your courage falter. Do not be in fear, or in panic, or in dread of them.
content_old: 3 He shall say to them, “Hear, O Israel! You are about to join battle with your enemy. Let not your courage falter. Do not be in fear, or in panic, or in dread of them.

content: 4 For it is the LORD your God who marches with you to do battle for you against your enemy, to bring you victory.”
content_old: 4 For it is the LORD your God who marches with you to do battle for you against your enemy, to bring you victory.”

content: 5 Then the officials shall address the troops, as follows: “Is there anyone who has built a new house but has not dedicated it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another dedicate it.
content_old: 5 Then the officials shall address the troops, as follows: “Is there anyone who has built a new house but has not dedicated it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another dedicate it.

content: 6 Is there anyone who has planted a vineyard but has never harvested it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another harvest it.
content_old: 6 Is there anyone who has planted a vineyard but has never harvested it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another harvest it.

content: 7 Is there anyone who has paid the bride-price for a wife, but who has not yet married her? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another marry her.”
content_old: 7 Is there anyone who has paid the bride-price for a wife, but who has not yet married her? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another marry her.”

content: 8 The officials shall go on addressing the troops and say, “Is there anyone afraid and disheartened? Let him go back to his home, lest the courage of his comrades flag like his.”
content_old: 8 The officials shall go on addressing the troops and say, “Is there anyone afraid and disheartened? Let him go back to his home, lest the courage of his comrades flag like his.”

content: 9 When the officials have finished addressing the troops, army commanders shall assume command of the troops.
content_old: 9 When the officials have finished addressing the troops, army commanders shall assume command of the troops.

content: 10 When you approach a town to attack it, you shall offer it terms of peace.
content_old: 10 When you approach a town to attack it, you shall offer it terms of peace.

content: 11 If it responds peaceably and lets you in, all the people present there shall serve you at forced labor.
content_old: 11 If it responds peaceably and lets you in, all the people present there shall serve you at forced labor.

content: 12 If it does not surrender to you, but would join battle with you, you shall lay siege to it;
content_old: 12 If it does not surrender to you, but would join battle with you, you shall lay siege to it;

content: 13 and when the LORD your God delivers it into your hand, you shall put all its males to the sword.
content_old: 13 and when the LORD your God delivers it into your hand, you shall put all its males to the sword.

content: 14 You may, however, take as your booty the women, the children, the livestock, and everything in the town—all its spoil—and enjoy the use of the spoil of your enemy, which the LORD your God gives you.
content_old: 14 You may, however, take as your booty the women, the children, the livestock, and everything in the town—all its spoil—and enjoy the use of the spoil of your enemy, which the LORD your God gives you.

content: 15 Thus you shall deal with all towns that lie very far from you, towns that do not belong to nations hereabout.
content_old: 15 Thus you shall deal with all towns that lie very far from you, towns that do not belong to nations hereabout.

content: 16 In the towns of the latter peoples, however, which the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage, you shall not let a soul remain alive.
content_old: 16 In the towns of the latter peoples, however, which the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage, you shall not let a soul remain alive.

content: 17 No, you must proscribe them—the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites—as the LORD your God has commanded you,
content_old: 17 No, you must proscribe them—the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites—as the LORD your God has commanded you,

content: 18 lest they lead you into doing all the abhorrent things that they have done for their gods and you stand guilty before the LORD your God.
content_old: 18 lest they lead you into doing all the abhorrent things that they have done for their gods and you stand guilty before the LORD your God.

content: 19 When in your war against a city you have to besiege it a long time in order to capture it, you must not destroy its trees, wielding the ax against them. You may eat of them, but you must not cut them down. Are trees of the field human to withdraw before you into the besieged city?
content_old: 19 When in your war against a city you have to besiege it a long time in order to capture it, you must not destroy its trees, wielding the ax against them. You may eat of them, but you must not cut them down. Are trees of the field human to withdraw before you into the besieged city?

content: 1 If, in the land that the LORD your God is assigning you to possess, someone slain is found lying in the open, the identity of the slayer not being known,
content_old: 1 If, in the land that the LORD your God is assigning you to possess, someone slain is found lying in the open, the identity of the slayer not being known,

content: 2 your elders and magistrates shall go out and measure the distances from the corpse to the nearby towns.
content_old: 2 your elders and magistrates shall go out and measure the distances from the corpse to the nearby towns.

content: 3 The elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall then take a heifer which has never been worked, which has never pulled in a yoke;
content_old: 3 The elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall then take a heifer which has never been worked, which has never pulled in a yoke;

content: 4 and the elders of that town shall bring the heifer down to an everflowing wadi, which is not tilled or sown. There, in the wadi, they shall break the heifer’s neck.
content_old: 4 and the elders of that town shall bring the heifer down to an everflowing wadi, which is not tilled or sown. There, in the wadi, they shall break the heifer’s neck.

content: 5 The priests, sons of Levi, shall come forward; for the LORD your God has chosen them to minister to Him and to pronounce blessing in the name of the LORD, and every lawsuit and case of assault is subject to their ruling.
content_old: 5 The priests, sons of Levi, shall come forward; for the LORD your God has chosen them to minister to Him and to pronounce blessing in the name of the LORD, and every lawsuit and case of assault is subject to their ruling.

content: 6 Then all the elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the wadi.
content_old: 6 Then all the elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the wadi.

content: 7 And they shall make this declaration: “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it done.
content_old: 7 And they shall make this declaration: “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it done.

content: 8 Absolve, O LORD, Your people Israel whom You redeemed, and do not let guilt for the blood of the innocent remain among Your people Israel.” And they will be absolved of bloodguilt.
content_old: 8 Absolve, O LORD, Your people Israel whom You redeemed, and do not let guilt for the blood of the innocent remain among Your people Israel.” And they will be absolved of bloodguilt.

content: 9 Thus you will remove from your midst guilt for the blood of the innocent, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of the LORD.
content_old: 9 Thus you will remove from your midst guilt for the blood of the innocent, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of the LORD.

content: 10 When you take the field against your enemies, and the LORD your God delivers them into your power and you take some of them captive,
content_old: 10 When you take the field against your enemies, and the LORD your God delivers them into your power and you take some of them captive,

content: 11 and you see among the captives a beautiful woman and you desire her and would take her to wife,
content_old: 11 and you see among the captives a beautiful woman and you desire her and would take her to wife,

content: 12 you shall bring her into your house, and she shall trim her hair, pare her nails,
content_old: 12 you shall bring her into your house, and she shall trim her hair, pare her nails,

content: 13 and discard her captive’s garb. She shall spend a month’s time in your house lamenting her father and mother; after that you may come to her and possess her, and she shall be your wife.
content_old: 13 and discard her captive’s garb. She shall spend a month’s time in your house lamenting her father and mother; after that you may come to her and possess her, and she shall be your wife.

content: 14 Then, should you no longer want her, you must release her outright. You must not sell her for money: since you had your will of her, you must not enslave her.
content_old: 14 Then, should you no longer want her, you must release her outright. You must not sell her for money: since you had your will of her, you must not enslave her.

content: 15 If a man has two wives, one loved and the other unloved, and both the loved and the unloved have borne him sons, but the first-born is the son of the unloved one—
content_old: 15 If a man has two wives, one loved and the other unloved, and both the loved and the unloved have borne him sons, but the first-born is the son of the unloved one—

content: 16 when he wills his property to his sons, he may not treat as first-born the son of the loved one in disregard of the son of the unloved one who is older.
content_old: 16 when he wills his property to his sons, he may not treat as first-born the son of the loved one in disregard of the son of the unloved one who is older.

content: 17 Instead, he must accept the first-born, the son of the unloved one, and allot to him a double portion of all he possesses; since he is the first fruit of his vigor, the birthright is his due.
content_old: 17 Instead, he must accept the first-born, the son of the unloved one, and allot to him a double portion of all he possesses; since he is the first fruit of his vigor, the birthright is his due.

content: 18 If a man has a wayward and defiant son, who does not heed his father or mother and does not obey them even after they discipline him,
content_old: 18 If a man has a wayward and defiant son, who does not heed his father or mother and does not obey them even after they discipline him,

content: 19 his father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his town at the public place of his community.
content_old: 19 his father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his town at the public place of his community.

content: 20 They shall say to the elders of his town, “This son of ours is disloyal and defiant; he does not heed us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
content_old: 20 They shall say to the elders of his town, “This son of ours is disloyal and defiant; he does not heed us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”

content: 21 Thereupon the men of his town shall stone him to death. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst: all Israel will hear and be afraid.
content_old: 21 Thereupon the men of his town shall stone him to death. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst: all Israel will hear and be afraid.

content: 22 If a man is guilty of a capital offense and is put to death, and you impale him on a stake,
content_old: 22 If a man is guilty of a capital offense and is put to death, and you impale him on a stake,

content: 1 If you see your fellow’s ox or sheep gone astray, do not ignore it; you must take it back to your fellow.
content_old: 1 If you see your fellow’s ox or sheep gone astray, do not ignore it; you must take it back to your fellow.

content: 2 If your fellow does not live near you or you do not know who he is, you shall bring it home and it shall remain with you until your fellow claims it; then you shall give it back to him.
content_old: 2 If your fellow does not live near you or you do not know who he is, you shall bring it home and it shall remain with you until your fellow claims it; then you shall give it back to him.

content: 3 You shall do the same with his ass; you shall do the same with his garment; and so too shall you do with anything that your fellow loses and you find: you must not remain indifferent.
content_old: 3 You shall do the same with his ass; you shall do the same with his garment; and so too shall you do with anything that your fellow loses and you find: you must not remain indifferent.

content: 4 If you see your fellow’s ass or ox fallen on the road, do not ignore it; you must help him raise it.
content_old: 4 If you see your fellow’s ass or ox fallen on the road, do not ignore it; you must help him raise it.

content: 5 A woman must not put on man’s apparel, nor shall a man wear woman’s clothing; for whoever does these things is abhorrent to the LORD your God.
content_old: 5 A woman must not put on man’s apparel, nor shall a man wear woman’s clothing; for whoever does these things is abhorrent to the LORD your God.

content: 6 If, along the road, you chance upon a bird’s nest, in any tree or on the ground, with fledglings or eggs and the mother sitting over the fledglings or on the eggs, do not take the mother together with her young.
content_old: 6 If, along the road, you chance upon a bird’s nest, in any tree or on the ground, with fledglings or eggs and the mother sitting over the fledglings or on the eggs, do not take the mother together with her young.

content: 7 Let the mother go, and take only the young, in order that you may fare well and have a long life.
content_old: 7 Let the mother go, and take only the young, in order that you may fare well and have a long life.

content: 8 When you build a new house, you shall make a parapet for your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if anyone should fall from it.
content_old: 8 When you build a new house, you shall make a parapet for your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if anyone should fall from it.

content: 9 You shall not sow your vineyard with a second kind of seed, else the crop—from the seed you have sown—and the yield of the vineyard may not be used.
content_old: 9 You shall not sow your vineyard with a second kind of seed, else the crop—from the seed you have sown—and the yield of the vineyard may not be used.

content: 10 You shall not plow with an ox and an ass together.
content_old: 10 You shall not plow with an ox and an ass together.

content: 11 You shall not wear cloth combining wool and linen.
content_old: 11 You shall not wear cloth combining wool and linen.

content: 12 You shall make tassels on the four corners of the garment with which you cover yourself.
content_old: 12 You shall make tassels on the four corners of the garment with which you cover yourself.

content: 13 A man marries a woman and cohabits with her. Then he takes an aversion to her
content_old: 13 A man marries a woman and cohabits with her. Then he takes an aversion to her

content: 14 and makes up charges against her and defames her, saying, “I married this woman; but when I approached her, I found that she was not a virgin.”
content_old: 14 and makes up charges against her and defames her, saying, “I married this woman; but when I approached her, I found that she was not a virgin.”

content: 15 In such a case, the girl’s father and mother shall produce the evidence of the girl’s virginity before the elders of the town at the gate.
content_old: 15 In such a case, the girl’s father and mother shall produce the evidence of the girl’s virginity before the elders of the town at the gate.

content: 16 And the girl’s father shall say to the elders, “I gave this man my daughter to wife, but he has taken an aversion to her;
content_old: 16 And the girl’s father shall say to the elders, “I gave this man my daughter to wife, but he has taken an aversion to her;

content: 17 so he has made up charges, saying, ‘I did not find your daughter a virgin.’ But here is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity!” And they shall spread out the cloth before the elders of the town.
content_old: 17 so he has made up charges, saying, ‘I did not find your daughter a virgin.’ But here is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity!” And they shall spread out the cloth before the elders of the town.

content: 18 The elders of that town shall then take the man and flog him,
content_old: 18 The elders of that town shall then take the man and flog him,

content: 19 and they shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give it to the girl’s father; for the man has defamed a virgin in Israel. Moreover, she shall remain his wife; he shall never have the right to divorce her.
content_old: 19 and they shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give it to the girl’s father; for the man has defamed a virgin in Israel. Moreover, she shall remain his wife; he shall never have the right to divorce her.

content: 20 But if the charge proves true, the girl was found not to have been a virgin,
content_old: 20 But if the charge proves true, the girl was found not to have been a virgin,

content: 21 then the girl shall be brought out to the entrance of her father’s house, and the men of her town shall stone her to death; for she did a shameful thing in Israel, committing fornication while under her father’s authority. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.
content_old: 21 then the girl shall be brought out to the entrance of her father’s house, and the men of her town shall stone her to death; for she did a shameful thing in Israel, committing fornication while under her father’s authority. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.

content: 22 If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both of them—the man and the woman with whom he lay—shall die. Thus you will sweep away evil from Israel.
content_old: 22 If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both of them—the man and the woman with whom he lay—shall die. Thus you will sweep away evil from Israel.

content: 23 In the case of a virgin who is engaged to a man—if a man comes upon her in town and lies with her,
content_old: 23 In the case of a virgin who is engaged to a man—if a man comes upon her in town and lies with her,

content: 24 you shall take the two of them out to the gate of that town and stone them to death: the girl because she did not cry for help in the town, and the man because he violated another man’s wife. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.
content_old: 24 you shall take the two of them out to the gate of that town and stone them to death: the girl because she did not cry for help in the town, and the man because he violated another man’s wife. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.

content: 25 But if the man comes upon the engaged girl in the open country, and the man lies with her by force, only the man who lay with her shall die,
content_old: 25 But if the man comes upon the engaged girl in the open country, and the man lies with her by force, only the man who lay with her shall die,

content: 26 but you shall do nothing to the girl. The girl did not incur the death penalty, for this case is like that of a man attacking another and murdering him.
content_old: 26 but you shall do nothing to the girl. The girl did not incur the death penalty, for this case is like that of a man attacking another and murdering him.

content: 27 He came upon her in the open; though the engaged girl cried for help, there was no one to save her.
content_old: 27 He came upon her in the open; though the engaged girl cried for help, there was no one to save her.

content: 28 If a man comes upon a virgin who is not engaged and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,
content_old: 28 If a man comes upon a virgin who is not engaged and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,

content: 1 No man shall marry his father’s former wife, so as to remove his father’s garment.
content_old: 1 No man shall marry his father’s former wife, so as to remove his father’s garment.

content: 2 No one whose testes are crushed or whose member is cut off shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD.
content_old: 2 No one whose testes are crushed or whose member is cut off shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD.

content: 3 No one misbegotten shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD; none of his descendants, even in the tenth generation, shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD.
content_old: 3 No one misbegotten shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD; none of his descendants, even in the tenth generation, shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD.

content: 4 No Ammonite or Moabite shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD; none of their descendants, even in the tenth generation, shall ever be admitted into the congregation of the LORD,
content_old: 4 No Ammonite or Moabite shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD; none of their descendants, even in the tenth generation, shall ever be admitted into the congregation of the LORD,

content: 5 because they did not meet you with food and water on your journey after you left Egypt, and because they hired Balaam son of Beor, from Pethor of Aramnaharaim, to curse you.—
content_old: 5 because they did not meet you with food and water on your journey after you left Egypt, and because they hired Balaam son of Beor, from Pethor of Aramnaharaim, to curse you.—

content: 6 But the LORD your God refused to heed Balaam; instead, the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, for the LORD your God loves you.—
content_old: 6 But the LORD your God refused to heed Balaam; instead, the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, for the LORD your God loves you.—

content: 7 You shall never concern yourself with their welfare or benefit as long as you live.
content_old: 7 You shall never concern yourself with their welfare or benefit as long as you live.

content: 8 You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your kinsman. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, for you were a stranger in his land.
content_old: 8 You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your kinsman. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, for you were a stranger in his land.

content: 9 Children born to them may be admitted into the congregation of the LORD in the third generation.
content_old: 9 Children born to them may be admitted into the congregation of the LORD in the third generation.

content: 10 When you go out as a troop against your enemies, be on your guard against anything untoward.
content_old: 10 When you go out as a troop against your enemies, be on your guard against anything untoward.

content: 11 If anyone among you has been rendered unclean by a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp, and he must not reenter the camp.
content_old: 11 If anyone among you has been rendered unclean by a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp, and he must not reenter the camp.

content: 12 Toward evening he shall bathe in water, and at sundown he may reenter the camp.
content_old: 12 Toward evening he shall bathe in water, and at sundown he may reenter the camp.

content: 13 Further, there shall be an area for you outside the camp, where you may relieve yourself.
content_old: 13 Further, there shall be an area for you outside the camp, where you may relieve yourself.

content: 14 With your gear you shall have a spike, and when you have squatted you shall dig a hole with it and cover up your excrement.
content_old: 14 With your gear you shall have a spike, and when you have squatted you shall dig a hole with it and cover up your excrement.

content: 15 Since the LORD your God moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you, let your camp be holy; let Him not find anything unseemly among you and turn away from you.
content_old: 15 Since the LORD your God moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you, let your camp be holy; let Him not find anything unseemly among you and turn away from you.

content: 16 You shall not turn over to his master a slave who seeks refuge with you from his master.
content_old: 16 You shall not turn over to his master a slave who seeks refuge with you from his master.

content: 17 He shall live with you in any place he may choose among the settlements in your midst, wherever he pleases; you must not ill-treat him.
content_old: 17 He shall live with you in any place he may choose among the settlements in your midst, wherever he pleases; you must not ill-treat him.

content: 18 No Israelite woman shall be a cult prostitute, nor shall any Israelite man be a cult prostitute.
content_old: 18 No Israelite woman shall be a cult prostitute, nor shall any Israelite man be a cult prostitute.

content: 19 You shall not bring the fee of a whore or the pay of a dog into the house of the LORD your God in fulfillment of any vow, for both are abhorrent to the LORD your God.
content_old: 19 You shall not bring the fee of a whore or the pay of a dog into the house of the LORD your God in fulfillment of any vow, for both are abhorrent to the LORD your God.

content: 20 You shall not deduct interest from loans to your countrymen, whether in money or food or anything else that can be deducted as interest;
content_old: 20 You shall not deduct interest from loans to your countrymen, whether in money or food or anything else that can be deducted as interest;

content: 21 but you may deduct interest from loans to foreigners. Do not deduct interest from loans to your countrymen, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all your undertakings in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
content_old: 21 but you may deduct interest from loans to foreigners. Do not deduct interest from loans to your countrymen, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all your undertakings in the land that you are about to enter and possess.

content: 22 When you make a vow to the LORD your God, do not put off fulfilling it, for the LORD your God will require it of you, and you will have incurred guilt;
content_old: 22 When you make a vow to the LORD your God, do not put off fulfilling it, for the LORD your God will require it of you, and you will have incurred guilt;

content: 23 whereas you incur no guilt if you refrain from vowing.
content_old: 23 whereas you incur no guilt if you refrain from vowing.

content: 24 You must fulfill what has crossed your lips and perform what you have voluntarily vowed to the LORD your God, having made the promise with your own mouth.
content_old: 24 You must fulfill what has crossed your lips and perform what you have voluntarily vowed to the LORD your God, having made the promise with your own mouth.

content: 25 When you enter another man’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you want, until you are full, but you must not put any in your vessel.
content_old: 25 When you enter another man’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you want, until you are full, but you must not put any in your vessel.

content: 1 A man takes a wife and possesses her. She fails to please him because he finds something obnoxious about her, and he writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house;
content_old: 1 A man takes a wife and possesses her. She fails to please him because he finds something obnoxious about her, and he writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house;

content: 2 she leaves his household and becomes the wife of another man;
content_old: 2 she leaves his household and becomes the wife of another man;

content: 3 then this latter man rejects her, writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house; or the man who married her last dies.
content_old: 3 then this latter man rejects her, writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house; or the man who married her last dies.

content: 4 Then the first husband who divorced her shall not take her to wife again, since she has been defiled—for that would be abhorrent to the LORD. You must not bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage.
content_old: 4 Then the first husband who divorced her shall not take her to wife again, since she has been defiled—for that would be abhorrent to the LORD. You must not bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage.

content: 5 When a man has taken a bride, he shall not go out with the army or be assigned to it for any purpose; he shall be exempt one year for the sake of his household, to give happiness to the woman he has married.
content_old: 5 When a man has taken a bride, he shall not go out with the army or be assigned to it for any purpose; he shall be exempt one year for the sake of his household, to give happiness to the woman he has married.

content: 6 A handmill or an upper millstone shall not be taken in pawn, for that would be taking someone’s life in pawn.
content_old: 6 A handmill or an upper millstone shall not be taken in pawn, for that would be taking someone’s life in pawn.

content: 7 If a man is found to have kidnapped a fellow Israelite, enslaving him or selling him, that kidnapper shall die; thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.
content_old: 7 If a man is found to have kidnapped a fellow Israelite, enslaving him or selling him, that kidnapper shall die; thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.

content: 8 In cases of a skin affection be most careful to do exactly as the levitical priests instruct you. Take care to do as I have commanded them.
content_old: 8 In cases of a skin affection be most careful to do exactly as the levitical priests instruct you. Take care to do as I have commanded them.

content: 9 Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the journey after you left Egypt.
content_old: 9 Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the journey after you left Egypt.

content: 10 When you make a loan of any sort to your countryman, you must not enter his house to seize his pledge.
content_old: 10 When you make a loan of any sort to your countryman, you must not enter his house to seize his pledge.

content: 11 You must remain outside, while the man to whom you made the loan brings the pledge out to you.
content_old: 11 You must remain outside, while the man to whom you made the loan brings the pledge out to you.

content: 12 If he is a needy man, you shall not go to sleep in his pledge;
content_old: 12 If he is a needy man, you shall not go to sleep in his pledge;

content: 13 you must return the pledge to him at sundown, that he may sleep in his cloth and bless you; and it will be to your merit before the LORD your God.
content_old: 13 you must return the pledge to him at sundown, that he may sleep in his cloth and bless you; and it will be to your merit before the LORD your God.

content: 14 You shall not abuse a needy and destitute laborer, whether a fellow countryman or a stranger in one of the communities of your land.
content_old: 14 You shall not abuse a needy and destitute laborer, whether a fellow countryman or a stranger in one of the communities of your land.

content: 15 You must pay him his wages on the same day, before the sun sets, for he is needy and urgently depends on it; else he will cry to the LORD against you and you will incur guilt.
content_old: 15 You must pay him his wages on the same day, before the sun sets, for he is needy and urgently depends on it; else he will cry to the LORD against you and you will incur guilt.

content: 16 Parents shall not be put to death for children, nor children be put to death for parents: a person shall be put to death only for his own crime.
content_old: 16 Parents shall not be put to death for children, nor children be put to death for parents: a person shall be put to death only for his own crime.

content: 17 You shall not subvert the rights of the stranger or the fatherless; you shall not take a widow’s garment in pawn.
content_old: 17 You shall not subvert the rights of the stranger or the fatherless; you shall not take a widow’s garment in pawn.

content: 18 Remember that you were a slave in Egypt and that the LORD your God redeemed you from there; therefore do I enjoin you to observe this commandment.
content_old: 18 Remember that you were a slave in Egypt and that the LORD your God redeemed you from there; therefore do I enjoin you to observe this commandment.

content: 19 When you reap the harvest in your field and overlook a sheaf in the field, do not turn back to get it; it shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow—in order that the LORD your God may bless you in all your undertakings.
content_old: 19 When you reap the harvest in your field and overlook a sheaf in the field, do not turn back to get it; it shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow—in order that the LORD your God may bless you in all your undertakings.

content: 20 When you beat down the fruit of your olive trees, do not go over them again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.
content_old: 20 When you beat down the fruit of your olive trees, do not go over them again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.

content: 21 When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, do not pick it over again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.
content_old: 21 When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, do not pick it over again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.

content: 1 When there is a dispute between men and they go to law, and a decision is rendered declaring the one in the right and the other in the wrong—
content_old: 1 When there is a dispute between men and they go to law, and a decision is rendered declaring the one in the right and the other in the wrong—

content: 2 if the guilty one is to be flogged, the magistrate shall have him lie down and be given lashes in his presence, by count, as his guilt warrants.
content_old: 2 if the guilty one is to be flogged, the magistrate shall have him lie down and be given lashes in his presence, by count, as his guilt warrants.

content: 3 He may be given up to forty lashes, but not more, lest being flogged further, to excess, your brother be degraded before your eyes.
content_old: 3 He may be given up to forty lashes, but not more, lest being flogged further, to excess, your brother be degraded before your eyes.

content: 4 You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing.
content_old: 4 You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing.

content: 5 When brothers dwell together and one of them dies and leaves no son, the wife of the deceased shall not be married to a stranger, outside the family. Her husband’s brother shall unite with her: he shall take her as his wife and perform the levir’s duty.
content_old: 5 When brothers dwell together and one of them dies and leaves no son, the wife of the deceased shall not be married to a stranger, outside the family. Her husband’s brother shall unite with her: he shall take her as his wife and perform the levir’s duty.

content: 6 The first son that she bears shall be accounted to the dead brother, that his name may not be blotted out in Israel.
content_old: 6 The first son that she bears shall be accounted to the dead brother, that his name may not be blotted out in Israel.

content: 7 But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, his brother’s widow shall appear before the elders in the gate and declare, “My husband’s brother refuses to establish a name in Israel for his brother; he will not perform the duty of a levir.”
content_old: 7 But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, his brother’s widow shall appear before the elders in the gate and declare, “My husband’s brother refuses to establish a name in Israel for his brother; he will not perform the duty of a levir.”

content: 8 The elders of his town shall then summon him and talk to him. If he insists, saying, “I do not want to marry her,”
content_old: 8 The elders of his town shall then summon him and talk to him. If he insists, saying, “I do not want to marry her,”

content: 9 his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, pull the sandal off his foot, spit in his face, and make this declaration: Thus shall be done to the man who will not build up his brother’s house!
content_old: 9 his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, pull the sandal off his foot, spit in his face, and make this declaration: Thus shall be done to the man who will not build up his brother’s house!

content: 10 And he shall go in Israel by the name of “the family of the unsandaled one.”
content_old: 10 And he shall go in Israel by the name of “the family of the unsandaled one.”

content: 11 If two men get into a fight with each other, and the wife of one comes up to save her husband from his antagonist and puts out her hand and seizes him by his genitals,
content_old: 11 If two men get into a fight with each other, and the wife of one comes up to save her husband from his antagonist and puts out her hand and seizes him by his genitals,

content: 12 you shall cut off her hand; show no pity.
content_old: 12 you shall cut off her hand; show no pity.

content: 13 You shall not have in your pouch alternate weights, larger and smaller.
content_old: 13 You shall not have in your pouch alternate weights, larger and smaller.

content: 14 You shall not have in your house alternate measures, a larger and a smaller.
content_old: 14 You shall not have in your house alternate measures, a larger and a smaller.

content: 15 You must have completely honest weights and completely honest measures, if you are to endure long on the soil that the LORD your God is giving you.
content_old: 15 You must have completely honest weights and completely honest measures, if you are to endure long on the soil that the LORD your God is giving you.

content: 16 For everyone who does those things, everyone who deals dishonestly, is abhorrent to the LORD your God.
content_old: 16 For everyone who does those things, everyone who deals dishonestly, is abhorrent to the LORD your God.

content: 17 Remember what Amalek did to you on your journey, after you left Egypt—
content_old: 17 Remember what Amalek did to you on your journey, after you left Egypt—

content: 18 how, undeterred by fear of God, he surprised you on the march, when you were famished and weary, and cut down all the stragglers in your rear.
content_old: 18 how, undeterred by fear of God, he surprised you on the march, when you were famished and weary, and cut down all the stragglers in your rear.

content: 1 When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage, and you possess it and settle in it,
content_old: 1 When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage, and you possess it and settle in it,

content: 2 you shall take some of every first fruit of the soil, which you harvest from the land that the LORD your God is giving you, put it in a basket and go to the place where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name.
content_old: 2 you shall take some of every first fruit of the soil, which you harvest from the land that the LORD your God is giving you, put it in a basket and go to the place where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name.

content: 3 You shall go to the priest in charge at that time and say to him, “I acknowledge this day before the LORD your God that I have entered the land that the LORD swore to our fathers to assign us.”
content_old: 3 You shall go to the priest in charge at that time and say to him, “I acknowledge this day before the LORD your God that I have entered the land that the LORD swore to our fathers to assign us.”

content: 4 The priest shall take the basket from your hand and set it down in front of the altar of the LORD your God.
content_old: 4 The priest shall take the basket from your hand and set it down in front of the altar of the LORD your God.

content: 5 You shall then recite as follows before the LORD your God: “My father was a fugitive Aramean. He went down to Egypt with meager numbers and sojourned there; but there he became a great and very populous nation.
content_old: 5 You shall then recite as follows before the LORD your God: “My father was a fugitive Aramean. He went down to Egypt with meager numbers and sojourned there; but there he became a great and very populous nation.

content: 6 The Egyptians dealt harshly with us and oppressed us; they imposed heavy labor upon us.
content_old: 6 The Egyptians dealt harshly with us and oppressed us; they imposed heavy labor upon us.

content: 7 We cried to the LORD, the God of our fathers, and the LORD heard our plea and saw our plight, our misery, and our oppression.
content_old: 7 We cried to the LORD, the God of our fathers, and the LORD heard our plea and saw our plight, our misery, and our oppression.

content: 8 The LORD freed us from Egypt by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm and awesome power, and by signs and portents.
content_old: 8 The LORD freed us from Egypt by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm and awesome power, and by signs and portents.

content: 9 He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 9 He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 10 Wherefore I now bring the first fruits of the soil which You, O LORD, have given me.” You shall leave it before the LORD your God and bow low before the LORD your God.
content_old: 10 Wherefore I now bring the first fruits of the soil which You, O LORD, have given me.” You shall leave it before the LORD your God and bow low before the LORD your God.

content: 11 And you shall enjoy, together with the Levite and the stranger in your midst, all the bounty that the LORD your God has bestowed upon you and your household.
content_old: 11 And you shall enjoy, together with the Levite and the stranger in your midst, all the bounty that the LORD your God has bestowed upon you and your household.

content: 12 When you have set aside in full the tenth part of your yield—in the third year, the year of the tithe—and have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat their fill in your settlements,
content_old: 12 When you have set aside in full the tenth part of your yield—in the third year, the year of the tithe—and have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat their fill in your settlements,

content: 13 you shall declare before the LORD your God: “I have cleared out the consecrated portion from the house; and I have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, just as You commanded me; I have neither transgressed nor neglected any of Your commandments:
content_old: 13 you shall declare before the LORD your God: “I have cleared out the consecrated portion from the house; and I have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, just as You commanded me; I have neither transgressed nor neglected any of Your commandments:

content: 14 I have not eaten of it while in mourning, I have not cleared out any of it while I was unclean, and I have not deposited any of it with the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done just as You commanded me.
content_old: 14 I have not eaten of it while in mourning, I have not cleared out any of it while I was unclean, and I have not deposited any of it with the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done just as You commanded me.

content: 15 Look down from Your holy abode, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the soil You have given us, a land flowing with milk and honey, as You swore to our fathers.”
content_old: 15 Look down from Your holy abode, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the soil You have given us, a land flowing with milk and honey, as You swore to our fathers.”

content: 16 The LORD your God commands you this day to observe these laws and rules; observe them faithfully with all your heart and soul.
content_old: 16 The LORD your God commands you this day to observe these laws and rules; observe them faithfully with all your heart and soul.

content: 17 You have affirmed this day that the LORD is your God, that you will walk in His ways, that you will observe His laws and commandments and rules, and that you will obey Him.
content_old: 17 You have affirmed this day that the LORD is your God, that you will walk in His ways, that you will observe His laws and commandments and rules, and that you will obey Him.

content: 18 And the LORD has affirmed this day that you are, as He promised you, His treasured people who shall observe all His commandments,
content_old: 18 And the LORD has affirmed this day that you are, as He promised you, His treasured people who shall observe all His commandments,

content: 1 Moses and the elders of Israel charged the people, saying: Observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.
content_old: 1 Moses and the elders of Israel charged the people, saying: Observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.

content: 2 As soon as you have crossed the Jordan into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall set up large stones. Coat them with plaster
content_old: 2 As soon as you have crossed the Jordan into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall set up large stones. Coat them with plaster

content: 3 and inscribe upon them all the words of this Teaching. When you cross over to enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as the LORD, the God of your fathers, promised you—
content_old: 3 and inscribe upon them all the words of this Teaching. When you cross over to enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as the LORD, the God of your fathers, promised you—

content: 4 upon crossing the Jordan, you shall set up these stones, about which I charge you this day, on Mount Ebal, and coat them with plaster.
content_old: 4 upon crossing the Jordan, you shall set up these stones, about which I charge you this day, on Mount Ebal, and coat them with plaster.

content: 5 There, too, you shall build an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. Do not wield an iron tool over them;
content_old: 5 There, too, you shall build an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. Do not wield an iron tool over them;

content: 6 you must build the altar of the LORD your God of unhewn stones. You shall offer on it burnt offerings to the LORD your God,
content_old: 6 you must build the altar of the LORD your God of unhewn stones. You shall offer on it burnt offerings to the LORD your God,

content: 7 and you shall sacrifice there offerings of well-being and eat them, rejoicing before the LORD your God.
content_old: 7 and you shall sacrifice there offerings of well-being and eat them, rejoicing before the LORD your God.

content: 8 And on those stones you shall inscribe every word of this Teaching most distinctly.
content_old: 8 And on those stones you shall inscribe every word of this Teaching most distinctly.

content: 9 Moses and the levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying: Silence! Hear, O Israel! Today you have become the people of the LORD your God:
content_old: 9 Moses and the levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying: Silence! Hear, O Israel! Today you have become the people of the LORD your God:

content: 10 Heed the LORD your God and observe His commandments and His laws, which I enjoin upon you this day.
content_old: 10 Heed the LORD your God and observe His commandments and His laws, which I enjoin upon you this day.

content: 11 Thereupon Moses charged the people, saying:
content_old: 11 Thereupon Moses charged the people, saying:

content: 12 After you have crossed the Jordan, the following shall stand on Mount Gerizim when the blessing for the people is spoken: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
content_old: 12 After you have crossed the Jordan, the following shall stand on Mount Gerizim when the blessing for the people is spoken: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.

content: 13 And for the curse, the following shall stand on Mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphthali.
content_old: 13 And for the curse, the following shall stand on Mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphthali.

content: 14 The Levites shall then proclaim in a loud voice to all the people of Israel:
content_old: 14 The Levites shall then proclaim in a loud voice to all the people of Israel:

content: 15 Cursed be anyone who makes a sculptured or molten image, abhorred by the LORD, a craftsman’s handiwork, and sets it up in secret.—And all the people shall respond, Amen.
content_old: 15 Cursed be anyone who makes a sculptured or molten image, abhorred by the LORD, a craftsman’s handiwork, and sets it up in secret.—And all the people shall respond, Amen.

content: 16 Cursed be he who insults his father or mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 16 Cursed be he who insults his father or mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 17 Cursed be he who moves his fellow countryman’s landmark.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 17 Cursed be he who moves his fellow countryman’s landmark.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 18 Cursed be he who misdirects a blind person on his way.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 18 Cursed be he who misdirects a blind person on his way.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 19 Cursed be he who subverts the rights of the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 19 Cursed be he who subverts the rights of the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 20 Cursed be he who lies with his father’s wife, for he has removed his father’s garment.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 20 Cursed be he who lies with his father’s wife, for he has removed his father’s garment.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 21 Cursed be he who lies with any beast.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 21 Cursed be he who lies with any beast.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 22 Cursed be he who lies with his sister, whether daughter of his father or of his mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 22 Cursed be he who lies with his sister, whether daughter of his father or of his mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 23 Cursed be he who lies with his mother-in-law.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 23 Cursed be he who lies with his mother-in-law.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 24 Cursed be he who strikes down his fellow countryman in secret.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 24 Cursed be he who strikes down his fellow countryman in secret.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 25 Cursed be he who accepts a bribe in the case of the murder of an innocent person.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
content_old: 25 Cursed be he who accepts a bribe in the case of the murder of an innocent person.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

content: 1 Now, if you obey the LORD your God, to observe faithfully all His commandments which I enjoin upon you this day, the LORD your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.
content_old: 1 Now, if you obey the LORD your God, to observe faithfully all His commandments which I enjoin upon you this day, the LORD your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.

content: 2 All these blessings shall come upon you and take effect, if you will but heed the word of the LORD your God:
content_old: 2 All these blessings shall come upon you and take effect, if you will but heed the word of the LORD your God:

content: 3 Blessed shall you be in the city and blessed shall you be in the country.
content_old: 3 Blessed shall you be in the city and blessed shall you be in the country.

content: 4 Blessed shall be the issue of your womb, the produce of your soil, and the offspring of your cattle, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.
content_old: 4 Blessed shall be the issue of your womb, the produce of your soil, and the offspring of your cattle, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.

content: 5 Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
content_old: 5 Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.

content: 6 Blessed shall you be in your comings and blessed shall you be in your goings.
content_old: 6 Blessed shall you be in your comings and blessed shall you be in your goings.

content: 7 The LORD will put to rout before you the enemies who attack you; they will march out against you by a single road, but flee from you by many roads.
content_old: 7 The LORD will put to rout before you the enemies who attack you; they will march out against you by a single road, but flee from you by many roads.

content: 8 The LORD will ordain blessings for you upon your barns and upon all your undertakings: He will bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
content_old: 8 The LORD will ordain blessings for you upon your barns and upon all your undertakings: He will bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.

content: 9 The LORD will establish you as His holy people, as He swore to you, if you keep the commandments of the LORD your God and walk in His ways.
content_old: 9 The LORD will establish you as His holy people, as He swore to you, if you keep the commandments of the LORD your God and walk in His ways.

content: 10 And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the LORD‘s name is proclaimed over you, and they shall stand in fear of you.
content_old: 10 And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the LORD‘s name is proclaimed over you, and they shall stand in fear of you.

content: 11 The LORD will give you abounding prosperity in the issue of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to assign to you.
content_old: 11 The LORD will give you abounding prosperity in the issue of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to assign to you.

content: 12 The LORD will open for you His bounteous store, the heavens, to provide rain for your land in season and to bless all your undertakings. You will be creditor to many nations, but debtor to none.
content_old: 12 The LORD will open for you His bounteous store, the heavens, to provide rain for your land in season and to bless all your undertakings. You will be creditor to many nations, but debtor to none.

content: 13 The LORD will make you the head, not the tail; you will always be at the top and never at the bottom—if only you obey and faithfully observe the commandments of the LORD your God that I enjoin upon you this day,
content_old: 13 The LORD will make you the head, not the tail; you will always be at the top and never at the bottom—if only you obey and faithfully observe the commandments of the LORD your God that I enjoin upon you this day,

content: 14 and do not deviate to the right or to the left from any of the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day and turn to the worship of other gods.
content_old: 14 and do not deviate to the right or to the left from any of the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day and turn to the worship of other gods.

content: 15 But if you do not obey the LORD your God to observe faithfully all His commandments and laws which I enjoin upon you this day, all these curses shall come upon you and take effect:
content_old: 15 But if you do not obey the LORD your God to observe faithfully all His commandments and laws which I enjoin upon you this day, all these curses shall come upon you and take effect:

content: 16 Cursed shall you be in the city and cursed shall you be in the country.
content_old: 16 Cursed shall you be in the city and cursed shall you be in the country.

content: 17 Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
content_old: 17 Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.

content: 18 Cursed shall be the issue of your womb and the produce of your soil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.
content_old: 18 Cursed shall be the issue of your womb and the produce of your soil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.

content: 19 Cursed shall you be in your comings and cursed shall you be in your goings.
content_old: 19 Cursed shall you be in your comings and cursed shall you be in your goings.

content: 20 The LORD will let loose against you calamity, panic, and frustration in all the enterprises you undertake, so that you shall soon be utterly wiped out because of your evildoing in forsaking Me.
content_old: 20 The LORD will let loose against you calamity, panic, and frustration in all the enterprises you undertake, so that you shall soon be utterly wiped out because of your evildoing in forsaking Me.

content: 21 The LORD will make pestilence cling to you, until He has put an end to you in the land that you are entering to possess.
content_old: 21 The LORD will make pestilence cling to you, until He has put an end to you in the land that you are entering to possess.

content: 22 The LORD will strike you with consumption, fever, and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew; they shall hound you until you perish.
content_old: 22 The LORD will strike you with consumption, fever, and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew; they shall hound you until you perish.

content: 23 The skies above your head shall be copper and the earth under you iron.
content_old: 23 The skies above your head shall be copper and the earth under you iron.

content: 24 The LORD will make the rain of your land dust, and sand shall drop on you from the sky, until you are wiped out.
content_old: 24 The LORD will make the rain of your land dust, and sand shall drop on you from the sky, until you are wiped out.

content: 25 The LORD will put you to rout before your enemies; you shall march out against them by a single road, but flee from them by many roads; and you shall become a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
content_old: 25 The LORD will put you to rout before your enemies; you shall march out against them by a single road, but flee from them by many roads; and you shall become a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

content: 26 Your carcasses shall become food for all the birds of the sky and all the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.
content_old: 26 Your carcasses shall become food for all the birds of the sky and all the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.

content: 27 The LORD will strike you with the Egyptian inflammation, with hemorrhoids, boil-scars, and itch, from which you shall never recover.
content_old: 27 The LORD will strike you with the Egyptian inflammation, with hemorrhoids, boil-scars, and itch, from which you shall never recover.

content: 28 The LORD will strike you with madness, blindness, and dismay.
content_old: 28 The LORD will strike you with madness, blindness, and dismay.

content: 29 You shall grope at noon as a blind man gropes in the dark; you shall not prosper in your ventures, but shall be constantly abused and robbed, with none to give help.
content_old: 29 You shall grope at noon as a blind man gropes in the dark; you shall not prosper in your ventures, but shall be constantly abused and robbed, with none to give help.

content: 30 If you pay the bride-price for a wife, another man shall enjoy her. If you build a house, you shall not live in it. If you plant a vineyard, you shall not harvest it.
content_old: 30 If you pay the bride-price for a wife, another man shall enjoy her. If you build a house, you shall not live in it. If you plant a vineyard, you shall not harvest it.

content: 31 Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it; your ass shall be seized in front of you, and it shall not be returned to you; your flock shall be delivered to your enemies, with none to help you.
content_old: 31 Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it; your ass shall be seized in front of you, and it shall not be returned to you; your flock shall be delivered to your enemies, with none to help you.

content: 32 Your sons and daughters shall be delivered to another people, while you look on; and your eyes shall strain for them constantly, but you shall be helpless.
content_old: 32 Your sons and daughters shall be delivered to another people, while you look on; and your eyes shall strain for them constantly, but you shall be helpless.

content: 33 A people you do not know shall eat up the produce of your soil and all your gains; you shall be abused and downtrodden continually,
content_old: 33 A people you do not know shall eat up the produce of your soil and all your gains; you shall be abused and downtrodden continually,

content: 34 until you are driven mad by what your eyes behold.
content_old: 34 until you are driven mad by what your eyes behold.

content: 35 The LORD will afflict you at the knees and thighs with a severe inflammation, from which you shall never recover—from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.
content_old: 35 The LORD will afflict you at the knees and thighs with a severe inflammation, from which you shall never recover—from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.

content: 36 The LORD will drive you, and the king you have set over you, to a nation unknown to you or your fathers, where you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone.
content_old: 36 The LORD will drive you, and the king you have set over you, to a nation unknown to you or your fathers, where you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone.

content: 37 You shall be a consternation, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to which the LORD will drive you.
content_old: 37 You shall be a consternation, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to which the LORD will drive you.

content: 38 Though you take much seed out to the field, you shall gather in little, for the locust shall consume it.
content_old: 38 Though you take much seed out to the field, you shall gather in little, for the locust shall consume it.

content: 39 Though you plant vineyards and till them, you shall have no wine to drink or store, for the worm shall devour them.
content_old: 39 Though you plant vineyards and till them, you shall have no wine to drink or store, for the worm shall devour them.

content: 40 Though you have olive trees throughout your territory, you shall have no oil for anointment, for your olives shall drop off.
content_old: 40 Though you have olive trees throughout your territory, you shall have no oil for anointment, for your olives shall drop off.

content: 41 Though you beget sons and daughters, they shall not remain with you, for they shall go into captivity.
content_old: 41 Though you beget sons and daughters, they shall not remain with you, for they shall go into captivity.

content: 42 The cricket shall take over all the trees and produce of your land.
content_old: 42 The cricket shall take over all the trees and produce of your land.

content: 43 The stranger in your midst shall rise above you higher and higher, while you sink lower and lower:
content_old: 43 The stranger in your midst shall rise above you higher and higher, while you sink lower and lower:

content: 44 he shall be your creditor, but you shall not be his; he shall be the head and you the tail.
content_old: 44 he shall be your creditor, but you shall not be his; he shall be the head and you the tail.

content: 45 All these curses shall befall you; they shall pursue you and overtake you, until you are wiped out, because you did not heed the LORD your God and keep the commandments and laws that He enjoined upon you.
content_old: 45 All these curses shall befall you; they shall pursue you and overtake you, until you are wiped out, because you did not heed the LORD your God and keep the commandments and laws that He enjoined upon you.

content: 46 They shall serve as signs and proofs against you and your offspring for all time.
content_old: 46 They shall serve as signs and proofs against you and your offspring for all time.

content: 47 Because you would not serve the LORD your God in joy and gladness over the abundance of everything,
content_old: 47 Because you would not serve the LORD your God in joy and gladness over the abundance of everything,

content: 48 you shall have to serve—in hunger and thirst, naked and lacking everything—the enemies whom the LORD will let loose against you. He will put an iron yoke upon your neck until He has wiped you out.
content_old: 48 you shall have to serve—in hunger and thirst, naked and lacking everything—the enemies whom the LORD will let loose against you. He will put an iron yoke upon your neck until He has wiped you out.

content: 49 The LORD will bring a nation against you from afar, from the end of the earth, which will swoop down like the eagle—a nation whose language you do not understand,
content_old: 49 The LORD will bring a nation against you from afar, from the end of the earth, which will swoop down like the eagle—a nation whose language you do not understand,

content: 50 a ruthless nation, that will show the old no regard and the young no mercy.
content_old: 50 a ruthless nation, that will show the old no regard and the young no mercy.

content: 51 It shall devour the offspring of your cattle and the produce of your soil, until you have been wiped out, leaving you nothing of new grain, wine, or oil, of the calving of your herds and the lambing of your flocks, until it has brought you to ruin.
content_old: 51 It shall devour the offspring of your cattle and the produce of your soil, until you have been wiped out, leaving you nothing of new grain, wine, or oil, of the calving of your herds and the lambing of your flocks, until it has brought you to ruin.

content: 52 It shall shut you up in all your towns throughout your land until every mighty, towering wall in which you trust has come down. And when you are shut up in all your towns throughout your land that the LORD your God has assigned to you,
content_old: 52 It shall shut you up in all your towns throughout your land until every mighty, towering wall in which you trust has come down. And when you are shut up in all your towns throughout your land that the LORD your God has assigned to you,

content: 53 you shall eat your own issue, the flesh of your sons and daughters that the LORD your God has assigned to you, because of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you.
content_old: 53 you shall eat your own issue, the flesh of your sons and daughters that the LORD your God has assigned to you, because of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you.

content: 54 He who is most tender and fastidious among you shall be too mean to his brother and the wife of his bosom and the children he has spared
content_old: 54 He who is most tender and fastidious among you shall be too mean to his brother and the wife of his bosom and the children he has spared

content: 55 to share with any of them the flesh of the children that he eats, because he has nothing else left as a result of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in all your towns.
content_old: 55 to share with any of them the flesh of the children that he eats, because he has nothing else left as a result of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in all your towns.

content: 56 And she who is most tender and dainty among you, so tender and dainty that she would never venture to set a foot on the ground, shall begrudge the husband of her bosom, and her son and her daughter,
content_old: 56 And she who is most tender and dainty among you, so tender and dainty that she would never venture to set a foot on the ground, shall begrudge the husband of her bosom, and her son and her daughter,

content: 57 the afterbirth that issues from between her legs and the babies she bears; she shall eat them secretly, because of utter want, in the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in your towns.
content_old: 57 the afterbirth that issues from between her legs and the babies she bears; she shall eat them secretly, because of utter want, in the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in your towns.

content: 58 If you fail to observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching that are written in this book, to reverence this honored and awesome Name, the LORD your God,
content_old: 58 If you fail to observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching that are written in this book, to reverence this honored and awesome Name, the LORD your God,

content: 59 the LORD will inflict extraordinary plagues upon you and your offspring, strange and lasting plagues, malignant and chronic diseases.
content_old: 59 the LORD will inflict extraordinary plagues upon you and your offspring, strange and lasting plagues, malignant and chronic diseases.

content: 60 He will bring back upon you all the sicknesses of Egypt that you dreaded so, and they shall cling to you.
content_old: 60 He will bring back upon you all the sicknesses of Egypt that you dreaded so, and they shall cling to you.

content: 61 Moreover, the LORD will bring upon you all the other diseases and plagues that are not mentioned in this book of Teaching, until you are wiped out.
content_old: 61 Moreover, the LORD will bring upon you all the other diseases and plagues that are not mentioned in this book of Teaching, until you are wiped out.

content: 62 You shall be left a scant few, after having been as numerous as the stars in the skies, because you did not heed the command of the LORD your God.
content_old: 62 You shall be left a scant few, after having been as numerous as the stars in the skies, because you did not heed the command of the LORD your God.

content: 63 And as the LORD once delighted in making you prosperous and many, so will the LORD now delight in causing you to perish and in wiping you out; you shall be torn from the land that you are about to enter and possess.
content_old: 63 And as the LORD once delighted in making you prosperous and many, so will the LORD now delight in causing you to perish and in wiping you out; you shall be torn from the land that you are about to enter and possess.

content: 64 The LORD will scatter you among all the peoples from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, wood and stone, whom neither you nor your ancestors have experienced.
content_old: 64 The LORD will scatter you among all the peoples from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, wood and stone, whom neither you nor your ancestors have experienced.

content: 65 Yet even among those nations you shall find no peace, nor shall your foot find a place to rest. The LORD will give you there an anguished heart and eyes that pine and a despondent spirit.
content_old: 65 Yet even among those nations you shall find no peace, nor shall your foot find a place to rest. The LORD will give you there an anguished heart and eyes that pine and a despondent spirit.

content: 66 The life you face shall be precarious; you shall be in terror, night and day, with no assurance of survival.
content_old: 66 The life you face shall be precarious; you shall be in terror, night and day, with no assurance of survival.

content: 67 In the morning you shall say, “If only it were evening!” and in the evening you shall say, “If only it were morning!”—because of what your heart shall dread and your eyes shall see.
content_old: 67 In the morning you shall say, “If only it were evening!” and in the evening you shall say, “If only it were morning!”—because of what your heart shall dread and your eyes shall see.

content: 68 The LORD will send you back to Egypt in galleys, by a route which I told you you should not see again. There you shall offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but none will buy.
content_old: 68 The LORD will send you back to Egypt in galleys, by a route which I told you you should not see again. There you shall offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but none will buy.

content: 1 Moses summoned all Israel and said to them: You have seen all that the LORD did before your very eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his courtiers and to his whole country:
content_old: 1 Moses summoned all Israel and said to them: You have seen all that the LORD did before your very eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his courtiers and to his whole country:

content: 2 the wondrous feats that you saw with your own eyes, those prodigious signs and marvels.
content_old: 2 the wondrous feats that you saw with your own eyes, those prodigious signs and marvels.

content: 3 Yet to this day the LORD has not given you a mind to understand or eyes to see or ears to hear.
content_old: 3 Yet to this day the LORD has not given you a mind to understand or eyes to see or ears to hear.

content: 4 I led you through the wilderness forty years; the clothes on your back did not wear out, nor did the sandals on your feet;
content_old: 4 I led you through the wilderness forty years; the clothes on your back did not wear out, nor did the sandals on your feet;

content: 5 you had no bread to eat and no wine or other intoxicant to drink—that you might know that I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 5 you had no bread to eat and no wine or other intoxicant to drink—that you might know that I the LORD am your God.

content: 6 When you reached this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out to engage us in battle, but we defeated them.
content_old: 6 When you reached this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out to engage us in battle, but we defeated them.

content: 7 We took their land and gave it to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh as their heritage.
content_old: 7 We took their land and gave it to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh as their heritage.

content: 8 Therefore observe faithfully all the terms of this covenant, that you may succeed in all that you undertake.
content_old: 8 Therefore observe faithfully all the terms of this covenant, that you may succeed in all that you undertake.

content: 9 You stand this day, all of you, before the LORD your God—your tribal heads, your elders and your officials, all the men of Israel,
content_old: 9 You stand this day, all of you, before the LORD your God—your tribal heads, your elders and your officials, all the men of Israel,

content: 10 your children, your wives, even the stranger within your camp, from woodchopper to waterdrawer—
content_old: 10 your children, your wives, even the stranger within your camp, from woodchopper to waterdrawer—

content: 11 to enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, which the LORD your God is concluding with you this day, with its sanctions;
content_old: 11 to enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, which the LORD your God is concluding with you this day, with its sanctions;

content: 12 to the end that He may establish you this day as His people and be your God, as He promised you and as He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
content_old: 12 to the end that He may establish you this day as His people and be your God, as He promised you and as He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

content: 13 I make this covenant, with its sanctions, not with you alone,
content_old: 13 I make this covenant, with its sanctions, not with you alone,

content: 14 but both with those who are standing here with us this day before the LORD our God and with those who are not with us here this day.
content_old: 14 but both with those who are standing here with us this day before the LORD our God and with those who are not with us here this day.

content: 15 Well you know that we dwelt in the land of Egypt and that we passed through the midst of various other nations through which you passed;
content_old: 15 Well you know that we dwelt in the land of Egypt and that we passed through the midst of various other nations through which you passed;

content: 16 and you have seen the detestable things and the fetishes of wood and stone, silver and gold, that they keep.
content_old: 16 and you have seen the detestable things and the fetishes of wood and stone, silver and gold, that they keep.

content: 17 Perchance there is among you some man or woman, or some clan or tribe, whose heart is even now turning away from the LORD our God to go and worship the gods of those nations—perchance there is among you a stock sprouting poison weed and wormwood.
content_old: 17 Perchance there is among you some man or woman, or some clan or tribe, whose heart is even now turning away from the LORD our God to go and worship the gods of those nations—perchance there is among you a stock sprouting poison weed and wormwood.

content: 18 When such a one hears the words of these sanctions, he may fancy himself immune, thinking, “I shall be safe, though I follow my own willful heart”—to the utter ruin of moist and dry alike.
content_old: 18 When such a one hears the words of these sanctions, he may fancy himself immune, thinking, “I shall be safe, though I follow my own willful heart”—to the utter ruin of moist and dry alike.

content: 19 The LORD will never forgive him; rather will the LORD‘s anger and passion rage against that man, till every sanction recorded in this book comes down upon him, and the LORD blots out his name from under heaven.
content_old: 19 The LORD will never forgive him; rather will the LORD‘s anger and passion rage against that man, till every sanction recorded in this book comes down upon him, and the LORD blots out his name from under heaven.
