content: 20 The LORD will single them out from all the tribes of Israel for misfortune, in accordance with all the sanctions of the covenant recorded in this book of Teaching.
content_old: 20 The LORD will single them out from all the tribes of Israel for misfortune, in accordance with all the sanctions of the covenant recorded in this book of Teaching.

content: 21 And later generations will ask—the children who succeed you, and foreigners who come from distant lands and see the plagues and diseases that the LORD has inflicted upon that land,
content_old: 21 And later generations will ask—the children who succeed you, and foreigners who come from distant lands and see the plagues and diseases that the LORD has inflicted upon that land,

content: 22 all its soil devastated by sulfur and salt, beyond sowing and producing, no grass growing in it, just like the upheaval of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD overthrew in His fierce anger—
content_old: 22 all its soil devastated by sulfur and salt, beyond sowing and producing, no grass growing in it, just like the upheaval of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD overthrew in His fierce anger—

content: 23 all nations will ask, “Why did the LORD do thus to this land? Wherefore that awful wrath?”
content_old: 23 all nations will ask, “Why did the LORD do thus to this land? Wherefore that awful wrath?”

content: 24 They will be told, “Because they forsook the covenant that the LORD, God of their fathers, made with them when He freed them from the land of Egypt;
content_old: 24 They will be told, “Because they forsook the covenant that the LORD, God of their fathers, made with them when He freed them from the land of Egypt;

content: 25 they turned to the service of other gods and worshiped them, gods whom they had not experienced and whom He had not allotted to them.
content_old: 25 they turned to the service of other gods and worshiped them, gods whom they had not experienced and whom He had not allotted to them.

content: 26 So the LORD was incensed at that land and brought upon it all the curses recorded in this book.
content_old: 26 So the LORD was incensed at that land and brought upon it all the curses recorded in this book.

content: 27 The LORD uprooted them from their soil in anger, fury, and great wrath, and cast them into another land, as is still the case.”
content_old: 27 The LORD uprooted them from their soil in anger, fury, and great wrath, and cast them into another land, as is still the case.”

content: 1 When all these things befall you—the blessing and the curse that I have set before you—and you take them to heart amidst the various nations to which the LORD your God has banished you,
content_old: 1 When all these things befall you—the blessing and the curse that I have set before you—and you take them to heart amidst the various nations to which the LORD your God has banished you,

content: 2 and you return to the LORD your God, and you and your children heed His command with all your heart and soul, just as I enjoin upon you this day,
content_old: 2 and you return to the LORD your God, and you and your children heed His command with all your heart and soul, just as I enjoin upon you this day,

content: 3 then the LORD your God will restore your fortunes and take you back in love. He will bring you together again from all the peoples where the LORD your God has scattered you.
content_old: 3 then the LORD your God will restore your fortunes and take you back in love. He will bring you together again from all the peoples where the LORD your God has scattered you.

content: 4 Even if your outcasts are at the ends of the world, from there the LORD your God will gather you, from there He will fetch you.
content_old: 4 Even if your outcasts are at the ends of the world, from there the LORD your God will gather you, from there He will fetch you.

content: 5 And the LORD your God will bring you to the land that your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and He will make you more prosperous and more numerous than your fathers.
content_old: 5 And the LORD your God will bring you to the land that your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and He will make you more prosperous and more numerous than your fathers.

content: 6 Then the LORD your God will open up your heart and the hearts of your offspring to love the LORD your God with all your heart and soul, in order that you may live.
content_old: 6 Then the LORD your God will open up your heart and the hearts of your offspring to love the LORD your God with all your heart and soul, in order that you may live.

content: 7 The LORD your God will inflict all those curses upon the enemies and foes who persecuted you.
content_old: 7 The LORD your God will inflict all those curses upon the enemies and foes who persecuted you.

content: 8 You, however, will again heed the LORD and obey all His commandments that I enjoin upon you this day.
content_old: 8 You, however, will again heed the LORD and obey all His commandments that I enjoin upon you this day.

content: 9 And the LORD your God will grant you abounding prosperity in all your undertakings, in the issue of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil. For the LORD will again delight in your well-being, as He did in that of your fathers,
content_old: 9 And the LORD your God will grant you abounding prosperity in all your undertakings, in the issue of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil. For the LORD will again delight in your well-being, as He did in that of your fathers,

content: 10 since you will be heeding the LORD your God and keeping His commandments and laws that are recorded in this book of the Teaching—once you return to the LORD your God with all your heart and soul.
content_old: 10 since you will be heeding the LORD your God and keeping His commandments and laws that are recorded in this book of the Teaching—once you return to the LORD your God with all your heart and soul.

content: 11 Surely, this Instruction which I enjoin upon you this day is not too baffling for you, nor is it beyond reach.
content_old: 11 Surely, this Instruction which I enjoin upon you this day is not too baffling for you, nor is it beyond reach.

content: 12 It is not in the heavens, that you should say, “Who among us can go up to the heavens and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”
content_old: 12 It is not in the heavens, that you should say, “Who among us can go up to the heavens and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”

content: 13 Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, “Who among us can cross to the other side of the sea and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”
content_old: 13 Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, “Who among us can cross to the other side of the sea and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”

content: 14 No, the thing is very close to you, in your mouth and in your heart, to observe it.
content_old: 14 No, the thing is very close to you, in your mouth and in your heart, to observe it.

content: 15 See, I set before you this day life and prosperity, death and adversity.
content_old: 15 See, I set before you this day life and prosperity, death and adversity.

content: 16 For I command you this day, to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, His laws, and His rules, that you may thrive and increase, and that the LORD your God may bless you in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
content_old: 16 For I command you this day, to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, His laws, and His rules, that you may thrive and increase, and that the LORD your God may bless you in the land that you are about to enter and possess.

content: 17 But if your heart turns away and you give no heed, and are lured into the worship and service of other gods,
content_old: 17 But if your heart turns away and you give no heed, and are lured into the worship and service of other gods,

content: 18 I declare to you this day that you shall certainly perish; you shall not long endure on the soil that you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.
content_old: 18 I declare to you this day that you shall certainly perish; you shall not long endure on the soil that you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.

content: 19 I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day: I have put before you life and death, blessing and curse. Choose life—if you and your offspring would live—
content_old: 19 I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day: I have put before you life and death, blessing and curse. Choose life—if you and your offspring would live—

content: 1 Moses went and spoke these things to all Israel.
content_old: 1 Moses went and spoke these things to all Israel.

content: 2 He said to them: I am now one hundred and twenty years old, I can no longer be active. Moreover, the LORD has said to me, “You shall not go across yonder Jordan.”
content_old: 2 He said to them: I am now one hundred and twenty years old, I can no longer be active. Moreover, the LORD has said to me, “You shall not go across yonder Jordan.”

content: 3 The LORD your God Himself will cross over before you; and He Himself will wipe out those nations from your path and you shall dispossess them.—Joshua is the one who shall cross before you, as the LORD has spoken.—
content_old: 3 The LORD your God Himself will cross over before you; and He Himself will wipe out those nations from your path and you shall dispossess them.—Joshua is the one who shall cross before you, as the LORD has spoken.—

content: 4 The LORD will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, kings of the Amorites, and to their countries, when He wiped them out.
content_old: 4 The LORD will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, kings of the Amorites, and to their countries, when He wiped them out.

content: 5 The LORD will deliver them up to you, and you shall deal with them in full accordance with the Instruction that I have enjoined upon you.
content_old: 5 The LORD will deliver them up to you, and you shall deal with them in full accordance with the Instruction that I have enjoined upon you.

content: 6 Be strong and resolute, be not in fear or in dread of them; for the LORD your God Himself marches with you: He will not fail you or forsake you.
content_old: 6 Be strong and resolute, be not in fear or in dread of them; for the LORD your God Himself marches with you: He will not fail you or forsake you.

content: 7 Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel: “Be strong and resolute, for it is you who shall go with this people into the land that the LORD swore to their fathers to give them, and it is you who shall apportion it to them.
content_old: 7 Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel: “Be strong and resolute, for it is you who shall go with this people into the land that the LORD swore to their fathers to give them, and it is you who shall apportion it to them.

content: 8 And the LORD Himself will go before you. He will be with you; He will not fail you or forsake you. Fear not and be not dismayed!”
content_old: 8 And the LORD Himself will go before you. He will be with you; He will not fail you or forsake you. Fear not and be not dismayed!”

content: 9 Moses wrote down this Teaching and gave it to the priests, sons of Levi, who carried the Ark of the LORD‘s Covenant, and to all the elders of Israel.
content_old: 9 Moses wrote down this Teaching and gave it to the priests, sons of Levi, who carried the Ark of the LORD‘s Covenant, and to all the elders of Israel.

content: 10 And Moses instructed them as follows: Every seventh year, the year set for remission, at the Feast of Booths,
content_old: 10 And Moses instructed them as follows: Every seventh year, the year set for remission, at the Feast of Booths,

content: 11 when all Israel comes to appear before the LORD your God in the place that He will choose, you shall read this Teaching aloud in the presence of all Israel.
content_old: 11 when all Israel comes to appear before the LORD your God in the place that He will choose, you shall read this Teaching aloud in the presence of all Israel.

content: 12 Gather the people—men, women, children, and the strangers in your communities—that they may hear and so learn to revere the LORD your God and to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching.
content_old: 12 Gather the people—men, women, children, and the strangers in your communities—that they may hear and so learn to revere the LORD your God and to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching.

content: 13 Their children, too, who have not had the experience, shall hear and learn to revere the LORD your God as long as they live in the land that you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.
content_old: 13 Their children, too, who have not had the experience, shall hear and learn to revere the LORD your God as long as they live in the land that you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.

content: 14 The LORD said to Moses: The time is drawing near for you to die. Call Joshua and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting, that I may instruct him. Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 14 The LORD said to Moses: The time is drawing near for you to die. Call Joshua and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting, that I may instruct him. Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.

content: 15 The LORD appeared in the Tent, in a pillar of cloud, the pillar of cloud having come to rest at the entrance of the tent.
content_old: 15 The LORD appeared in the Tent, in a pillar of cloud, the pillar of cloud having come to rest at the entrance of the tent.

content: 16 The LORD said to Moses: You are soon to lie with your fathers. This people will thereupon go astray after the alien gods in their midst, in the land that they are about to enter; they will forsake Me and break My covenant that I made with them.
content_old: 16 The LORD said to Moses: You are soon to lie with your fathers. This people will thereupon go astray after the alien gods in their midst, in the land that they are about to enter; they will forsake Me and break My covenant that I made with them.

content: 17 Then My anger will flare up against them, and I will abandon them and hide My countenance from them. They shall be ready prey; and many evils and troubles shall befall them. And they shall say on that day, “Surely it is because our God is not in our midst that these evils have befallen us.”
content_old: 17 Then My anger will flare up against them, and I will abandon them and hide My countenance from them. They shall be ready prey; and many evils and troubles shall befall them. And they shall say on that day, “Surely it is because our God is not in our midst that these evils have befallen us.”

content: 18 Yet I will keep My countenance hidden on that day, because of all the evil they have done in turning to other gods.
content_old: 18 Yet I will keep My countenance hidden on that day, because of all the evil they have done in turning to other gods.

content: 19 Therefore, write down this poem and teach it to the people of Israel; put it in their mouths, in order that this poem may be My witness against the people of Israel.
content_old: 19 Therefore, write down this poem and teach it to the people of Israel; put it in their mouths, in order that this poem may be My witness against the people of Israel.

content: 20 When I bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey that I promised on oath to their fathers, and they eat their fill and grow fat and turn to other gods and serve them, spurning Me and breaking My covenant,
content_old: 20 When I bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey that I promised on oath to their fathers, and they eat their fill and grow fat and turn to other gods and serve them, spurning Me and breaking My covenant,

content: 21 and the many evils and troubles befall them—then this poem shall confront them as a witness, since it will never be lost from the mouth of their offspring. For I know what plans they are devising even now, before I bring them into the land that I promised on oath.
content_old: 21 and the many evils and troubles befall them—then this poem shall confront them as a witness, since it will never be lost from the mouth of their offspring. For I know what plans they are devising even now, before I bring them into the land that I promised on oath.

content: 22 That day, Moses wrote down this poem and taught it to the Israelites.
content_old: 22 That day, Moses wrote down this poem and taught it to the Israelites.

content: 23 And He charged Joshua son of Nun: “Be strong and resolute: for you shall bring the Israelites into the land that I promised them on oath, and I will be with you.”
content_old: 23 And He charged Joshua son of Nun: “Be strong and resolute: for you shall bring the Israelites into the land that I promised them on oath, and I will be with you.”

content: 24 When Moses had put down in writing the words of this Teaching to the very end,
content_old: 24 When Moses had put down in writing the words of this Teaching to the very end,

content: 25 Moses charged the Levites who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD, saying:
content_old: 25 Moses charged the Levites who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD, saying:

content: 26 Take this book of Teaching and place it beside the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD your God, and let it remain there as a witness against you.
content_old: 26 Take this book of Teaching and place it beside the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD your God, and let it remain there as a witness against you.

content: 27 Well I know how defiant and stiffnecked you are: even now, while I am still alive in your midst, you have been defiant toward the LORD; how much more, then, when I am dead!
content_old: 27 Well I know how defiant and stiffnecked you are: even now, while I am still alive in your midst, you have been defiant toward the LORD; how much more, then, when I am dead!

content: 28 Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, that I may speak all these words to them and that I may call heaven and earth to witness against them.
content_old: 28 Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, that I may speak all these words to them and that I may call heaven and earth to witness against them.

content: 29 For I know that, when I am dead, you will act wickedly and turn away from the path that I enjoined upon you, and that in time to come misfortune will befall you for having done evil in the sight of the LORD and vexed Him by your deeds.
content_old: 29 For I know that, when I am dead, you will act wickedly and turn away from the path that I enjoined upon you, and that in time to come misfortune will befall you for having done evil in the sight of the LORD and vexed Him by your deeds.

content: 1 Give ear, O heavens, let me speak; Let the earth hear the words I utter!
content_old: 1 Give ear, O heavens, let me speak; Let the earth hear the words I utter!

content: 2 May my discourse come down as the rain, My speech distill as the dew, Like showers on young growth, Like droplets on the grass.
content_old: 2 May my discourse come down as the rain, My speech distill as the dew, Like showers on young growth, Like droplets on the grass.

content: 3 For the name of the LORD I proclaim; Give glory to our God!
content_old: 3 For the name of the LORD I proclaim; Give glory to our God!

content: 4 The Rock!—His deeds are perfect, Yea, all His ways are just; A faithful God, never false, True and upright is He.
content_old: 4 The Rock!—His deeds are perfect, Yea, all His ways are just; A faithful God, never false, True and upright is He.

content: 5 Children unworthy of Him— That crooked, perverse generation— Their baseness has played Him false.
content_old: 5 Children unworthy of Him— That crooked, perverse generation— Their baseness has played Him false.

content: 6 Do you thus requite the LORD, O dull and witless people? Is not He the Father who created you, Fashioned you and made you endure!
content_old: 6 Do you thus requite the LORD, O dull and witless people? Is not He the Father who created you, Fashioned you and made you endure!

content: 7 Remember the days of old, Consider the years of ages past; Ask your father, he will inform you, Your elders, they will tell you:
content_old: 7 Remember the days of old, Consider the years of ages past; Ask your father, he will inform you, Your elders, they will tell you:

content: 8 When the Most High gave nations their homes And set the divisions of man, He fixed the boundaries of peoples In relation to Israel’s numbers.
content_old: 8 When the Most High gave nations their homes And set the divisions of man, He fixed the boundaries of peoples In relation to Israel’s numbers.

content: 9 For the LORD‘s portion is His people, Jacob His own allotment.
content_old: 9 For the LORD‘s portion is His people, Jacob His own allotment.

content: 10 He found him in a desert region, In an empty howling waste. He engirded him, watched over him, Guarded him as the pupil of His eye.
content_old: 10 He found him in a desert region, In an empty howling waste. He engirded him, watched over him, Guarded him as the pupil of His eye.

content: 11 Like an eagle who rouses his nestlings, Gliding down to his young, So did He spread His wings and take him, Bear him along on His pinions;
content_old: 11 Like an eagle who rouses his nestlings, Gliding down to his young, So did He spread His wings and take him, Bear him along on His pinions;

content: 12 The LORD alone did guide him, No alien god at His side.
content_old: 12 The LORD alone did guide him, No alien god at His side.

content: 13 He set him atop the highlands, To feast on the yield of the earth; He fed him honey from the crag, And oil from the flinty rock,
content_old: 13 He set him atop the highlands, To feast on the yield of the earth; He fed him honey from the crag, And oil from the flinty rock,

content: 14 Curd of kine and milk of flocks; With the best of lambs, And rams of Bashan, and he-goats; With the very finest wheat— And foaming grape-blood was your drink.
content_old: 14 Curd of kine and milk of flocks; With the best of lambs, And rams of Bashan, and he-goats; With the very finest wheat— And foaming grape-blood was your drink.

content: 15 So Jeshurun grew fat and kicked— You grew fat and gross and coarse— He forsook the God who made him And spurned the Rock of his support.
content_old: 15 So Jeshurun grew fat and kicked— You grew fat and gross and coarse— He forsook the God who made him And spurned the Rock of his support.

content: 16 They incensed Him with alien things, Vexed Him with abominations.
content_old: 16 They incensed Him with alien things, Vexed Him with abominations.

content: 17 They sacrificed to demons, no-gods, Gods they had never known, New ones, who came but lately, Who stirred not your fathers’ fears.
content_old: 17 They sacrificed to demons, no-gods, Gods they had never known, New ones, who came but lately, Who stirred not your fathers’ fears.

content: 18 You neglected the Rock that begot you, Forgot the God who brought you forth.
content_old: 18 You neglected the Rock that begot you, Forgot the God who brought you forth.

content: 19 The LORD saw and was vexed And spurned His sons and His daughters.
content_old: 19 The LORD saw and was vexed And spurned His sons and His daughters.

content: 20 He said: I will hide My countenance from them, And see how they fare in the end. For they are a treacherous breed, Children with no loyalty in them.
content_old: 20 He said: I will hide My countenance from them, And see how they fare in the end. For they are a treacherous breed, Children with no loyalty in them.

content: 21 They incensed Me with no-gods, Vexed Me with their futilities; I’ll incense them with a no-folk, Vex them with a nation of fools.
content_old: 21 They incensed Me with no-gods, Vexed Me with their futilities; I’ll incense them with a no-folk, Vex them with a nation of fools.

content: 22 For a fire has flared in My wrath And burned to the bottom of Sheol, Has consumed the earth and its increase, Eaten down to the base of the hills.
content_old: 22 For a fire has flared in My wrath And burned to the bottom of Sheol, Has consumed the earth and its increase, Eaten down to the base of the hills.

content: 23 I will sweep misfortunes on them, Use up My arrows on them:
content_old: 23 I will sweep misfortunes on them, Use up My arrows on them:

content: 24 Wasting famine, ravaging plague, Deadly pestilence, and fanged beasts Will I let loose against them, With venomous creepers in dust.
content_old: 24 Wasting famine, ravaging plague, Deadly pestilence, and fanged beasts Will I let loose against them, With venomous creepers in dust.

content: 25 The sword shall deal death without, As shall the terror within, To youth and maiden alike, The suckling as well as the aged.
content_old: 25 The sword shall deal death without, As shall the terror within, To youth and maiden alike, The suckling as well as the aged.

content: 26 I might have reduced them to naught, Made their memory cease among men,
content_old: 26 I might have reduced them to naught, Made their memory cease among men,

content: 27 But for fear of the taunts of the foe, Their enemies who might misjudge And say, “Our own hand has prevailed; None of this was wrought by the LORD!”
content_old: 27 But for fear of the taunts of the foe, Their enemies who might misjudge And say, “Our own hand has prevailed; None of this was wrought by the LORD!”

content: 28 For they are a folk void of sense, Lacking in all discernment.
content_old: 28 For they are a folk void of sense, Lacking in all discernment.

content: 29 Were they wise, they would think upon this, Gain insight into their future:
content_old: 29 Were they wise, they would think upon this, Gain insight into their future:

content: 30 “How could one have routed a thousand, Or two put ten thousand to flight, Unless their Rock had sold them, The LORD had given them up?”
content_old: 30 “How could one have routed a thousand, Or two put ten thousand to flight, Unless their Rock had sold them, The LORD had given them up?”

content: 31 For their rock is not like our Rock, In our enemies’ own estimation.
content_old: 31 For their rock is not like our Rock, In our enemies’ own estimation.

content: 32 Ah! The vine for them is from Sodom, From the vineyards of Gomorrah; The grapes for them are poison, A bitter growth their clusters.
content_old: 32 Ah! The vine for them is from Sodom, From the vineyards of Gomorrah; The grapes for them are poison, A bitter growth their clusters.

content: 33 Their wine is the venom of asps, The pitiless poison of vipers.
content_old: 33 Their wine is the venom of asps, The pitiless poison of vipers.

content: 34 Lo, I have it all put away, Sealed up in My storehouses,
content_old: 34 Lo, I have it all put away, Sealed up in My storehouses,

content: 35 To be My vengeance and recompense, At the time that their foot falters. Yea, their day of disaster is near, And destiny rushes upon them.
content_old: 35 To be My vengeance and recompense, At the time that their foot falters. Yea, their day of disaster is near, And destiny rushes upon them.

content: 36 For the LORD will vindicate His people And take revenge for His servants, When He sees that their might is gone, And neither bond nor free is left.
content_old: 36 For the LORD will vindicate His people And take revenge for His servants, When He sees that their might is gone, And neither bond nor free is left.

content: 37 He will say: Where are their gods, The rock in whom they sought refuge,
content_old: 37 He will say: Where are their gods, The rock in whom they sought refuge,

content: 38 Who ate the fat of their offerings And drank their libation wine? Let them rise up to your help, And let them be a shield unto you!
content_old: 38 Who ate the fat of their offerings And drank their libation wine? Let them rise up to your help, And let them be a shield unto you!

content: 39 See, then, that I, I am He; There is no god beside Me. I deal death and give life; I wounded and I will heal: None can deliver from My hand.
content_old: 39 See, then, that I, I am He; There is no god beside Me. I deal death and give life; I wounded and I will heal: None can deliver from My hand.

content: 40 Lo, I raise My hand to heaven And say: As I live forever,
content_old: 40 Lo, I raise My hand to heaven And say: As I live forever,

content: 41 When I whet My flashing blade And My hand lays hold on judgment, Vengeance will I wreak on My foes, Will I deal to those who reject Me.
content_old: 41 When I whet My flashing blade And My hand lays hold on judgment, Vengeance will I wreak on My foes, Will I deal to those who reject Me.

content: 42 I will make My arrows drunk with blood— As My sword devours flesh— Blood of the slain and the captive From the long-haired enemy chiefs.
content_old: 42 I will make My arrows drunk with blood— As My sword devours flesh— Blood of the slain and the captive From the long-haired enemy chiefs.

content: 43 O nations, acclaim His people! For He’ll avenge the blood of His servants, Wreak vengeance on His foes, And cleanse the land of His people.
content_old: 43 O nations, acclaim His people! For He’ll avenge the blood of His servants, Wreak vengeance on His foes, And cleanse the land of His people.

content: 44 Moses came, together with Hosea son of Nun, and recited all the words of this poem in the hearing of the people.
content_old: 44 Moses came, together with Hosea son of Nun, and recited all the words of this poem in the hearing of the people.

content: 45 And when Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel,
content_old: 45 And when Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel,

content: 46 he said to them: Take to heart all the words with which I have warned you this day. Enjoin them upon your children, that they may observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching.
content_old: 46 he said to them: Take to heart all the words with which I have warned you this day. Enjoin them upon your children, that they may observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching.

content: 47 For this is not a trifling thing for you: it is your very life; through it you shall long endure on the land that you are to possess upon crossing the Jordan.
content_old: 47 For this is not a trifling thing for you: it is your very life; through it you shall long endure on the land that you are to possess upon crossing the Jordan.

content: 48 That very day the LORD spoke to Moses:
content_old: 48 That very day the LORD spoke to Moses:

content: 49 Ascend these heights of Abarim to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab facing Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving the Israelites as their holding.
content_old: 49 Ascend these heights of Abarim to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab facing Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving the Israelites as their holding.

content: 50 You shall die on the mountain that you are about to ascend, and shall be gathered to your kin, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his kin;
content_old: 50 You shall die on the mountain that you are about to ascend, and shall be gathered to your kin, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his kin;

content: 51 for you both broke faith with Me among the Israelite people, at the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin, by failing to uphold My sanctity among the Israelite people.
content_old: 51 for you both broke faith with Me among the Israelite people, at the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin, by failing to uphold My sanctity among the Israelite people.

content: 1 This is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, bade the Israelites farewell before he died.
content_old: 1 This is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, bade the Israelites farewell before he died.

content: 2 He said: The LORD came from Sinai; He shone upon them from Seir; He appeared from Mount Paran, And approached from Ribeboth-kodesh, Lightning flashing at them from His right.
content_old: 2 He said: The LORD came from Sinai; He shone upon them from Seir; He appeared from Mount Paran, And approached from Ribeboth-kodesh, Lightning flashing at them from His right.

content: 3 Lover, indeed, of the people, Their hallowed are all in Your hand. They followed in Your steps, Accepting Your pronouncements,
content_old: 3 Lover, indeed, of the people, Their hallowed are all in Your hand. They followed in Your steps, Accepting Your pronouncements,

content: 4 When Moses charged us with the Teaching As the heritage of the congregation of Jacob.
content_old: 4 When Moses charged us with the Teaching As the heritage of the congregation of Jacob.

content: 5 Then He became King in Jeshurun, When the heads of the people assembled, The tribes of Israel together.
content_old: 5 Then He became King in Jeshurun, When the heads of the people assembled, The tribes of Israel together.

content: 6 May Reuben live and not die, Though few be his numbers.
content_old: 6 May Reuben live and not die, Though few be his numbers.

content: 7 And this he said of Judah: Hear, O LORD the voice of Judah And restore him to his people. Though his own hands strive for him, Help him against his foes.
content_old: 7 And this he said of Judah: Hear, O LORD the voice of Judah And restore him to his people. Though his own hands strive for him, Help him against his foes.

content: 8 And of Levi he said: Let Your Thummim and Urim Be with Your faithful one, Whom You tested at Massah, Challenged at the waters of Meribah;
content_old: 8 And of Levi he said: Let Your Thummim and Urim Be with Your faithful one, Whom You tested at Massah, Challenged at the waters of Meribah;

content: 9 Who said of his father and mother, “I consider them not.” His brothers he disregarded, Ignored his own children. Your precepts alone they observed, And kept Your covenant.
content_old: 9 Who said of his father and mother, “I consider them not.” His brothers he disregarded, Ignored his own children. Your precepts alone they observed, And kept Your covenant.

content: 10 They shall teach Your laws to Jacob And Your instructions to Israel. They shall offer You incense to savor And whole-offerings on Your altar.
content_old: 10 They shall teach Your laws to Jacob And Your instructions to Israel. They shall offer You incense to savor And whole-offerings on Your altar.

content: 11 Bless, O LORD, his substance, And favor his undertakings. Smite the loins of his foes; Let his enemies rise no more.
content_old: 11 Bless, O LORD, his substance, And favor his undertakings. Smite the loins of his foes; Let his enemies rise no more.

content: 12 Of Benjamin he said: Beloved of the LORD, He rests securely beside Him; Ever does He protect him, As he rests between His shoulders.
content_old: 12 Of Benjamin he said: Beloved of the LORD, He rests securely beside Him; Ever does He protect him, As he rests between His shoulders.

content: 13 And of Joseph he said: Blessed of the LORD be his land With the bounty of dew from heaven, And of the deep that couches below;
content_old: 13 And of Joseph he said: Blessed of the LORD be his land With the bounty of dew from heaven, And of the deep that couches below;

content: 14 With the bounteous yield of the sun, And the bounteous crop of the moons;
content_old: 14 With the bounteous yield of the sun, And the bounteous crop of the moons;

content: 15 With the best from the ancient mountains, And the bounty of hills immemorial;
content_old: 15 With the best from the ancient mountains, And the bounty of hills immemorial;

content: 16 With the bounty of earth and its fullness, And the favor of the Presence in the Bush. May these rest on the head of Joseph, On the crown of the elect of his brothers.
content_old: 16 With the bounty of earth and its fullness, And the favor of the Presence in the Bush. May these rest on the head of Joseph, On the crown of the elect of his brothers.

content: 17 Like a firstling bull in his majesty, He has thorns like the horns of the wild-ox; With them he gores the peoples, The ends of the earth one and all. These are the myriads of Ephraim, Those are the thousands of Manasseh.
content_old: 17 Like a firstling bull in his majesty, He has thorns like the horns of the wild-ox; With them he gores the peoples, The ends of the earth one and all. These are the myriads of Ephraim, Those are the thousands of Manasseh.

content: 18 And of Zebulun he said: Rejoice, O Zebulun, on your journeys, And Issachar, in your tents.
content_old: 18 And of Zebulun he said: Rejoice, O Zebulun, on your journeys, And Issachar, in your tents.

content: 19 They invite their kin to the mountain, Where they offer sacrifices of success. For they draw from the riches of the sea And the hidden hoards of the sand.
content_old: 19 They invite their kin to the mountain, Where they offer sacrifices of success. For they draw from the riches of the sea And the hidden hoards of the sand.

content: 20 And of Gad he said: Blessed be He who enlarges Gad! Poised is he like a lion To tear off arm and scalp.
content_old: 20 And of Gad he said: Blessed be He who enlarges Gad! Poised is he like a lion To tear off arm and scalp.

content: 21 He chose for himself the best, For there is the portion of the revered chieftain, Where the heads of the people come. He executed the LORD‘s judgments And His decisions for Israel.
content_old: 21 He chose for himself the best, For there is the portion of the revered chieftain, Where the heads of the people come. He executed the LORD‘s judgments And His decisions for Israel.

content: 22 And of Dan he said: Dan is a lion’s whelp That leaps forth from Bashan.
content_old: 22 And of Dan he said: Dan is a lion’s whelp That leaps forth from Bashan.

content: 23 And of Naphtali he said: O Naphtali, sated with favor And full of the LORD‘s blessing, Take possession on the west and south.
content_old: 23 And of Naphtali he said: O Naphtali, sated with favor And full of the LORD‘s blessing, Take possession on the west and south.

content: 24 And of Asher he said: Most blessed of sons be Asher; May he be the favorite of his brothers, May he dip his foot in oil.
content_old: 24 And of Asher he said: Most blessed of sons be Asher; May he be the favorite of his brothers, May he dip his foot in oil.

content: 25 May your doorbolts be iron and copper, And your security last all your days.
content_old: 25 May your doorbolts be iron and copper, And your security last all your days.

content: 26 O Jeshurun, there is none like God, Riding through the heavens to help you, Through the skies in His majesty.
content_old: 26 O Jeshurun, there is none like God, Riding through the heavens to help you, Through the skies in His majesty.

content: 27 The ancient God is a refuge, A support are the arms everlasting. He drove out the enemy before you By His command: Destroy!
content_old: 27 The ancient God is a refuge, A support are the arms everlasting. He drove out the enemy before you By His command: Destroy!

content: 28 Thus Israel dwells in safety, Untroubled is Jacob’s abode, In a land of grain and wine, Under heavens dripping dew.
content_old: 28 Thus Israel dwells in safety, Untroubled is Jacob’s abode, In a land of grain and wine, Under heavens dripping dew.

content: 1 Moses went up from the steppes of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the summit of Pisgah, opposite Jericho, and the LORD showed him the whole land: Gilead as far as Dan;
content_old: 1 Moses went up from the steppes of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the summit of Pisgah, opposite Jericho, and the LORD showed him the whole land: Gilead as far as Dan;

content: 2 all Naphtali; the land of Ephraim and Manasseh; the whole land of Judah as far as the Western Sea;
content_old: 2 all Naphtali; the land of Ephraim and Manasseh; the whole land of Judah as far as the Western Sea;

content: 3 the Negeb; and the Plain—the Valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees—as far as Zoar.
content_old: 3 the Negeb; and the Plain—the Valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees—as far as Zoar.

content: 4 And the LORD said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, ‘I will assign it to your offspring.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you shall not cross there.”
content_old: 4 And the LORD said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, ‘I will assign it to your offspring.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you shall not cross there.”

content: 5 So Moses the servant of the LORD died there, in the land of Moab, at the command of the LORD.
content_old: 5 So Moses the servant of the LORD died there, in the land of Moab, at the command of the LORD.

content: 6 He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab, near Beth-peor; and no one knows his burial place to this day.
content_old: 6 He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab, near Beth-peor; and no one knows his burial place to this day.

content: 7 Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died; his eyes were undimmed and his vigor unabated.
content_old: 7 Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died; his eyes were undimmed and his vigor unabated.

content: 8 And the Israelites bewailed Moses in the steppes of Moab for thirty days. The period of wailing and mourning for Moses came to an end.
content_old: 8 And the Israelites bewailed Moses in the steppes of Moab for thirty days. The period of wailing and mourning for Moses came to an end.

content: 9 Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands upon him; and the Israelites heeded him, doing as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 9 Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands upon him; and the Israelites heeded him, doing as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 10 Never again did there arise in Israel a prophet like Moses—whom the LORD singled out, face to face,
content_old: 10 Never again did there arise in Israel a prophet like Moses—whom the LORD singled out, face to face,

content: 11 for the various signs and portents that the LORD sent him to display in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his courtiers and his whole country,
content_old: 11 for the various signs and portents that the LORD sent him to display in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his courtiers and his whole country,
